Title: About the Polish -Kraby- near Pokrovsk, interaction with the 117th brigade and Russian stormtroopers...
Description: Correspondents of ArmiyaInform managed to visit one of the control points of the 157th brigade and record an interview with the deputy commander of the 3rd mechanized battalion Artem with the call sign -Historik-. A man from the Poltava region voluntarily mobilized at the beginning of the large-scale invasion of the Russian Federation. Got into the 53rd brigade as an ordinary soldier. He led a platoon near Vugledar, where he was severely wounded by shrapnel from a tank shell. He went through a long treatment and recovery. He received the rank of officer in Odessa following an accelerated training course, because he had a higher education. After the formation of the 157th brigade, he was offered a position there. Artem talked about the combat situation, the enemy's tactics near Pokrovsk, how many enemy attack aircraft our infantrymen manage to destroy in a day, about the battle with Russian -ssoshniks-, which units of the Russian army are the most difficult to fight, and also about what the Rashists tell when they are captured. - Artem, tell us about the daily difficult tasks performed by the infantrymen in your unit's area of ​​responsibility. - Currently, the 3rd mechanized battalion is performing defensive tasks. In some places, there can be maneuver defense, and we also carry out assault actions. We storm the enemy, repulse his positions, improve our tactical position. It cannot be said that this is some dull defense or an attack. That is, the situation on the battlefield, I would say, is floating and rapidly changing. Everything, of course, depends on the combat situation. - What are the advantages of maneuverable defense? - They consist in the fact that we can withdraw a little, free some space for the enemy to enter. What is it for? For example, the enemy enters there in the evening, and we come in the morning and storm this position. The enemy either surrenders or we destroy him. That is, how it works: we leave the enemy a place, he thinks he is entering new positions, occupies them, but in fact he walks into our trap. Because we either undermine these positions or leave certain secrets in order to restore them again later. That is, our first task in defense is to inflict maximum losses on the enemy, which we are now coping with, which is confirmed by objective monitoring of destroyed enemies. - A bit about statistics. How many enemies can be destroyed in a day? - It happens differently. It can be from three to 15 people. Now the enemy is constantly storming. And if, for example, there is such a situation that today two means of fire work against the enemy, then tomorrow more may already work. And it depends on how many enemies we destroy, so the number of forces involved is important. After all, the first priority for us is to use firearms and protect people. People are the most important and ultimate trump card going into battle. - What exactly are the weapons of fire used by your unit to destroy the Russians? - Unmanned systems. In addition, Western models of weapons, for example, MK-19, show themselves quite well. This is an analogue of the AGS-17, an automatic grenade launcher plus mortars show themselves well. Engineers also do a great job. That is, these are mine barriers, the creation of obstacles, for example, -jagoza-, which makes it difficult for the enemy to move, and we can direct him into our -channel-. We can even involve a UAV that drops a piece of -yagoza- into a trench or somewhere else. What is a -jagoza-? This is such a twisted barbed wire, where a grenade is attached to the trigger in the middle. And when this piece of -jagoza- is dropped, the grenade explodes and it unravels. Then it is already difficult to pass the enemy in a certain area. And taking into account the fact that the main roads and logistics in the fields are outlined by the presence of forest plantations, these actions force the enemy to go out into the open. This helps a lot on the front end. — Are drones, -efpivishki- already connected? —Yes. In some cases, if the assault is more or less massive, artillery can be connected. These are, for example, self-propelled artillery installations of the KRAB type. Of course, FPV drones and drones with resets, without them there is no way. We can also involve neighbors' firearms. For example, we currently have a very close interaction with the 117th separate heavy mechanized brigade. They engage their firepower in tandem with ours. On the other hand, if we need more firepower to suppress the enemy, they are happy to join in immediately. Such interaction helps to destroy the enemy more effectively and faster. There are no dividing lines, everyone understands that today is bad for you and tomorrow will be bad for me. Therefore, there is full interaction. —Small assault groups, how does the enemy use them near Pokrovsk? — The enemy has been using small assault groups for a long time. The offensives, both chaotic and not, are fairly well organized. For example, today we are being stormed by a separate motorized rifle company of Rashists, it is divided into groups. Lately, the enemy has been trying very hard to penetrate our defenses, but nothing has come of it. In addition to ordinary infantrymen, even units of special operations forces of the Russian Federation took part in the campaign. This was objectively captured by drones. These were groups of 4-5 people who are equipped with binocular night vision devices and who attack at once from two directions. How do they work? They need to capture a certain point that is on the map, it is key. dashers deal a diversionary strike on a primary point, and can land a primary strike on a secondary point. And the enemy thinks that he will distract us with his actions and come from a completely different direction. But the Russians have already tried this more than once, but it does not work and will not work. Some absolutely absurd situations happen. It even got to the point that the enemy sent people without weapons, body armor and helmets into the attack. At first, they concentrated themselves on the positions in the forest strip and tried to simply move forward. It was a group of eight people, we destroyed them with heavy bombers -Vampire-. Although if we had known that they were unarmed, we would have simply captured them. The thing is that at that time it was not very clear in the landing what kind of weapons they had and what they had. But even after the first bomb drop from -Vampire- it was clear that these people did not understand what was happening at all. There is such a concept that people have not even learned to be afraid. So we completely destroyed them all there and, to be honest, we were a little surprised. But, according to Russian prisoners of war, such tactics are practiced by the enemy. For example, a person refuses to go to a position. At first, she is physically and morally -processed- somewhere in the basement. And then she still goes to our positions, but without anything. This is simply to -illuminate- the fire point or distract our main fire means while some other fire group does its work. —Regarding prisoners of war of the Russian Federation. Who are these people, from which units? What do they say? -We captured servicemen of the 5th and 110th motorized rifle brigades, various separate battalions, Storm-Z units, etc. Our battalion took about 15 Russian prisoners of war directly in this area where we are now standing. If you divide them into social strata, then, in general, they are different people. But the vast majority are those who were threatened with prison terms or who were already in Russian prisons. For example, there was a prisoner from Krasnoyarsk, a soldier of the Russian Federation from the 5th brigade. He is 61 years old, he did not serve two years for the murder of his own son and decided to go to war. — did the Rashists come to the colony and incite him? —He himself wanted to go to fight. There were also prisoners from the temporarily occupied Yasynuvat district of the Donetsk region. Mobilized. One boy was 21-22 years old. You ask him: how old were you in 2014, he says, 10 or 11 years old. That is, you already understand for yourself that the generation in the occupied territories has already grown up. And already consciously or maybe unconsciously, with weapons in their hands, they are going to fight against us. But he had another story - the threat of prison time. And the RF system always offers a choice. Either-or. So they go. There were also representatives of various regions of the Russian Federation: Siberia, Krasnoyarsk, Kemerovo, Stavropol. They come in -packs-, and you understand who is from which region. —Who is currently the most skilled and combat-capable of the Russian units? Who is it difficult to fight? -The most skilled are the line units of the Russian army, contract workers who have been serving for a long time. And, of course, these are special operations forces. But they did not always show themselves from the best side. We had a case: a night assault was going on, all Russian military personnel have expensive and high-quality equipment for conducting combat operations at night, etc. Yes, they stormed our trenches. And Russian special forces in the number of 7 people thought that they had caught our guys by surprise, but it turned out a little differently. And when we flew in -Mavik- with a thermal camera to see what and how there is. Our guys already chased these Katsap -ssoshniks- around the trenches so much that they didn't know what to do with them. They only did what they shouted - -Surrender, we are Russian spetsnaz.- And our guys answered: -We are Ukrainian tractor drivers. And today we are -bumping- on you. Fought to the last. Unfortunately, some soldiers were injured, but in general they fought back and held back the invaders. For such cases, we always have a reserve that can come to the rescue. Ours jumped into the trenches, and there, accordingly, tied up the occupiers with a fight, until the -Vampire- flew up with big bombs - and our bomber then simply gave these -suckers- hell. In our area, the enemy is trying to break through in various ways. For example, with the involvement of technology. Of course, it is less here, because even according to the words of the Russian prisoners themselves, logistics in them suffers greatly. They, from Ocheretyn, go to their positions on foot. They tried a mechanized assault once, but we planted anti-tank mines early and that was the end of it. I did not observe other methods of using mechanized assaults. This was a one-time promotion. —What about the use of motorcycles, buggies, etc.? —Yes, they do, but it is in my area, and this is confirmed by the words of Russian prisoners that they walk. They are simply given the order to go and go. Or, for example, it happens like this, the Rashists storm, we inflict fire damage, they retreat. And even then we watch how the occupiers move 400-500 meters away, and then their walkie-talkie -breaks- and they turn around and go back. - The prisoners themselves say: either to storm or die - there is no choice? - Yes. Most often, those who understand everything themselves are captured. There were cases when enemies simply killed themselves with a weapon or blew themselves up with a grenade. Somehow there was a situation, we discovered the enemy's positions, then there was a shelter in a forest plantation. We -ironed- them with -Vampires- all night, after that one live raschist got out and surrendered. It is not known if there were any more wounded, no one else came out. So, we were thinking of taking this one rashist prisoner, but we didn't have time. The Russians killed him with a drop from a drone. They shot right at him, although he was whole and unharmed. That is, they took the life of their own soldier. —How do you manage to capture the Russians? — There are also people sitting in the positions. And they have a rather difficult morale. When I talk to a prisoner and ask: -How many of your people are sitting there?- He says, -12 people.- I ask if they will surrender. The occupier says that 10 people will give up like that and 2 won't. I say, why not two? He answers because they are ideological, in the Russian army since 2014, their main task is to -hold- the situation in position so that others do not surrender. Therefore, as an option, we use Russian prisoners so that they convince -their- soldiers to voluntarily surrender to captivity, that they have a chance to survive, to keep their lives, that such a chance will no longer exist, that the Russians will die during the assaults or that their commanders will shoot them. And it works. First of all, such tactics save the lives of our servicemen, why go into battle, suffer losses, get wounded, if you can force them to leave calmly and surrender. Especially since the firing position itself is not destroyed and can be occupied. - What can you tell us about the positions of the Russians, how they are arranged, their daily life, etc.? -Their daily life boils down to one thing, how they live somewhere in -Khrushchevka-, where, sorry, everything is planted, the same way they behave in the positions. The only thing worth noting is the pattern of Russian officers. For example, if they make a position for a mortar somewhere in the rear, it will be equipped -according to the last letter of the book.- And there will be people who will do this work. Again, they have more manpower to set up a mortar position, because a lot of earth cubes have to be thrown away. As well as doing the appropriate work to properly disguise this position, and they have the resources to do so. They don't use tractors, they have people for that. - the Kremlin has always been spitting on people. - Yes, even -interceptions- show the attitude. For example, if the Russians dig something there and complain that they have neither water nor food. They are answered: if you do not dig so much, you will not be given water or food, and you will not be changed here at all. This often happened near Avdiivka. And so, they, like obedient slaves, wave a pickaxe and everything is fine. When we allow Russian prisoners to call their relatives in the Russian Federation, any of them begins their dialogue by telling their relatives that the Ukrainian army is fighting for each of its wounded, trying to -pull out- its -200s-, and he has never seen such a thing in the Russian army. We had a case when we were carrying prisoners and came under fire. Then one of the prisoners helped pull our -300- and even covered it with himself. And then that Russian also thanked the Ukrainian military that he survived and that they saved his life. There are different people, for example, they stormed the dugout, and we knew for sure that there were two -Wagners- there, we really wanted to capture them. Moreover, there was some evidence that they had committed war crimes against Ukrainians. And then another prisoner we took, he, by the way, was also from the 110th brigade of the Russian Federation, says that the -Agnerov- shot themselves, they did not want to be captured. As evidence, he showed their brains on his back. By the way, this Russian soldier has been passed on and will be exchanged. Once we had 5 prisoners, and they asked to record an appeal to the military court of the Russian Federation, where they asked not to abuse the Ukrainian military, not to commit war crimes and crimes against humanity. - And how do the Russian occupiers explain their war crimes, why do they shoot our soldiers, how do they justify it? -The answer is always the same - we are not like that, there is no such thing in our unit. That is, complete -frost-. —Tell us about the organization of work at the battalion's KSP? —In general, this is interaction. The structure of the unit is made so that communication and objective control of positions are the first and most important. That is, our UAV pilots who are on duty here, plus there are calculations at the very positions. We constantly see a 24/7 picture of everything that is happening on the battlefield, at the front edge, to identify the enemy on the far flanks and inflict fire damage on them before they come within shooting range of our infantry. That is, it is actually a battle control point. Continuous review and monitoring. Close contact with company commanders, who are located a little closer to the front edge and manage their soldiers. We have developed a clear cascade system -from top to bottom- and, accordingly, back. This is such a -blood circulation- of information that is constantly moving, there is a constant exchange of information. All our work is aimed at only one thing - to destroy the enemy. - What are your capabilities for conducting aerial reconnaissance deep into the enemy's battle formations? -If we talk about the battalion level, then most often for reconnaissance we use such boards as Mavic during the day and Mavic 3T at night. We also use FPV drones. The brigade already conducts more in-depth reconnaissance with the use of such reconnaissance boards as -Stork-, etc., which are used for reconnaissance and detection of enemy firepower. If we see that one of our positions is being shelled, we immediately find out where the shelling is coming from, the frequency of shelling, and then pass this information on to the brigade. The brigade immediately monitors the nearest populated place from where the shelling is taking place, and accordingly directs a reconnaissance plane there and engages fire means to suppress or destroy the enemy. We also apply -fire on the ban.- That is, there are certain serifs where Russian mortars, Grads, guns can be located, and there is a possible concentration of the enemy. There is a preemptive strike. This works very often and helps stop the shelling. Unfortunately, this is not always the case, sometimes the enemy is camouflaged in such a way that it is very difficult to detect a firearm.

Title: -War for the mind-: GUR presented a film about countering Russian propaganda
Description: This is discussed in a publication on the GUR MOU page. The film reveals the details of countering Russia's aggression in the information and communication sphere, where more than 1,000 destructive information attacks on Ukrainian society are recorded every month. Kirill Budanov, head of the GUR of the IOM, emphasized that without resolute opposition, Russian propaganda -fills the entire space- using methods similar to those used by Goebbels. As reported by ArmyInform, the head of the Main Directorate intelligence of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine Lieutenant General Kyrylo Budanov stated that Russia will continue to try to destabilize the situation in Ukraine. However, according to him, all hostile actions will receive a decent response.

Title: Fiber-optic drones, aviation and -volumetric-strikes support attacks by Russian attack aircraft in t...
Description: Danylo Borysenko, chief of intelligence of the anti-aircraft missile and artillery division of the -Rubizh- brigade, told about this on the air of the -Yedini Novyni- telethon. In the Kupyansk direction, there was one assault attempt in the area of ​​the settlement of Zagryzovy, in the Lymansk direction there were 13 attacks in the Novopavlivka and Yampolivka areas. They also tried to storm in the Seversky direction - in the Bilogorivka area. According to the officer, the enemy's tactics remain unchanged. These are -volumetric- artillery attacks, including rocket salvo systems. Also, the enemy uses aviation with KABs and FABs, a lot of FPV drones, including fiber-optic drones. -Assault actions are being tried to be carried out mainly by the tactics of small infantry groups, which are trying to infiltrate, gain a foothold somewhere in the forest strips, in the junctions between our units. If they manage to accumulate enough personnel in these areas, then they try to advance further. However, our guys are trying to destroy them even on the approaches to the battle line,- Danylo Borysenko said. As ArmyInform reported, in the Pokrovsky direction, the combined forces of the enemy reach approximately one combined army. These are tens of thousands of people.

Title: - Shaheds - fall, - Beech trees - burn: devastating losses of the enemy in the South
Description: This is reported by the Defense Forces of Southern Ukraine. In addition, the Defense Forces continued to inflict fire damage on enemy emplacements, firing positions and rears. During the day, the enemy lost: It was also destroyed/destroyed: As reported by ArmyInform, in general, during the past day 101 were recorded combat clash.

Title: The Air Force of the Ukrainian Armed Forces shot down 65 enemy UAVs, another 32 drones were lost to ...
Description: This is reported by the Air Force of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The air attack was repulsed by aviation, anti-aircraft missile forces, electronic warfare units and mobile fire groups of the Air Force and the Defense Forces of Ukraine. As of 09:00, the shooting down of 65 Shahed-type attack UAVs and other types of drones in the Kharkiv, Poltava, Sumy, Kirovohrad, Zaporizhzhya, Dnipropetrovsk, Donetsk, Mykolaiv and Odesa regions has been confirmed. 32 Enemy Mimic Drones - Lost in location (no ill effects). As a result of the enemy attack, Odeshchyna, Sumyshchyna and Donetsk region were affected. As reported by ArmyInform, at night Russian troops made another massive attack on Odessa using attack drones. The attack damaged the city's energy infrastructure, leading to emergency power outages in some areas.

Title: -Sat on the helmets of the occupiers-: UAV operator -Limon- about his work at the front
Description: The story of the fighter was made public on the brigade's page. Until December 2023, Bohdan fought in the TRO brigade, where he mastered the skills of controlling drones. At first, he used the drone for reconnaissance — monitoring approaches to enemy positions and actions. But his own initiative turned into a profession. -I was a machine gunner, and I used UAVs for security. It helped to see the enemy, his maneuvers, act in advance,- says -Lemon-. Its crew consists of four people, and together they inflicted heavy losses on the occupiers. -Lemon- himself stopped counting the destroyed enemies when their number exceeded fifty. Bohdan felt a qualitative difference in the 46th brigade of the DSHV - in security, approaches to combat, level of armament. -It's grown-up here,- he says. Its task now is not only reconnaissance, but also targeted damage. He does not regret his choice, because he feels the main thing is confidence in his siblings. -In war, many things lose meaning. But brotherhood is something I've come to believe in even more,- Lemon concludes. His drone continues to fly, and he himself does everything every day so that the invaders do not have a chance. As reported by ArmyInform, war changes people, hardens characters and reveals the true essence of everyone. This is what happened to the soldier, known by the call sign -Afghan-, who today transfers his combat experience to recruits of the 33rd separate mechanized brigade.

Title: A moment of silence in Ukraine
Description: -In order to honor the bright memory, civic courage and self-sacrifice, strength of spirit, resilience and heroic deed of the soldiers who fell during the execution of combat missions to protect the state sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine, civilians who died as a result of the armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine, I decree: to start holding a national minute of silence every day at 9:00 a.m. for compatriots who died as a result of the armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine, which should be announced in all mass media, regardless of the form of ownership,- the document says.

Title: The Verkhovna Rada appealed to the President of the United States with a call for further partnershi...
Description: This is stated in a message on the website of the parliament. -On behalf of the Ukrainian people, the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine expresses deep gratitude to President Donald Trump, the Congress of the United States of America, and the American people for their firm and consistent support for the independence, sovereignty, and territorial integrity of Ukraine, as well as for the security assistance packages provided to Ukraine, which contributed to the stabilization of the situation at the front,- the statement reads. It is emphasized that Ukraine deeply respects the aspirations of the great American people for a comprehensive restoration of the global leadership of the United States. The deputies noted that the security and stable development of Ukraine is ensured by the constant support of the USA and reflects the values ​​that were the basis of America's historical success, inspiring millions of Ukrainians. -Today, this support is more important than ever for the Ukrainian people and the Security and Defense Forces of Ukraine, as well as for ensuring security and stability on the entire European continent,- the statement reads. The statement indicates that the Ukrainian people seek peace like no other in the world, and believe that the personal role of President Donald Trump and his peacemaking efforts will be decisive in ending hostilities as soon as possible and achieving peace for Ukraine, Europe and the whole world. The Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine welcomed US President Donald Trump's initiatives to start a negotiation process aimed at ensuring peace. The Parliament also emphasizes the need for further development of strategic partnership with the USA, in particular in the field of exploration of critical minerals. -The Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine confirms that Ukraine must remain an independent and sovereign state, and the Ukrainian people - free and unconquered,- the statement reads. American mass media reported on March 4 that Donald Trump ordered the suspension of all military aid to Ukraine. The decision of the US president includes weapons that have already left the US territory and were heading to the Ukrainian border, as well as those waiting in transit zones in Poland.

Title: Kherson Oblast under fire: Russian shelling injured five people, an ambulance blew up on a mine
Description: This was reported by the head of Kherson OVA Oleksandr Prokudin. Antonivka, Chornobayivka, Zelenivka, Komyshany, Ivanivka, Inzhenerne, Prydniprovske, Sadove, Tokarivka, Molodizhne, Novodmytrivka, Bilozerka, Dniprovske, Kizomys, Nadezhdivka, Tomina Balka, Beryslav, Novoberislav, Zolota Balka, Havrylivka, Zmiivka, Kostyrka, Mykolaivka came under enemy fire. Odradokamyanka, Chervyn Mayak, Shlyakhove, Novoraisk, Mykhailivka, Vesele and the city of Kherson. The Russian military targeted critical and social infrastructure, as well as residential areas. As a result of shelling, 9 private houses, the Inviolability Point, a warehouse, a garage and private cars were damaged. Five people were injured due to Russian aggression. In addition, at night near Novovorontsovka, an -ambulance- was detonated on an explosive device. The medics' vehicle ran into an ordnance, as a result of which the car's wheel was crushed. Fortunately, the -emergency- team and the patient were not injured. As reported by ArmyInform, this morning Russian troops attacked a civilian vehicle in the Dnipro district of Kherson using a drone.

Title: -Even if my legs were torn off, I would fight-: -Afghan- is an instructor who went through the hell ...
Description: The story of the fighter was made public on the brigade's page. Before the war, he worked at the Toyota factory abroad, assembling cars. However, on February 28, 2022, -Afghan- left everything behind and returned to Ukraine. Tried to mobilize through the TCC, but was refused. He could not sit at home - he signed up for the Teroborona, and later managed to be mobilized and joined the 33rd Brigade, where he became a machine gunner. His baptism of fire took place on June 7-8 during the Zaporizhia counteroffensive. He was in the front lines on the M-113, serving as a platoon leader. The battle was successful, after which the enemy trenches had to be cleared. On June 14, -Afghan- received a shrapnel wound - a mine exploded four meters from him, shattering the meniscus. The impact was so strong that the helmet simply broke off. Despite the pain, he managed to walk more than 150 meters to the shelter, where he received first aid. After the evacuation, doctors removed two fragments, two more remained in the leg forever. Despite this, the fighter did not leave the service. After treatment, he returned to the unit, was a driver, a gunner-medic. Later, his experience and methods of training fighters attracted attention. He was offered to train recruits in the newly created platoon of instructors. At first it was planned to be a short-term task, but later it became clear that his method works. -Afghan- was sent for training: first in Ukraine, and then in Great Britain, where he was trained by Norwegian instructors. -The Norwegians were impressed by our skills. They even called their families, talking about us with pride. We gave them a Ukrainian flag, which one of them hung at home in a place of honor,- recalls -Afghan-. But the most important thing that he acquired abroad was the military training methodology. Now, every day of his life begins with motivation for new recruits. -Our enemy is cunning and insidious, but not immortal. Don't be afraid of him. We are Ukrainians, we are not timid. When we show our teeth, the occupiers will be scared,- -Afghan- tells his charges. He is not worried about his fate, but he is worried about his brothers. Teaches them that in battle the main thing is to survive and win. -Victory will come when the shelling stops, when the brothers return to their families, and Ukraine liberates all the occupied territories,- -Afghan- is confident. And until that day comes, he continues to impart knowledge and train warriors who will change the course of history. As reported by ArmyInform, Oleksiy Sereda, chief sergeant, technician of one of the navigation systems of the 114th tactical aviation brigade, known under the call sign -Panda-, told an incredible story of his combat experience in the Vovchansk direction.

Title: A Russian drone attacked a civilian car in Kherson: a 67-year-old man was injured
Description: This was reported by the Kherson Regional Military Administration. A 67-year-old man was injured as a result of dropping explosives on a vehicle. He suffered a blast injury, as well as injuries to his arms and legs. The victim was promptly taken to the hospital, where he is being provided with the necessary medical assistance. As reported by ArmyInform, at night Russian troops carried out another mass attack on Odessa, using attack drones. As a result of the attack, the city's energy infrastructure was damaged, which led to emergency power outages in some areas.

Title: At the front, there were more than 100 clashes per day, most of them in the Kursk and Pokrovsky dire...
Description: This is in the operational information of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine as of 08:00 on March 4. Yesterday, the enemy carried out 56 airstrikes on the positions of Ukrainian units and populated areas, dropping 104 anti-aircraft missiles, using 2,638 kamikaze drones. In addition, he fired more than five thousand one hundred shots, of which 186 were from RSZV. The aggressor carried out airstrikes, in particular in the areas of Loknia, Stavky, Novoyehorivka, Kostyantynivka, Pokrovsk, Myrolyubivka, Udachne, Yablunivka, Voskresenka, Staromlynivka, Zelene Pole, Zaliznychne, Novopil, Chervona Krynytsia, Omelnyk, Yehorivka, Novoraisk and Chervony Mayak. Over the past day, aviation, missile forces and artillery of the Defense Forces hit 14 personnel and equipment concentration areas, an artillery system and two enemy control points. In the Kharkiv direction, our troops repelled two enemy attacks in the direction of Bochkovo and Krasny Pershyi. In the Kupyan direction, two attacks by the occupiers took place last day. Defense forces repelled assaults near the settlements of Zagryzove and Ivanivka. On the Lyman direction the enemy attacked 13 times. Tried to advance near Novolyubivka, Ivanovka and Yampolivka. In the Seversky direction, the enemy once attacked the positions of our defenders in the area of ​​the settlement of Bilogorivka. In the Kramatorsk direction, three clashes were recorded in the area of ​​Chasovoy Yar and in the direction of Stupochky and Predtechyny. In the Toretsk direction the enemy launched 13 attacks in the Krymskyi and Toretsk regions. In the Pokrovsky direction, our defenders stopped 21 assaults and offensive actions of the aggressor in the areas of the settlements of Oleksandropil, Lysivka, Promin, Dachenske, Preobrazhenka, Kotlyna, Ulakly and Andriivka. In the Novopavlovsk direction the occupiers attacked the positions of our troops seven times, tried to break through in the direction of Constantinople, Burlatsky and Skudny. In the direction of Gulyajpil, the invaders tried to launch an offensive in the direction of Privilny. In the Orichivsk direction our troops repelled four enemy attacks in the direction of Stepovoy and near Nesteryanka. In the operational zone of Kurshchyna, units of the Defense Forces of Ukraine repelled 29 attacks by Russian invaders over the past day. In addition, the enemy carried out 13 air strikes with the use of 17 guided bombs, and also carried out 308 artillery attacks on the positions of our troops and populated areas, of which 17 were from anti-aircraft missiles. In the Dnieper direction, the enemy did not carry out assault operations last day. In the Volyn and Poliske directions no signs of the formation of enemy offensive groups were detected. Our soldiers inflict significant losses in manpower, equipment and actively undermine the offensive potential of the enemy in the rear to the occupying forces. In general, the Russian invaders lost 1,340 people last day. Ukrainian soldiers also destroyed three tanks, eight armored combat vehicles, 45 artillery systems, an air defense vehicle, 86 anti-aircraft missiles and 101 vehicles of the occupiers. As reported by ArmyInform, over the past day the army of the aggressor country lost 1,340 people and 8 armored combat vehicles of various models.

Title: Russian drones attacked Odessa: four injured, damage to houses and a business center
Description: This was reported by Oleg Kiper, the head of Odesa OVA. According to him, utility services have already started work to restore power, including starting generators to ensure the operation of critical infrastructure, including boiler houses. Additional points of invincibility are also being deployed, currently there are 425 such points in the city. As a result of falling debris and blast waves, two private houses and a business center were damaged. Unfortunately, there are casualties among the civilian population. Three residents of private houses received shrapnel wounds and broken limbs. They are hospitalized and in moderate condition. Another person who was in the business center during the attack was injured. All relevant services are working at the scene of the incident, law enforcement officers are recording yet another crime by the Russian occupiers against the civilian population of Odesa. Doctors provide the victims with the necessary medical assistance. As reported by ArmyInform, over the past day Russian troops carried out 510 strikes on 13 settlements of the Zaporizka Oblast, which led to to the death of a 49-year-old man and the wounding of a 46-year-old woman in the Pologiv district.

Title: An incredible escape from captivity: the story of a Czech man who impressed even the enemy with his ...
Description: But everything changed in February 2022: military comrades from the Defense Forces of Ukraine said that it was time to turn back - Russia was preparing for a full-scale attack on Ukraine. Oleksiy did not renew his contract with the private military company where he worked for 12 years. He immediately wrote a report and flew to Ukraine. Everything that followed is more reminiscent of a movie script than the real life of a real person, a movie about evil and faith, about inner strength and physical pain, about torture and safety, about a father's example and about male dignity. And about many things and meanings. This story, which the correspondent of ArmiyaInform recorded in one of the capital's medical institutions, is about Oleksiy with the nickname -Czech-. He is currently undergoing rehabilitation after his injury. He is 41 years old, the chief sergeant of a company of one of the units of the Defense Forces of Ukraine. Then his story: in direct language, without unnecessary words. -I served the military service from 2003 to 2005, I really liked it. Signed a contract for another three years - from 2005 to 2008. During the time when I was in contract service, familiar friends were part of the Ukrainian peacekeeping contingent in Iraq. They talked a lot, shared their impressions. And when my contract ended, some of my brothers decided to go to the Middle East to work in one of the private military companies. Duties include oil well security, paramilitary security, official escort, etc. At the time, it was an attractive proposition, plus it paid well. One of the main requirements is at least a basic level of English to understand the commands you receive over the radio. Therefore, in 2008, I did not renew my contract with the Armed Forces. The contract worker's salary was not enough to support the young family, in 2007 the son Yaroslav was born. I liked being in the army, but there was not enough money. Since 2010, I started working abroad, while improving my English. Rotation schedule: 12 weeks work, four weeks off. So I worked for 9 months, I was with my family in Ukraine for three. At the beginning of 2010, my salary was 7 thousand dollars per month. Then, in 2014, global oil prices fell, and wages fell after that. In 2022, this amount was 4 thousand dollars. It was difficult when my son started growing up. As soon as I started to pack my suitcase before leaving, Yaroslav climbed into it and said that he was coming with me. My son is my main strength and motivation. There have been many difficult situations in life when it seems that something is about to break in you. And then you say to yourself: -You have a son, and by some parental example you should show how it should be done.- Now he is already 17 years old, and he is a professional athlete for me - he is engaged in mixed martial arts. At the age of seven, he started practicing judo… And when he was still very small, he was only one year old, maybe just learning to walk, he saw me doing some physical exercise in the morning, let's say, push-ups from the floor, and he tried to repeat the exercise himself (smiles). I talked a lot with coaches about what a child should start doing, and that's how he first came to judo, and then things went downhill. There were many Ukrainian military personnel in our group that worked with in Iraq, and in 2022 we had an understanding that there would be a full-scale war. Comrades from the Defense Forces of Ukraine also wrote and explained that it was worth returning. We had no doubts. We wrote reports, the management of the company went to meet. It helped as much as it could. I returned to Ukraine on February 14, 2022 without renewing the contract. From Iraq, transfer in Istanbul, from there to Boryspil. My colleagues' rotation in this company ended on February 25, 2022. The wife was in the Czech Republic, the son was still in Ukraine. On February 24, we were at home with our son when we realized that a full-scale war had begun. Next to us was a military camp - everything was audible. Son was evacuated from Ukraine on February 28. And two cats in carriers. And March 1 has already arrived in Dnipro. My comrades and I knew in which unit we would serve, we did not plan to go to the Military Commissariat. There were five of us, we knew each other because we worked in the same team abroad for several years. As a small volunteer formation, we joined one unit, some of their groups were already working in the Raisin direction. Was in the rank of sergeant. Received the call sign -Czech-. Why -Czech-? At one time, my wife and I decided that we wanted to live in the Czech Republic. My wife's mother has lived in this country for 20 years, and when there were holidays and I went to visit my relatives in the Czech Republic, my brothers asked me to bring delicious Czech beer (laughs). That's how he got the call sign - -Czech Republic-. Although I do not speak Czech. Next was the Izyum direction. And here he could not apply all his experience gained abroad. Yes, in some cases it makes sense - in terms of preparation and so on. But not countermeasures to the Russians: Pod*ar aviation was very active, our air defense did not work like that. Yes, some MANPADS calculations knocked them down, but the Russians calmly entered our airspace and delivered Kharkiv or Izyum. They were flying at very low altitudes, I could make out what was written on the wings of the plane, etc. It was difficult, but it is important which unit you are in. An experienced and competent commander is important. Clear and step-by-step action planning is important. It is important to consider the number of the enemy and their weapons. And when all this is announced at the briefing before the task, then each of the group understands their actions in the future and what depends on them. In the Izyum direction, the scale of how the Russians climbed: in columns, was impressive. I have never seen this in any movie. I remember how we were in the village of Hrushevakha. A river divided this village. When our Defense Forces took control of it and the bridges over the river were blown up, then the Russians tried to make pontoon crossings across the river. Among our tasks, in particular, were adjustments and mining. Then there was Raisin itself, and the work of the artillery was also adjusted. Then there was Kharkiv, the ring road, the village of Pyatikhatki - they started working there from the middle of April. There was a gray area, near Ruska Lozova. Forest. And here we had tasks: to find the enemy's firing points, to identify enemy DRGs, their routes, etc. At that time, our group did not have drones, we collected information on our own. At least 10 km were walked every day - through a dense forest, in gear. The exits were for at least two or three days. One of these tasks was carried out on May 8, when the counteroffensive of the Defense Forces began. We needed to conduct surveillance on one of the sections of the road where the Russians could advance. And then we found the forester's house, next to it was a section of the road. And it was our mistake, or we were a little relaxed and did not take into account that in the middle of the forest the house is an obvious landmark, I don't know… We understood that we would have to stay for three days, there was no desire to dig in, it was cloudy, not the best weather. So we decided to set up our observation post not far from this house. Two hours passed, and the mortar shelling began, the mines were falling very densely. And the landmark-house played a wicked joke on us: they hit it. We started to leave, but there was a flight, and one of the projectiles very badly wounded my brother Roman in the leg. The fragment entered the knee, through the entire thigh and lodged in the hip joint. We pulled him away and began to administer first aid. But we understood that we had gone deep for 12 kilometers, and it would be difficult to carry him back the same distance. We had no luggage with us. It was difficult to communicate due to the topography of the area. Colleagues decided to move a little further to get in touch with another group and explain the situation. I stayed with the wounded man, gave him painkillers. And about 40 minutes later, I saw some silhouettes among the trees with my side vision. At first I thought it was ours coming back. There was no feeling of anxiety. There wasn't even a thought that you should put on the equipment - it was lying nearby. As the people came closer, I realized that it was already under. In balaclavas. My brother was in pain shock, periodically screaming. I warned him that we had -guests- and asked him to endure the pain. I tried to stretch it, about 5 meters at the most. I tried to get in touch with my relatives, but there was no connection. Therefore, he said to his friend: -Roma, let's press as low as possible to the ground.- I had no thoughts of leaving him. There was still hope that this core of the DRG could pass and not notice us. But visual contact was made, and in about 10-15 minutes they began to take us into a semi-circle. I understood that I would have time to put on the bulletproof vest. Weapons are nearby, grenades are nearby. They started throwing grenades at us. Three -ergedeshka- flew, one of them fell near my leg and I managed to push it away. Debris hit the leg and right side. Then there are the short lines. Hands and blindfolded. He managed to hear something like: -He is heavy, we will not drag him through the forest.- And as for you, everything depends on you: if you go, you will live.- I tried to stand up, felt pain. Then there was a road through the forest for approximately 30 minutes. Then they were transported on some type of quad bike, then thrown into a truck. And then they started to find out who I am. I was saved by the fact that I had no phone, no military ID, no tattoo. I came up with a legend that was as true as possible, although I listened to a lot of idiotic questions. However, they did not learn anything about my unit or the commander. He replied that we communicated only by callsigns… But it is necessary to understand that each person has his own pain threshold. Someone does not survive on the second or third interrogation, someone on the 10th. Torture began in the field camp. They said that I -can sculpt fables-, but -one corner - and you will still tell the truth.- They called that shot -truth serum,- but I didn't pay any attention to that, I'm not in a James Bond movie. Simultaneously with the interrogations, torture continued: nails, ribs were broken. All in order to break you mentally and physically. The eyes were constantly blindfolded. And the same question could be repeated several times during the interrogation. I was alone in this field camp, interrogated mostly by contract officers of the Russian army. Then I was brought to some other place where there were cells and basements. There were also other prisoners. During these few days, my hands were constantly tied and very tight. I even thought that their blood circulation had already stopped because it didn't feel as if they were dry. I just didn't feel them. And I went to the first interrogation already at the -new- place. I am a person of faith, and the Lord gave me strength that I did not have any panicky moods. I was just going over it in my head and reminding myself what I shouldn't say and what I should make them believe. And where I should confuse them as much as possible. During the interrogation, one should behave as calmly as possible. Because as soon as they feel weakness, they get pleasure from it. Yes, I understand that everyone feels pain. But everyone can somehow control this pain. And during all these interrogations, they kept asking me: -Are you stubborn? Masochist?-. I said no. I was questioned: -Do you like being fucked?- Just say so, and we'll wake you up later.- All this took place on May 9-10. It was the third day that I was in captivity, and the second hour of interrogation. I haven't gone to the toilet all this time. All my fingers were broken, my nails were torn. Asked to go to the toilet. They asked if he had ever peed his pants. Then they pointed to the tapik and its wires… When the interrogation ended, I was taken to the toilet and my hands were untied, but I did not feel them. I asked to remove the tape from my eyes. I was led to the toilet. But I had military pants with a bunch of buttons, plus a belt I just couldn't handle with my numb hands. I was asked why it took so long. To which I replied that my hands did not work. Then the second Russian came up and said to the first one: -Unbutton his shirt.- And he replied: -What, I'm going to unbutton the dill?-. And he did it. After some time I realized where I was - this is Hoptivka, our border point. Before, there were no cameras there, just some rooms and a grid welded on top. Prisoners were kept there: both military and civilian. Concrete floor, humidity… The next day, a paramedic came, provided help, and gave analgin. Then a facebooker started working with me, there were long interrogations. Working in Iraq saved me a lot. When I started talking about it, they kind of switched gears. They called me a mercenary, although I appealed to the fact that their companies also work there. They wondered what the salaries were, for example… Then they sent propagandists with a camera - forced to give interviews. They asked why I, as a native of Donetsk region, do not defend my native region on the side of the Russians. In other words, they tried to break as much as possible. But I felt the support of loved ones, even at a distance. I understood that they would cut out of this interview and publish only what they were interested in. And I said this: -I have a son, he is now 15 years old. And now I'm in captivity, nothing depends on me, I can't defend myself in any way. But I don't want my son, who is 15 years old, who is now a young man, to see his father chewing snot on camera and then being shown on all Telegram channels. For him, it will be a psychological trauma for the rest of his life. He is an athlete. What example will I set for him if I only think for my own skin?... But it is important for me that my son thinks that his father is not a traitor.- To which the chief replied: -Well, you are stubborn… Nabazaril dohyera, I would have shot you already. But you answered like a man.- And I sit and think: -Wow, they also give compliments-… After that, everyone left, only one remained in a balaclava, and suddenly points a gun at me… I checked that I am not in the basement, there are no blood stains on the floor - that is, there is clearly no shooting here. He stood like that, saw that I had no reaction, lowered his weapon and left. After that, I was no longer called for questioning. After that, I was already transferred to Kupyansk to a temporary detention center. I spent another four months there. The memory of my son and faith in God helped me. Six people sat in solitary confinement: three prisoners of war and three more criminals who were imprisoned for murder. They were -settled- with us. Summer has begun. There was some kind of holiday in the pod*riv - the day of their pod*rstan. They came to us and told us to learn the Russian national anthem. They gave a piece of paper with the text… I didn't even touch it. Others began to teach. Then they look into our cell and ask: -You are stubborn, you don't understand where you got to?-. I replied that it was not my holiday, but theirs, and they called me a moron. Two hours passed, my guys from the cell said that I have nothing to prove to anyone, and that I am not in solitary confinement, but everyone can pay for my stubbornness. Then I asked one of the guards to transfer me to solitary confinement. To which he replied that during the evening inspection he would f*ck my cellmates until I learned the national anthem. I had no choice, I had to learn that hymn. Although I understood that we would be filmed on a phone and it might be published somewhere. I was in a very confusing situation and I didn't know how to do the right thing. There were 12 cameras in total and everyone started singing in turn. And our camera just hummed. And the warden replied that now he will cheer us up - he took out a tear gas grenade and threw it into our cell. And closed the door. Tears, snot, saliva flows… It's still hot, because it was June… And once they brought a girl - thin, young. It can be seen that she is some kind of drug addict. She was also placed in a cell, waiting for interrogation. I asked for a cigarette. The guard replied that if he squats 500 times, then he will let him smoke. And she starts squatting: 10 times, 20 times, 200 times! And counts out loud! We all wondered how it would end! She squatted 500 times in one breath. And got a well-deserved cigarette. These 500 times are very memorable to me, because I have never squatted 500 times myself. We were forbidden to do any physical exercises at all. Our camera was never taken out into the courtyard for a walk. Then, when we were transferred to another, larger cell, I started to do some physical exercises. Little by little, I started with prints from the floor. I started, and within a week the whole camera joined my physical training. But those 500 squats are very stuck in my head… From July to September I trained. In the end, I was able to squat three times for 500 times! And he did push-ups, standing on his hands on the floor. Every night, falling asleep, I mentally thanked God for giving me the strength to live another day. At the beginning of September 2022, we heard the first explosions. The guys from the camera assumed that probably ours started to press the bottom. On September 6, there was such a strong arrival that those who were lying on the bunks were hit. And the apartment flew out with an explosive wave. The next day we were warned that there might be shelling and that we should hide under the windows at night, in case of shelling, so that the glass would not fall on us. And at night it was just as bad - the grill on the windows even bent. The defense forces of Ukraine did press. We heard machinery moving outside, heard an artillery duel. We understood that the counteroffensive was going on, but we did not understand how it would benefit us. There was a feeling of incomprehension. The guys from the neighboring cell said that they have no windows at all. There was silence in the corridor - no one. It turned out that the guards were so scared and ran away that they even left the keys to the cameras. Comrades from the neighboring camera were released. There were some 120-130 people. We still wanted to find our personal affairs in the offices and burn them. Although there was a risk that the fall would return. Then I suggested that the last one who goes out, let it just set fire to the room, because if 100 people start looking for their business, it can be a long time. One of the guys who sat with us was from Kupyansk nodal. He knew all the routes and trails. Therefore, he is our statement. He led us to the house where we were able to eat, dress. When we ran across the bridge in Kupyansk, it began to shine. Under ** the equipment began to retreat, the city battles continued … Subsequently, a friend took us on the car, we went to the house. It was September 8. I was captured on May 8. Exactly 4 months. For the first time during this time he was normal. And turned on the TV. It turned out that we released raisins, Balaklium, and the direction of Kupyansk developed. And in a few days our brothers met a neighbor who, as it turned out, worked on a*duty … During a brief conversation, it became clear that we need to run. And it was necessary to swim across the river. He gave us bicycles, and the three of us started traffic. I still asked if this is a picture that is a picture of bicycles in the village? ( laughs ). Well, they went. Thank God that there was no to meet. We reached the river, heard enemy drones hung above us. The river sailed, they got the right bank - and there is our -espe-. There were our boys there - we looked at them, and they were at us. They explained the situation, we were told in which way to move. We went to the checkpoint, we were told that we will be checked by representatives of the VSP from Kharkiv. They interviewed us and then punched us on their base, asked what military unit. And we were a volunteer formation, we had nothing on a military ticket. In the end, they punched: Sashko was as prisoners of war, and I was missing. He did not remember the phone numbers, but remembered the group commander. He contacted him - he called back in 5 minutes. They were talking, I was glad that I was found, he already wanted to pick me up the next day. But at first I had to negotiate a military counterintelligence. Later, I was taken away by the commander, then there was a hospital in the Dnieper. And yet - an official investigation to find out the circumstances of how I was captured, where I was and so on. Such investigations always begin after captivity. But for me, it was the worst thing about all this that some people thought that I shot my brother Romk, switched to the*River side. And so I was on the lists not as captured, but missing missing, because it seemed to move to the side of the enemy. It was very difficult for me … Because these were shot by the Russians. I learned about it in the field camp. And then I was told that the body of Romka was taken away by our brothers from another subgroup in two to three days. The official investigation lasted for about three months. Yes, after all, I was released from captivity. And when communicating with military counterintelligence staff, they stated that they had not yet met such cases when people were released from captivity. Physical form and hardening in captivity came in handy when they overcome the river and the plot to the river. I know one thing: the power must be maintained, because without physical form it would be very difficult. And psychological stability is important. I always return myself to my son, a professional athlete. When I was given 30 days of vacation after injury and treatment and I went to the Czech Republic, I went to workout. He fights athletes, older than he, somewhere 20-year-olds and older. He only 17. I somehow said it could be difficult for him, because it is objectively stronger. To which he answered to me, -Dad, how difficult it could be here, if you were in captivity and in the video said that you did not want your son to see that you were weak.- And these words are important to me: that I, as his father, did not break in captivity. And he remembered his son. My son is a motivation for me as I am for him. He gives me the power of the internal as I do. After captivity, I continued service in the army, but in another unit. In 2023 he participated in a counter -offensive in the Zaporozhye direction. In the Verbov area he was injured. He was a little late and returned again. In the summer of 2024 they worked in Vovchansk, then transferred to the time of Yar. It was difficult because Vlad was killed with the call sign -hookah-. He is the son of a military man, with whom we started in 2022 in one group. There was a guy very volitional, bold. His body could not immediately pick up … And my brothers and I followed him. Under*the Drones were very active. Even before we approached the landing - we worked for us both discharges and mortars. All the boys from the group were injured. I have been treating and rehabilitation for the fourth month. The wife with her son is very worried about me … What are my plans for the future? Rehabilitation so far. I want to note work with a psychologist. Earlier, she thought she would have a little result, but that's not. I advise everyone. Next - VLK. It is necessary to determine my condition and whether I will continue to military service in the position I occupy. Because the main sergeant of the company is the position responsible, one must be an example for your subordinates … But there may be another position related to the preparation of personnel, say. What is my dream about the future? Do you know what profession I may be interested in? .. There is such a profession in the Czech Republic - a beer taster. So she would fit me (laughs). And this is my little dream - to tasting beer on small brewery ”. Photo by Elena Khudyakova and from the personal archive of a serviceman

Title: In the Pokrovsky direction, Ukrainian defenders repelled 13 enemy attacks
Description: This is in the operational information of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine as of 10:00 p.m. March 3. The Russian invaders launched 45 airstrikes using 73 anti-aircraft missiles. In addition, the Russians brought in 950 kamikaze drones and fired 4,139 shots at the positions of our troops and populated areas. In the Kharkiv direction the enemy tried to advance in the direction of Bochkovo and Krasny Pershyi, but was repulsed. In the Kupyansk direction, the enemy carried out an assault on the positions of our defenders in the Zagryzovo district. Ukrainian defenders repelled the attack. On the Lymanskyi direction during the day, Russian invaders attacked Ukrainian positions near Novolyubivka, Ivanovka and Yampolivka 13 times during the day, three skirmishes continue until now. In the Seversky direction, our defenders repelled enemy assaults in the Bilogorivka area. In the Kramatorsk direction three enemy assaults in the area of ​​Chasovoy Yar and in the direction of Stupochky and Predtechyny restrained Ukrainian units, inflicting losses on the enemy. In the Toretsk direction the Russians attacked the positions of the Defense Forces 13 times. The occupiers concentrated their main offensive efforts near the settlements of Krymske and Toretsk. At the moment, all hostilities have ended. Since the beginning of the last day, in the Pokrovsky direction, the invading units have tried 19 times to break through our defenses near the settlements of Oleksandropil, Lysivka, Promin, Dachenske, Preobrazhenka, Kotlyne, Ulakly, and Andriivka. The enemy is suffering significant losses - today, in this direction, Ukrainian soldiers neutralized 241 occupiers, 132 of them irreversibly. Six UAV control points, 18 units of motor vehicles, three motorcycles, three guns, five UAV control antennas, an electronic warfare device, a ground drone, two communication antennas and three satellite terminals of the enemy were also destroyed, in addition, one MTLB tractor, four guns and two cars were significantly damaged. The enemy is also active in the Novopavlovsk direction - eight times it attacked our positions near Konstantinopol, Burlatsky and Skudny, one battle continues to this day. In the direction of Gulyajpil, the invaders tried to launch an offensive in the direction of Privilny, the attack was repulsed. Zaliznychne, Novopil and Chervona Krynytsia were hit by airstrikes. In the Orichiv direction, our troops repelled two enemy attacks in the direction of Stepovoy and near Nesteryanka, two more clashes are still ongoing. Omelnyk and Yehorivka were hit by airstrikes with guided aerial bombs. In the Kursk region, Ukrainian defenders repelled 29 enemy attacks. In addition, the enemy carried out 13 air strikes with the use of 17 guided bombs, and also carried out 274 artillery attacks on the positions of our troops and settlements. In the Dnieper direction, the enemy did not conduct active offensive operations. The General Staff honored the soldiers of the 422nd separate battalion of unmanned systems and the 39th separate coastal defense brigade, who steadfastly restrained the onslaught of overwhelming enemy forces. As reported by ArmyInform, over the past day the army of the aggressor country lost 1,340 people and 8 armored combat vehicles of various models.

Title: -Listen, who is speaking?-: new deepfake audio from the Russian Federation
Description: The fake recording is distributed through pro-Russian Telegram channels and -anonymous insiders- who specialize in -biolaboratories-, -secret plans of the West- and other conspiracy stories. However, this time the technique was clearly not enough for a high-quality editing, because the deepfake reveals itself immediately: The logic of Russian propaganda is simple: throw a fake into the information space and see if someone will pick it up. In the best case for the Kremlin, one of the Western fringe politicians or journalists will take it at face value. At worst, the propagandists will simply indulge in the imitation of -treason- in the West in order to somehow justify their failures at the front. These methods have already been used before: the West is -tired of Ukraine-, then -the Americans admit defeat-, then something else from the same series. But every time these information attacks fail, because the world has long understood that all Moscow's statements must be divided by at least ten. You might think, -Well, fake and fake, who cares?- But the problem is that Russia is not just generating informational garbage - it is trying to create an alternative reality. Deepfakes and false narratives are aimed at undermining trust between allies and weakening support for Ukraine. What will be the next fake? Maybe the voice of Barack Obama, who -admits- that he is working for Ukraine? Or Joe Biden, who -offers- to transfer all NATO military equipment to Russia? Kremlin scriptwriters do not stop fantasizing, but the reality is this: deepfakes will not help win the war. And while Russian propagandists stamp new -revelations-, on the front, their troops suffer not at all virtual losses.

Title: -Crushed them like in a shooting range- - the fighter -Italy- returned to Ukraine and fights with th...
Description: The soldier's story was published on the Land Forces page. -Before the full-scale invasion, Volodymyr worked as a construction worker in Italy. But he was not left with terrible impressions from the crimes of the Russians, so in 2023 he returned to Ukraine and joined the ranks of the Armed Forces of Ukraine,- the report says. Today, -Italy- has significant combat experience. As an infantryman, he participated in fierce battles on different front lines: together with his comrades, he held the defense in the Serebryan Forest and the Lyman direction. It is currently performing combat missions on the Russian-Ukrainian border, holding back the invaders' breakthrough to Sumy region. Recently, while on duty at the positions of Italy, it was necessary to engage in a shooting battle. A group of occupiers broke through to the position, but met a fierce repulse. -Then I crushed them like in a shooting range. Then he and his brothers went to clean up,- the soldier recalls. -Italy- repeatedly brought the infantry to positions during rotations, together with the fighters at -zero- carried out territory sweeps, so it has a lot of trust among the soldiers. -He, by his own example, inspires his fellow men every day to do his difficult but important work,- the Ground Forces said. As reported by ArmyInform, fighter Serhii with the call sign -Forest- - a soldier of the 61st separate mechanized Steppe brigade - during the battles in Donetsk region saved brothers who were surrounded in the village of Orlivka.

Title: Produced fake IDs of the State Emergency Service for $1,500: the perpetrator was arrested in Kharkiv...
Description: The State Border Service of Ukraine informs about this. A resident of the city of Kharkiv, a former employee of the State Emergency Service of Ukraine was looking for persons of conscription age who had the financial ability to evade mobilization. For a monetary reward, he issued fictitious employment documents and a lifeguard certificate. -This allowed men of draft age to book in territorial recruitment and social support centers and avoid mobilization. The person involved valued his services at $1,500,- the message says. While receiving the sum of money and handing over the forged certificate, the law enforcement officers detained the suspect within the framework of Art. 208 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (Detention by an authorized official) and declared suspicion under Part 3 Article 369-2 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (Abuse of influence). The issue of choosing a preventive measure in the form of detention is being decided. -The sanction of the article provides imprisonment for up to eight years with confiscation of property. In the course of the authorized searches, seals, 11 forms of service certificates of the State Emergency Service of Ukraine, a hard drive, a photo, a dater, money and other things were seized,- the DPSU said. ArmyInform reminds that it is better not to break the law or risk your life, but to use the aggregator of vacancies in the Armed Forces and recruiting centers.

Title: -Contract 18-24-: the first recruits of the 92nd brigade about financial incentives and combat readi...
Description: The corresponding video was made public on the page of the military television of Ukraine. In the story, military correspondents met Vyacheslav and Mykhailo, who talked about the motivation for joining the army and the peculiarities of training. -I am 20 years old, and I chose a one-year contract,- says Vyacheslav. -I know that there are three months of guaranteed training, favorable conditions, such as free training and a preferential mortgage.- The boy has already received the first 200,000 hryvnias and is planning to buy a home. -The first purchase is the European Union flag,- he adds. Mykhailo, another contractor, said that he learned about the possibility of service from the news and quickly went through the necessary procedures. -It's a nice bonus, so to speak, but I say, I've wanted it for a long time,- he notes, referring to the payouts. Both guys are determined and ready for challenges. -I expect that it will be difficult, it will hurt, but I am ready for it,- says Mykhailo. -I want to connect my life with this,- Vyacheslav adds. The military expects that with the arrival of a large number of young contractors, tasks will be completed much better and faster. -I expect to advance, to liberate the land,- shares Vyacheslav's plans. As ArmyInform reported, the brigades are already preparing the first recruits who joined the Armed Forces within the framework of the Contract project 18-24-. The first volunteers are already undergoing training in 72 separate mechanized brigades named after Black Zaporozhets. As a reminder, -Contrakt 18-24- is a voluntary initiative that allows Ukrainians in the specified age category to join the Defense Forces of Ukraine for one year. The project offers a decent financial reward, professional combat training according to NATO standards and social guarantees that no civilian profession can provide.

Title: In the project - Damage report - damage to 9,000 enemy objects has already been recorded - Rustem Um...
Description: March 3 wrote Minister of Defense of Ukraine Rustem Umyerov about this. -At the beginning of the year, we launched the -Results Report- project, which made it possible to digitize and streamline reporting on the results of hostilities. In February, our soldiers showed a powerful result: about 100 units reported defeating 9,000 enemy targets through Army+ with confirmation in DELTA. Every fact of destruction — from infantry to equipment — is recorded in a single combat system. The report can be submitted simply on a smartphone, and the confirmed data form analytics for the General Staff. This allows you to make quick decisions, manage your troops more effectively and destroy the enemy. Digitization and analytics are the way to victory on the battlefield,- noted Rustem Umyerov. The minister posted a video about the work of the -Report on damage-: As ArmyInform reported, the defense ministers of Ukraine and Britain discussed military help and the role of London in the Rammstein format.
