Title: The enemy is breaking into Toretsk on motorcycles, but it is a one-way street
Description: The commander of the 49th separate assault battalion -Karpatska Sich- Evgeniy Skoryna told about this on the air of the telethon Edyny Novyni. According to him, the units are countering the intentions of enemy assault groups to gain a foothold in settlements around Toretsk. -This morning, such assaults using motorcycles began. And now we are finishing the work of destroying the Russians who were able to reach the settlement,- said the battalion commander. He added that in the conditions of urban battles, the Russians attack in small groups, try to gain a foothold, create ambushes and carry out mines. -They try to advance both on foot and with the use of armored vehicles, civilian cars, and motorcycles. There were cases of the use of electric scooters. The enemy uses everything that can bring them to one end. They are not coming back,- said Yevgeny Skoryna. As reported by ArmyInform, on March 2, in the Toretsk direction, the enemy attacked the defense positions of our troops in the Toretsk and Shcherbinivka districts 12 times. So far, six clashes are ongoing.

Title: -Panda- from the -Mainland-: the story of an aircraft engineer who captured 11 invaders in the Khark...
Description: The story of the fighter was made public on the page of the Air Command -West- of the Air Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. In the middle of 2024, during the planned rotation, Oleksiy was seconded to the Kharkiv National University of the Air Force to perform combat missions as part of the combined battalion -Mainland-. There he held the position of commander of the detachment, protecting the village of Staritsa in the Kharkiv region. On September 30, while at the observation post, -Panda- along with three comrades engaged in a fierce battle with an enemy assault group. -We occupied firing points and were ready to meet the enemy,- Oleksiy recalls. Thanks to the support of the attack drones of neighboring units, Ukrainian fighters forced the invaders to hide in the basement of a neighboring house. -We decided to go to the basement and throw grenades at it,- says -Panda-. After intense grenade fire, Ukrainian soldiers offered the enemy to surrender. To their surprise, 11 unarmed occupants came out of the basement. -We were in shock - there were only four of us, and there were 11 of them! It was incredible,- admits Oleksiy. However, the adventures did not end there. During the convoy of prisoners, the group was attacked by enemy drones. -They dropped the ammunition and I was wounded in my left forearm. But because of the adrenaline, I didn't feel much pain, so I continued tying up the prisoners,- says -Panda-. After being evacuated to a military hospital, Oleksii was successfully treated and returned to service. -I don't consider myself a hero,- says Oleksii. - I'm just doing my duty, like all my brothers. We stood up to defend our country and defend our families so our children don't know what war is like. As reported by ArmyInform, -I was almost covered by a drone,- says a 20-year-old fighter of the -Rubizh- brigade of the National Guard of Ukraine with the call sign -Quiet- with a smile. href=-https://armyinform.com.ua/2025/03/02/bila-kaska-vryatuvala-20-richnyj-tyhyj-z-rubizhu-pro-drony-bij-pid-lozovoyu-ta-frontovu-medyczynu/->-. Despite his young age, he has already managed to go through the flames of war, visit the occupation, go abroad and return to the Motherland to defend it from the Russian invaders.

Title: The occupiers launched an airstrike on a community in the Kharkiv region, there are casualties
Description: This was reported by the National Police of Ukraine. Today, around 16:00, Russian troops launched an airstrike with four anti-aircraft missiles on the village of Dovzhik, Zolochiv community. Residential private houses were damaged as a result of shelling. A 14-year-old boy received a shrapnel wound and an acute reaction to stress. His 65-year-old grandmother also received explosive injuries. The police are documenting the aftermath of the shelling and collecting evidence of war crimes committed by the occupiers. As reported by ArmyInform, Russian troops again struck the civilian population of Kherson, using a drone to attack a route bus.

Title: -Lucky-: from a Lviv lawyer to a drone commander on the front line
Description: The story of the fighter was made public on the brigade's page. Before the full-scale invasion, Oleksandr worked in the State Emergency Service and planned to go to Spain to earn money. -On February 19, 2022, my 3-year contract with the State Emergency Service expired, I resigned and planned to go abroad to earn money,- Oleksandr says. -It was necessary to spin, to support the family.- However, when the Russians invaded, Alexander handed in his ticket and went to the Military Commissariat. -They refused to mobilize me because I was too young and had not served my term. I went seven times and kept hearing the same thing - we don't take it,- he recalls. Only on March 3, thanks to the help of a friend, Oleksandr got to the 128th brigade. At first, he worked in the medical unit, evacuating the wounded from the front line. -I worked with Prometheus, a very experienced combat medic. He delivered the wounded from the evacuation point to the stabilization point, and Prometheus provided them with assistance on the way,- Oleksandr says. Later, Oleksandr volunteered for the drone unit, where he was trained and became the commander of the FPV drone unit. -In the beginning, there were very few drones, we protected them as much as we could. And even FPVs were often used not as kamikazes but as bombers,- he recalls. Alexander received the nickname Lucky (lucky) for his ability to survive in extreme situations. -I could have died many times, but I survived. Once an enemy drone flew into our pickup truck, then a comrade sitting in front was killed. Another time, the drone also flew into our car, but bounced off the protective net and exploded 20 meters from the driver,- he says. Last May, Oleksandr's younger brother also joined the 128th brigade, serving in the drone unit. -For a long time, I dissuaded my brother from joining the army, because I think that I alone is enough from our family,- says Lucky. -However, when I realized that he had made a firm decision, I persuaded him to come to me.- Oleksandr plans to attend officer courses in the future, using his higher legal education to further serve Ukraine. As reported by ArmyInform, Denis under the pseudonym -Forest- is a fighter of the 127th separate territorial defense brigade, who passed a lot of hot fighting and forced the Russian group to retreat.

Title: The feat of the Hero of Ukraine: a 19-year-old border guard took out 21 comrades
Description: reported this in DPSU. The defender showed heroism already in the first months of his stay at the front, where he, coming from a military family, went in April 2024, just after reaching his 18th birthday. Soldier Vladyslav Stepanchuk and his comrades were setting up firing positions at one of the border areas, but the Russians noticed this and launched a heavy combined attack on the Ukrainian units. Artillery, Lancet drones, mortars, infantry groups - the fighters had to retreat. The commander of the cannon with which Vladyslav's unit worked was seriously wounded during the retreat. The young border guard led his comrades to the nearest forest strip, provided the necessary assistance to the wounded and took command of the adjacent units that had lost contact and were disoriented. As a result of the battle, which lasted for four hours, the Ukrainian defenders under the command of soldier Stepanchuk left the dangerous zone to reserve positions. The actions and determination of the young Hero saved the lives of 21 soldiers. As a reminder, Ukraine has a new project -Contrakt 18-24- - this is a voluntary initiative that allows Ukrainians in the specified age category to join the Defense Forces of Ukraine for one year. The project offers a decent financial reward, professional combat training according to NATO standards and social guarantees that no civilian profession provides.

Title: A summit on the situation in Ukraine began in London
Description: This was reported by the Office of the President of Ukraine. It is attended by the leaders of Ukraine, Great Britain, Denmark, Italy, Spain, Canada, the Netherlands, Germany, Norway, Poland, Romania, Finland, France, the Czech Republic, Sweden, as well as the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Turkey, Hakan Fidan. NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte, President of the European Commission Ursula von der Leyen and Chairman of the European Council Antonio Costa arrived in Britain for the summit. At the summit, they should discuss more active support of Ukraine from Europe against the background of US statements about its reluctance to provide military aid in the future. Also among the issues is a potential peace deal to end the war and increased defense spending in Europe. As reported by ArmyInform, the Minister of Defense of Ukraine Rustem Umyerov, during the visit of the delegation of the President of Ukraine to London met with his British colleague John Gilly.

Title: The President of Ukraine and the Prime Minister of Italy discussed an action plan to end the war wit...
Description: This was reported by the Office of the President. The key topic of the meeting is coordination with partners in order to develop a joint plan of action to end the war with a just, sustainable peace. Volodymyr Zelenskyi and George Maloney discussed the importance of unity around Ukraine and strengthening the position of our state in cooperation with allies — European countries and the USA. Separately, it was about providing reliable security guarantees to Ukraine and all of Europe. Our people must be sure that Russia will never return with war. In addition, the leaders discussed the formats of new contacts for conducting consultations between European countries and the United States. A meeting of the leaders of the countries is taking place in London today, at which Volodymyr Zelensky will be present. NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte, President of the European Council Antonio Costa and President of the European Commission Ursula von der Leyen will also join the meeting. As reported by ArmyInform, on March 1 Volodymyr Zelensky met with the Prime Minister of Great Britain Keir Starmer in London. The main topic of the negotiations was further support for Ukraine, strengthening of defense capabilities and ways to a just peace.

Title: Procurement of drones and EW, support of the domestic defense industry: the government adopted a res...
Description: About this reported acting state secretary of the IOU Nikita Nikitenko. The first resolution is -On Amendments to the Procedure for Procurement of Unmanned Systems, Radio-Electronic Warfare Means of Tactical Level of Domestic Production and Their Components.- The introduced changes eliminate the need to provide an expert's opinion or a report on the valuation of property by domestic executors of state contracts (agreements) for the manufacture and supply of unmanned systems, tactical-level electronic warfare equipment (their components) during the conclusion of a state contract (agreement) with military units. This will allow: The second resolution - -On state support of domestic manufacturers of trucks and automobile base chassis for weapons and equipment- According to the document, the state customer in the field of defense, the service of the state customer, as well as military units, organizations, during the procurement of goods, works and services for defense purposes, carry out the purchase of trucks and automobile base chassis for weapons and equipment, which are produced by enterprises of the domestic defense industry, provided that the degree of localization of the production of goods is at least 50%. The third resolution — -On Amendments to Appendix 5 to the Procedure for Conscription of Citizens for Military Service During Mobilization, for a Special Period- According to the resolution, Ukrainians who were captured, received the right to a postponement from mobilization. The document gives civilians held captive as a result of Russian aggression the right to postpone mobilization. In order to receive a deferment, it is necessary to provide an extract from the Unified Register of persons, in respect of whom the fact of deprivation of personal freedom has been established as a result of armed aggression against Ukraine.

Title: -Beaver- from Kharkiv: from watches to the front line to protect her daughter
Description: The story of the fighter was made public on the page of the Eastern Air Command. Without hesitation, Dmytro told his wife that he was going to the army, gathered the necessary things and went to the military unit, where he was doing his military service. At first, he performed tasks by post, and later joined the battalions that defended Kharkiv. Before the full-scale invasion, -Beaver- had a small private business - engaged in the production of watches. His wife worked as a logistician, and during the war, the couple had a daughter, Varvara. In the fall of 2023, Dmytro returned to the duties of his post, but later expressed a desire to go on combat missions again. Together with other recruits of the Air Force, he underwent training at the base of the Rifle Brigade of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. -Beaver- talks about one day of his -work-: -Several units of equipment were moving towards our positions. We quickly hit the nearest two. the Russians rushed in different directions. One vehicle started to turn around to go back, but blew up on an anti-tank mine.- At night of the same day, Dmytro was on duty and heard how the occupiers were -whining in the forest from injuries.- -Beaver- is sure that peaceful times will come in Ukraine after the final destruction of the enemy. -I'm often asked if it's hard to fight in the gray zone, but I don't know what to say, because I don't know how to fight. Here, on the front line, I and my comrades are doing everything possible for the future of Ukraine, for the sake of my daughter's happy life,- says the serviceman. As reported by ArmyInform, Denis under the pseudonym -Forest- is a fighter of the 127th separate territorial defense brigade, who passed a lot of hot fighting and forced the Russian group to retreat.

Title: Defense Ministers of Ukraine and Britain discussed military aid and the role of London in the Rammst...

Rustem Umyerov noted that Great Britain is ready to increase military aid to Ukraine, as well as more actively involve European partners in supporting the Armed Forces. The interlocutors considered the prospects of purchasing weapons at the expense of profits from confiscated assets of Russia. Title: -Hone Skill-: How -Edelweiss- prepare for battle
Description: Photos of combat training of fighters were shared on the brigade's page. -Each day is another step towards flawless execution of tasks,- says the brigade's message. Assault, defense, reconnaissance - all these areas require coordination, endurance and high professionalism. Ammunition, weapons, team spirit - everything works as a single mechanism. As a reminder, the 10th separate mountain assault brigade of the Armed Forces of Ukraine -Edelweiss- participates in the -Contract 18-24- project - this is a voluntary initiative that allows Ukrainians in the specified age category to join the Defense Forces of Ukraine for one year. The project offers a decent financial reward, professional combat training according to NATO standards and social guarantees that no civilian profession can provide. As reported by ArmyInform, fighters of the 109th mountain assault battalion found and destroyed the Russian radar station 1L219M -Zoopark-1-.

Title: General Staff of the Armed Forces: 72 combat clashes at the front, the occupiers are concentrating t...
Description: This is stated in the operational information of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine as of 16:00 on March 2. The occupiers continue to focus their efforts on the Pokrovsk, Toretsk and Kursk directions. In the Kupyansk direction, the enemy made one attempt to advance towards our positions in the area of ​​the Zagryzove settlement since the beginning of the day, which was successfully repelled by the Ukrainian defenders. Seven times the aggressor attacked the positions of our troops in the Lyman direction near the settlement of Nove and in the direction of Novomykhailivka. In the Kramatorsk direction, our defenders successfully repelled three enemy attacks in the areas of Chasovoy Yar, Hryhorivka, and Aleksandro-Shultyny. On the Toretsk direction the enemy attacked the defensive positions of our troops in the Toretsk and Shcherbinivka districts 12 times. So far, six clashes are ongoing. High activity of the enemy is currently maintained in the Pokrovsky direction. Thirteen times today clashes of varying intensity started here. Ukrainian soldiers repelled enemy attacks in the areas of Tarasivka, Promin, Pokrovsk, Kotlyne, Udachne, Kotlyarivka, Andriivka and Ulakly settlements. The settlements of Pokrovsk, Hryshyne and Leontovichi were hit by airstrikes. The occupiers tried four times to break through in the directions of Konstantinopol and Skudny in the direction of Novopavlovsk, but were stopped by our defenders. The enemy carried out airstrikes on the Voskresenka and Sichneve settlements. In the direction of Gulyaipol, the aggressor carried out airstrikes in the areas of Gulyaipol, Zaliznychny and Priyutny. In addition, the Defense Forces successfully repelled one enemy attack in the area of ​​Privilne settlement. The battle continues in the area of ​​Nesteryanka settlement in the Orihiv direction. In the Dnieper direction, the enemy twice stormed the positions of our defenders, one battle is currently ongoing. On the Kharkiv and Siversk directions since the beginning of the day, the enemy has not carried out active operations. In Kurshchyna, Ukrainian defenders repelled 14 attacks by invaders, eight more clashes are ongoing. In addition, the enemy carried out 10 air strikes using 17 guided bombs. Ukrainian troops are exhausting the enemy along the entire battle line and in the rear.

Title: Ukraine condemned the rotation of IAEA employees at the Zaporizhia NPP through the occupied territor...
Description: This is stated in a statement on the department's website. It is noted that these violations were the result of Russian blackmail and systematic attempts to impose illegal and contradictory mechanisms of activity on the temporarily occupied territories on international organizations. -Russia purposefully creates artificial obstacles for the activities of international organizations in Ukraine, forcing them to violate Ukrainian legislation, bilateral agreements with Ukraine, as well as to disregard the resolutions of the UN General Assembly,- the statement reads. The situation at the Russian-occupied Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant became a special example of such Russian blackmail. The occupiers actually forced the IAEA employees to stay at the station without rotation for 80 days, which is much longer than the planned period, keeping people under unprecedented psychological pressure, in a zone of increased risks. Moscow actually deprived international experts of their freedom of movement and used them as a tool of political pressure on the international community. Ukraine has repeatedly offered a safe and legal route of rotation through controlled territory. However, Moscow systematically refused the IAEA to provide security guarantees under these conditions. The Kremlin deliberately blocked the safe exit of specialists through the territory controlled by Ukraine, forcing the Agency to agree to Russian conditions. -We consider the actions of the IAEA not as a rotation of experts at the ZNPP, but as a humanitarian evacuation in conditions of threat to the lives and health of people who are employees of the Agency,- the Ministry of Foreign Affairs emphasized. Ukraine sent a note of protest to the leadership of the IAEA, in which it condemns the violation of the sovereignty and territorial integrity of our state and warns against repeating any similar actions in the future. The Ukrainian side will also raise the issue of unprecedented blackmail of the Russian Federation at the meeting of the IAEA Board of Governors in the coming days. Earlier on Sunday, information appeared that the IAEA could for the first time conduct a rotation at the ZNPP through the occupied territories of Ukraine. Probably, this could happen due to the territory of the Russian Federation and the temporarily occupied Crimea. So far, no official comments have been received from the IAEA regarding this information.

Title: 30 meters to the enemy: tankers of the Kyiv brigade about the fight without the right to make a mist...
Description: The tank crew was told in the -War-show- episode on Channel 5 of the separate Kyiv assault brigade. -When you get to the position and start working, it's the best feeling,- says Green, the crew chief. At the age of 21, he drives his car into hell, attacking the enemy from 20-30 meters. Thanks to the features of the T-80, they can approach almost imperceptibly: the turbine works more quietly, and the tracks do not create the usual rumble on soft ground. Each of their outings is a surgically precise shot. They drive up to a minimum distance, quickly work off and leave, leaving behind only the ruins of enemy fortifications. -We worked in the dugout - 20-30 meters, almost close to each other. I've seen the enemy live, and my only desire is to bury him there so he doesn't come out again,- admits Green. A tank in war is an armored bastion, but it is not immortal either. FPV drones have changed the rules of the game: if previously the main threats were artillery and ATGMs, now the main danger is kamikaze drones. -Before, you drove without fear, but now you don't think about artillery or mines, but only about a drone that can fly into a hatch or into an ammunition kit,- the fighters say. The most intense moment is the fighting in Ivanovo. They went out in the morning to destroy the fortified house in which the enemies were holed up. 18 shells and the building was reduced to rubble. And when the Russians tried to return fire, the T-80 crew quickly found and destroyed the enemy BMP hiding behind the house. -Bekha was 60 meters away. One shot - and she was already on fire,- recalls gunner Cherny. But not all departures are perfect. In one of the last battles, the enemy hit a tank - the debris pierced the hatch, and the driver-mechanic Moroz was injured. -Shards flew into the face, and a lump of earth also flew. But there is no blood, so we continue to work,- he says. Each exit of the tank crew is support for the infantry fighting for every meter of Ukrainian land. -When you come back and the guys are waving at you from the trenches, it's the best feeling. They understand that we have not abandoned them, that we are with them,- the tankers say. The war changed them. No more fear, no more hesitation. -It used to be scary, now it's not. You drive, you work, and even your knees don't tremble anymore. There is only one goal - to beat the enemy until we drive them out,- says Commander Green. The 5th Separate Assault Brigade is always looking for new fighters. -If you have a desire, come. We teach everything: driving, navigation, shooting. Anyone can become a tanker, we have places for both mechanics and support,- the soldiers assure. -Don't hesitate. Come to the 5th assault team - let's beat the enemy together!- they say. As reported by ArmyInform, the roar of shots, harmonious work and life between battles - this is what daily life of artillerymen of the 56th separate motorized infantry brigade of Mariupol. They are an integral part of the defense, its -shield and striking power-, working in advance, striking where the enemy does not expect it.

Title: Character of Steel: The Story of a Marine Who Turned Mining Experience into Military Prowess
Description: The story of the fighter was made public on the page of the Naval Forces of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. Since 2023, Anton has been serving in the reconnaissance battalion of the marines, where, despite his young age and lack of experience in leading people in civilian life, he successfully performs the duties of a unit commander. -My motivation is simple. I treat the service as a job. It just so happens that I'm here, so I have to do my job at a high level. The main thing is to preserve the life and health of my subordinates. I have to teach them well and provide them with everything they need,- Anton shares. During his service, the marine was repeatedly wounded and participated in operations on the left bank of the Dnieper. The work of a scout requires a lot of preparation, endurance and often goes to the limits of human capabilities. The main task of intelligence is to obtain information that becomes the basis for planning operations. This requires knowledge and high motivation. It depends on the commander how he will find an approach to each fighter, build discipline and the training process. -I firmly believe in my people. They have repeatedly proven their professionalism in critical situations. We will win this war together and return home together,- Anton is confident. As ArmiyaInform reported, -I was almost covered by a drone,- says a 20-year-old fighter of the -Rubizh- brigade of the National Guard of Ukraine with the call sign -Quiet- with a smile. Despite his young age, he already managed to go through the flames of war, be in occupation, go abroad and return to the Motherland to defend it from the Russian invaders.

Title: -Knights- received hundreds of applications for the new project -Contract -18-24-
Description: Yevhen Alkhimov, press officer of the 28th OMBr, told about this on the air of the telethon Edyny Novyni. -We have several hundred new applications. People leave despite the fact that the positions are not easy, they are infantry positions, scouts. But citizens under the age of 24 are best suited for such a job,- said Yevhen Alkhimov. One of the advantages for recruits will be that the instructors of the 28th OMBr will work with them in the training center. -They are training under the conditions of current hostilities, the training is of better quality, because we have to fight with these people and we are interested in their training,- the press officer explained. He added that the brigade's recruiting center also continues to recruit volunteers outside of this program, as people are needed for very different positions, from cook to tank commander. -People are most needed in the infantry, as they need to be replaced. Now the most difficult thing is not even to be in positions, but to make rotations, for this you need people. We are looking for UAV pilots, as we bet on unmanned systems in battles. We are doing everything so that the infantry enters the battle as little as possible-, As ArmyInform reported, the brigades are already preparing the first recruits, who joined the Armed Forces within the framework of the -Contract 18-24- project. The first volunteers are already undergoing training in 72 separate mechanized brigades named after the Black Zaporozhets. As a reminder, -Contrakt 18-24- is a voluntary initiative that allows Ukrainians in the specified age category to join the Defense Forces of Ukraine for one year. The project offers a decent financial reward, professional combat training according to NATO standards and social guarantees that no civilian profession provides.

Title: I like to be a hunter, not a victim-: the story of an attack aircraft -Dryus- from Luhansk region
Description: The story of the fighter was made public on page 58 of the separate motorized infantry brigade named after Hetman Ivan Vyhovsky -They said: we are too old to change life. No persuasion worked,- Andrii recalls. He himself left at the age of 18, entering the Kharkiv educational institution as a dental technician. But a full-scale invasion changed everything: at the age of 24, he joined the army. Due to his health, Andrei was initially sent to the rear unit, where he served until last year. However, the desire to fight did not leave him. Repeated requests to be transferred to a combat unit finally yielded results: he ended up in the 58th Motorized Infantry Brigade, and later in an assault unit fighting in Donbas. -I remember my first fight well. It wasn't scary at all - I just didn't understand anything yet. We were driven to the enemy trenches on an -emka- (American armored personnel carrier M113). While they were disembarking, our machine gunner fired. We caught the enemy by surprise, threw grenades, cleared the position and got out without casualties,- says Andriy. But war teaches quickly. -When the guys you live with don't come back from the war one day, when you see empty beds, the realization comes. And before each next assault, you think that this could be your last fight,- the fighter admits. Andriy is convinced: active attack is his element. -Attack or defense? Of course, storm! I'm an impatient person, I need to act. Once I had to sit in defense, so I almost lost my mind. Tossed off the bronik and climbed up to the parapet to smoke - at least some fun. I like to be in an active position, in the role of the hunter, not the victim,- he explains. Assaults, well-aimed strikes, destruction of the enemy - this is the life of -Drews- today. And behind his shoulders is an occupied home, his parents who remained, and his hometown, for which he is fighting. This war is personal for him. And he's not going to stop. As reported by ArmyInform, Denis under the pseudonym -Forest- is a fighter of the 127th separate territorial defense brigade, who passed a lot of hot fighting and forced the Russian group to retreat.

Title: OTU -Luhansk-: the enemy reduced the number of assaults in February, mostly attacked in the Toretsk ...
Description: This was said on the air of the -Edyny Novyni- telethon, the spokesman of the -Luhansk- OTU, Lt. Col. Dmytro Zaporozhets. -Some of our units have already summed up the results for the month, and it is the component of assault actions that indicates that their number in our operational zone has decreased,- said Dmytro Zaporozhets. The spokesman reported that 839 enemy assaults were recorded in January, while 533 enemy assaults were recorded in February. The majority is in the Toretsk direction. -In general, along the entire line of combat, the enemy is carrying out certain activities, logistical movements, movement of personnel. Perhaps this is connected with the change of leaders from the aggressor in certain areas of the front, who want to show some activity,- the spokesman said. As reported by ArmyInform, the enemy made 15 attacks in the areas of populated areas in the Toretsk direction Krymske, Dachne, Toretsk and Diliivka.

Title: Lithuania invests in joint production of weapons with Ukraine
Description: The Ministry of Defense of Lithuania informed about this The corresponding decision was agreed upon at a meeting between Defense Minister of Lithuania Dovila Shakaliene, Oleksandr Kamyshin, senior adviser to the President of Ukraine on strategic issues, and Herman Smetanin, Minister of Strategic Industry of Ukraine. Doville Shakaliene noted that the Ukrainian defense industry has incredible potential to become a world-class player thanks to a high level of expertise based on direct combat experience, motivation and competence of engineers. -Lithuania will continue to invest in the Ukrainian defense industry, purchasing in Ukraine for Ukraine. 20 million euros have already been allocated for this, and this amount will continue to grow. However, we seek even closer cooperation — to develop joint Lithuanian-Ukrainian arms production both in Lithuania and Ukraine,- she said. -We will always be grateful to Lithuania for the support it has given us since day one. And the simultaneous development of the defense industry in Lithuania is a powerful next step that strengthens NATO's eastern flank,- said Oleksandr Kamyshyn. For security reasons, the specific types of weapons involved in the agreement have not been disclosed. In the near future, joint meetings of representatives of Ukraine and Lithuania will be held in Lithuania, where details of the implementation of the agreement will be discussed.

Title: -The white helmet saved-: 20-year-old -Tikhyy- from -Rubizh- about drones, the battle near Lozova an...
Description: The story of the fighter was made public on the page of the National Guard of Ukraine. -Tyhiy- joined the -Rubizh- brigade at the end of 2023 and is currently temporarily acting as the grenade launcher platoon commander. He does not hesitate to answer the question about his motivation: -Who, if not young people, -move-? During the war, you get skills that you could not have acquired in civilian life under any circumstances.- His combat experience is impressive. During the battles near Lozova, covering the Ukrainian infantry from the American MK19 automatic grenade launcher, -Tykhy- was 100 meters from the positions of the occupiers. -It was not possible to fire for a long time - the enemy actively responded,- he recalls. During the maneuvers, when their dugout became overcrowded, Tikhoi was almost covered by an enemy drone. -My trademark white helmet saved me, as they told me on the walkie-talkie,- the fighter laughs. In that battle, unfortunately, there were losses, but -Silent- managed to save the lives of his wounded comrades. -On the way, it was necessary to provide assistance to neighbors. Their lungs were cut by shrapnel. If you didn't know MARCH (algorithm for providing medical care), you wouldn't have been saved. They ran out of first-aid kits - we took everything out of ours, shared what everyone had in excess,- he says. -Tykhy- has been performing the duties of the platoon commander for four months. -Not that I wanted to, but I didn't mind either,- he says. -I came here to do a job.- After basic military training, he was sent to Norway, where he completed the unit commander's course and received the appropriate certificate. -The main thing in the position of a platoon leader is for people to understand what is required of them. There are not many people in the platoon, I try to pay enough attention to everyone,- shares -Tyhyy-. As reported by ArmyInform, Denis under the pseudonym -Forest- is a fighter of the 127th separate territorial defense brigade, who passed a lot of hot fighting and forced the Russian group to retreat.

Title: Elite hunters of Ukraine: -Group 13- struck 15 ships and 3 helicopters of the Russian Federation in ...
Description: The video of the combat work of -Group 13- was published on the page of the special unit of the GUR MOU -Artan-. In two years, -Group 13- managed to hit 15 ships of the Black Sea Fleet of the aggressor state, nine of which were completely destroyed. These successes have become possible thanks to the continuous improvement of weapons and innovative approaches to combat operations. One of the most striking achievements of -Group 13- was the destruction of an enemy air target with the help of a naval drone. On December 31, 2024, special forces fighters fired missiles from Magura V5 platforms at three Russian Mi-8 helicopters. Two of them were destroyed by drowning in the Black Sea. This became the first case in the world when an aerial target was destroyed by a strike from a naval drone. -Group 13- continues to demonstrate high professionalism and efficiency in the defense of Ukraine. Their successes are an important contribution to the fight against Russian aggression. -Congratulations, brothers. Have a successful hunt!-, says the message of the special unit of the GUR -Artan-. As reported by ArmyInform, the Main Directorate of Intelligence of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine revealed the details of a unique special operation during which domestic Magura V5 surface drones href=-https://armyinform.com.ua/2025/01/06/na-cherzi-litaky-gur-rozkrylo-detali-zuhvaloyi-speczoperacziyi-zi-znyshhennya-rosijskyh-mi-8-nad-chornym-morem/->for the first time in the history of hostilities, Russian Mi-8s managed to shoot down over the Black Sea.

Title: -Fake report-: Russia is trying to discredit Ukraine in the eyes of international partners
Description: informs the GUR of the IOU about this. In recent days, fake information accusing the Main Intelligence Directorate of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine (GUR MOU) of an alleged attempt to provoke an armed conflict between Azerbaijan and Armenia has been actively spreading in the Armenian information space, in particular in Telegram channels. Propagandists claim that a new war between these countries will force Russia to open a -second front- and disperse its troops, which is allegedly beneficial to Ukraine. The -proof- of these accusations is a fake report, allegedly from the Ministry of Internal Affairs and Communications, addressed to the Deputy Minister of Defense of Ukraine, Ivan Havryliuk. This document contains numerous gross errors, such as -Yivan- instead of -Ivan-, -SDR- instead of -YEDRPOU-, and also does not meet the requirements of the official documents of Ukraine. The GUR of the IOU declares that this information operation is aimed at discrediting Ukraine and worsening its relations with Armenia and Azerbaijan. It is primarily beneficial to Russia, which seeks to weaken international support for Ukraine. -Conducting the indicated information operation is aimed at discrediting Ukraine and worsening Ukrainian-Armenian and Ukrainian-Azerbaijani relations, which is beneficial primarily for the aggressor state of Russia,- the message of the GUR of the IOU reads. Ukrainian intelligence calls on citizens and the international community to be vigilant and not succumb to provocations. As ArmiyaInform reported, the head of the Main Directorate of Intelligence of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine, Lieutenant General Kyrylo Budanov, said that Russia will continue to try to destabilize the situation in Ukraine. However, according to him, all hostile actions will receive a worthy rebuff.

Title: Changed the chair of the driving school director to a trench: the story of Oleksandr Karbashevskyi
Description: Today we will talk about one of the regional branches of the TSOU — Chernivtsi regional, which is headed by reserve colonel Oleksandr Karbashevskyi. During the anti-terrorist operation, he, a reserve colonel of the regional department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs, put on an army uniform with the epaulets of a senior sergeant and spent almost two years -at ground zero- as a unit commander. Then, after freeing himself, he once again led the Bukovyna defenders. Well, on February 24, 2022, after the invasion of the Russians, I immediately packed my bag and went to the TCC. He spoke about what made him take such a decision, the help that the regional organization of the Society provides to our army. -There is such a feeling as if you have not done something important in your life-… - When the Russians came to -liberate- us, what were your first actions? — There was no shock or confusion: no one expected anything else from such nonsense as Putin and his Kremlin supporters. At that time, our region had not yet come under shelling, which made it possible to hold a quick operational meeting with the directors of our divisions, to determine priority actions to ensure the preservation of documents and property, additional forms of communication, and more, using mobile communications. — At one time, you, a reserve colonel of the Ministry of Internal Affairs, the head of one of the regional police units, wore an army uniform and, wearing the shoulder straps of a senior sergeant, commanded a department in the ATO/OOS area. And after the large-scale Russian invasion, they joined the army again and served in the district TCC for several years. What made you want to serve again? — Yes, there was something like that in my life. You know, there is a feeling as if you haven't done something important in your life, haven't given it your all, as they say in such cases. Apparently, something similar came to me then, affecting me as a person who wore epaulettes for most of my conscious life. Therefore, he changed the chair of the director of the Kitzman driving school to a trench. How did I end up in the army a second time? On the morning of February 24, 2022, he arrived at the territorial picking center. Hundreds of volunteers were already being sought there. Having gone through all the necessary procedures in such cases. The very next day he was mobilized to the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Then we all had one thing in our minds - to protect our country, people, family from the Russians, who came here to destroy us, our children and grandchildren. Everyone who came to the TCC that day did not know where they would serve, in the rear or at the front. At least I didn't try to stay as far from the front as possible. But it turned out differently: unlike the times of the ATO/UOS, I did not fight with a -Kalash- in my hands. But he performed mobilization tasks to provide the army with vehicles. The decision to join the army for the second time was also influenced by the fact that, during his stay in the ATO area, he had the opportunity to see with his own eyes the -humanism- of the Russians in relation to our soldiers and officers, as well as the civilian population. But these horrors, which they commit today on our land, exceed those thousands of times. The ancient Persian philosopher-humanist Omar Khayyam said the following words: -Never regret what you did if you were happy at that moment.- Yes, they can be interpreted in different ways, but adequate people who do not have faulty thinking and psyche will understand them as Omar Khayyam himself understood them. -My son supported my decision to join the army- - How did your family react to your decision to join the army again? — My son serves in the National Police. He understood me. And there are no former officers. Well, what about the wife, daughter… What to say? They were not delighted, but treated my step with understanding. They did not want and do not want the people of Chernivtsi to repeat the fate of Buchi, and the whole of Bukovyna lived according to the wolf laws of the occupiers. However, the Syromans have laws by which they live, perhaps, more humane. About the charity project for training young people and restoring equipment for the front - I know that today you and your colleagues are implementing a project to create an educational institution where UAV pilots will be trained. Tell us in more detail what it involves, what the training period will be, where you will find specialists who will teach the guys to master this newest weapon. — UAVs have convincingly proven and continue to prove their effectiveness in war. But, apart from them, we desperately need people who know how to manage them, destroying both the enemy's manpower and its equipment. At the moment, we have decided on the location of the training, purchased simulators, relevant training programs, and part of the necessary aircraft. We are looking for training specialists, there are considerable difficulties with this. We want to launch this project for student youth on a charitable basis, and for the adult population for a fee. — Bukovyna defenders began to provide volunteer assistance to our army back in 2014. Does this work somehow continue after a large-scale enemy invasion? — Yes, emergency aid to the defenders of the Ukrainian land began to be provided more than 10 years ago, when I did not yet work in the Society, and therefore it is difficult for me to operate with numbers. But I know for sure that Chernivtsi OO TSO of Ukraine, like all other regional units, made every effort to help our soldiers. Starting in the spring of 2022, we are not outside observers either. Members of the Chernivtsi regional organization are actively involved in fundraising for the purchase of technical means or other items for the needs of the Armed Forces. The largest financial project recently has been the restoration of cars by the forces of driving schools, which are so needed at the front. Hundreds of thousands of hryvnias were spent for this. They also bought all-wheel drive Opel Frontera and UAZ-452 cars at their own expense. Responding to the request of the military, they helped in the restoration of other equipment, in particular, welding UAZ-452 all-wheel drive cars, as well as the GAZELLE minibus. However, assistance to the Ukrainian army is not limited to the purchase and repair of automobile equipment. For example, from the moment of the large-scale invasion of the Russian Federation, the Chernivtsi driving school provides premises free of charge for the needs of the personnel of various divisions, as well as for volunteers who carry out restoration and repair work on machinery, equipment, and inventory. Premises with an area of ​​more than 100 -squares- were provided for the storage of humanitarian aid. Members of our regional defense unit, mobilized to the ranks of the Armed Forces, are also not left without financial support. Yes, at their request, my colleagues collected and transferred to their units funds for the purchase of necessary military equipment and equipment. A lot of assistance is provided to charitable foundations, public organizations, local territorial defense units, and internally displaced persons. We do not believe that our help will significantly contribute to our victory. But I am sure that every Ukrainian, if he is one not only according to his passport, should do what he can for the sake of this victory. After all, small rivers form large ones, and those form seas and oceans. It is the same today in Ukraine: every hryvnia given to our defenders is a kind of nail in the coffin into which all of Moscow must turn. As reported by ArmyInform, soldier Rodion with the call sign -White- from the fire support company of the 228th battalion of the 127th separate brigade of the Armed Forces of the Armed Forces of the ZSU. He stopped a group of Russian infantry that was trying to break through to Ukrainian positions on motorcycles.

Title: -Sky hunters-: -Omega- in a matter of days -landed- five enemy drones in Donetsk region
Description: The video of the combat work was made public on the page of the Omega TSP -Sky hunters- from Omega successfully -landed- four Zala drones and one Orlan. The occupiers used these drones to conduct reconnaissance and transmit video information, which poses a significant threat to the Ukrainian military and civilians. Each downed drone is not only enemy equipment destroyed, but also lives saved. Thanks to the accurate work of the -Omegi- people, the sky over Donetsk region is becoming safer. -With each defeat, Ukrainian soldiers and civilians become more secure. A good job in the sky!-, says the message of the Special Purpose Center -Omega- of NSU. As reported by ArmyInform, the occupiers who hoped for a cozy shelter received a real -effect surprises- from the operators of UAV 5 of the separate special purpose unit -Omega-. The Ukrainian drone accurately sent the enemy dugout into oblivion, destroying both the shelter and its temporary residents.

Title: Blood is for our heroes: the occupiers forcefully drive budget workers and students to donation driv...
Description: This is reported by the Center of National Resistance. The reason for such actions is the huge losses that the Russian army is suffering at the front. The occupiers are trying to replenish blood supplies for wounded soldiers by using the civilian population of the occupied territories. Putin's party -United Russia- takes an active part in the organization of donor actions. Over the past few days, members of the party have forcibly driven at least 350 residents of occupied Luhansk to mobile laboratories. In the end, they reported to the Kremlin about 177 liters of collected blood. It was not without propaganda statements in the spirit of -the people and the army are one-, with which the occupiers try to justify their actions. Such actions are systematic in the temporarily occupied territories of Ukraine. In particular, in temporarily occupied Henichesk, local collaborators held a -Donor Day- with the involvement of a mobile laboratory for collecting donor blood. As reported by ArmyInform, the Russian occupiers have deployed a new filtration camp in the temporarily occupied territories of Ukraine, where local residents are forcibly detained. The camp is designed for 1,000 people and is intended to -test the loyalty- of residents of recently captured settlements.

Title: One step ahead: how Ukrainian EW specialists resist enemy technologies
Description: The video of combat work was published on the brigade's page. Despite the fact that the Russian occupiers are constantly improving their systems, the REB company of the 80th brigade not only successfully opposes them, but also often outpaces them in the technological race. In its own workshop, the brigade's specialists create means that detect and neutralize enemy reconnaissance drones, and also improve systems to combat FPV drones, one of the main threats on the battlefield. -This is an invisible dome that protects our guys,- is how the work of the EW company in the 80th Brigade is described. For security reasons, detailed information about the technology and its use on the battlefield has not been disclosed. This is done in order to maintain an advantage over the enemy and to ensure the effectiveness of the unit. This reconnaissance drone, worth about 100,000 dollars, is able to rise to a height of up to 5 kilometers, penetrate 100 kilometers deep into Ukrainian territory and develop a speed of up to 120 kilometers per hour. -It was a challenge to catch her, but our FPV pilots did it!- - says the message of the 63rd OMBr. Title: Beaver on a bird: the story of a Volyn warrior who destroys the enemy from the sky
Description: The story of the fighter was made public on the brigade's page. -My father, who has been serving since the beginning, had the call sign -Beaver-. When I later joined the unit, I received the call sign -Beaver Lesser-, and after moving to my current position, I became a simple -Beaver-, says the fighter. -Beaver- went through a difficult combat path, starting with service in the support unit and ending with participation in the battles in the Serebryan Forest and near Ocheretyn. He compares these areas with Toretsk, where he currently serves, and says that urban development creates many unpleasant nuances. During one of the combat missions near Toretsk, -Beaver- was seriously injured. -It was a landing in a forest lane near the tericon. There were three of us. On the first night, 80- and 120-mm mortars flew at our position (80- and 120-millimeter mortars - ed.) and we were slightly injured, but we continued to hold the designated line. The next day, the enemy aircraft started working, covering us with KABs. After the second such arrival, as a result of the blast wave, my eardrums ruptured,- the fighter recalls. After treatment and rehabilitation, -Beaver- returned to the front, but later, due to certain circumstances, he went to the SZCH, from where he soon returned. -Returning from the SZCH to the unit, I was mentally ready to continue serving in the infantry, but I understood that my physical condition would not allow me to fully perform the tasks assigned to me, so I asked the command to transfer me to the BpLA unit, and I was given the green light,- Valentin says. Now -Beaver- is a UAV operator in the 1st rifle battalion of the 100th OMBr. He is engaged in dropping -gifts- on the heads of invaders and plans to do so until the last occupier leaves Ukrainian land. -What's more, a fighter whose life motto is: 'Always forward' simply cannot do otherwise, especially when his mother Svitlana Evgeniyevna, two younger brothers: Andriy and Viktor and his beloved girlfriend Sabrina are waiting for him in the rear,- the publication says. As reported by ArmiyaInform, this story is about Oleg with the call sign -Gran-, who until the age of 45 had nothing to do with the army, but in 2024 received a summons and without hesitation stood up for the defense of Ukraine as part of the 100th separate mechanized brigade.

Title: A moment of silence in Ukraine
Description: -In order to honor the bright memory, civic courage and self-sacrifice, strength of spirit, resilience and heroic deed of the soldiers who fell during the execution of combat missions to protect the state sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine, civilians who died as a result of the armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine, I decree: to start holding a national minute of silence every day at 9:00 a.m. for compatriots who died as a result of the armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine, which should be announced in all mass media, regardless of the form of ownership,- the document says.

Title: Over the past 24 hours, 97 military clashes have been recorded — the General Staff of the Armed Forc...
Description: Operational information as of 8:00 March 2 was published by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Yesterday, the enemy carried out two missile and 99 air strikes, used two missiles and dropped 146 anti-aircraft missiles. In addition, the enemy carried out more than five thousand two hundred attacks, including 180 from reactive salvo fire systems, and also engaged 3,067 kamikaze drones for destruction. The aggressor carried out airstrikes, in particular in the areas of the following settlements: Okhrimivka, Makarove, Graniv, Bohuslavka, Bugaivka, Borova, Kostyantynivka, Toretsk, Novopavlivka, Pokrovsk, Novoukrainka, Udachne, Grodivka, Rodynske, Bagatyr, Komar, Shevchenko, Ternove, Gulyaipole, Stepnohirsk, Zaliznychne, Pyatikhatki, Antonivka and Mykolaivka. Over the past day, missile troops and artillery of the Defense Forces hit four areas of concentration of personnel, weapons and military equipment, three enemy control points and four enemy artillery systems. In the Kupyansk direction, the aggressor carried out three offensives near Novoosynovo and Zagryzovo, and was repulsed. In the Lyman direction the enemy attacked 11 times. Tried to penetrate our defenses near the settlements of Nove, Novomykhailivka, Yampolivka, Makiivka and in the direction of Katerynivka. In the Toretsk direction the enemy carried out 15 attacks in the areas of Krymske, Dachne, Toretsk and Dilyivka settlements. In the Pokrovsky direction, our defenders stopped 27 offensive actions of the aggressor in the direction of Nova Poltavka, Tarasivka, Elizavetivka, Promeny, Kotlyarivka, Nadiivka, Pokrovsk, Pischany, Udachny, Preobrazhenka, Bohdanivka, Andriivka, and Ulakli. In the Novopavlovsk direction, yesterday, the enemy carried out 11 attacks in the areas of Kostiantynopil, Burlatsk and Skudna settlements. In the Gulyajpil direction, the enemy attacked the positions of our defenders three times in the Privilny and Charivny districts. On the Orihiv direction, the occupying forces stormed the positions of the Defense Forces four times in the districts of Pyatikhatok, Nesteryanka, and Kamianskyi. In the Dnieper direction our soldiers successfully repelled one enemy attack. In the Volyn and Poliske directions no signs of the formation of enemy offensive groups were detected. In the Kharkiv, Siver and Kramatorsk directions, the enemy did not carry out offensive actions last day. Defense forces of Ukraine continue the operation in Kursk region. Last day, the enemy carried out 31 airstrikes, shooting down 47 anti-aircraft missiles, and fired 440 shots, including 4 from anti-aircraft missiles. Ukrainian defenders repelled 16 assaults by invaders. Our soldiers inflict significant losses in manpower, equipment and actively undermine the offensive potential of the enemy in the rear to the occupying forces. In general, the Russian invaders lost 1,110 people last day. Ukrainian soldiers also destroyed 8 tanks, 25 armored combat vehicles, 51 artillery systems, two rocket salvo fire systems, three air defense vehicles, 192 UAVs of the operational-tactical level, 117 vehicles and 5 units of special equipment of the occupiers.

Title: Volodymyr Zelenskyi in London: new agreements on security support for Ukraine
Description: This was reported by the head of the Ukrainian state on his page. In the presence of the two leaders, a loan agreement between Ukraine and Great Britain was signed. Funds that will be directed to strengthening the Ukrainian defense industry will be returned at the expense of revenues from frozen Russian assets. -It is so fair: the one who started the war must pay,- Volodymyr Zelenskyy emphasized. The president thanked the British government and people for their steadfast support of Ukraine since the very beginning of the full-scale invasion. Ukraine and Great Britain maintain a common vision of the future, which is based on security, stability and strengthening of the international legal order. The signed agreement opens up the possibility of expanding the production of weapons directly in Ukraine, which is a strategic step to strengthen the state's defense. Great Britain continues to be one of Ukraine's key allies in the fight against Russian aggression. As reported by ArmyInform, according to the President, Ukraine, like no one else in the world, seeks peace. But it must be a just and lasting peace.

Title: In the Pokrovsky direction, Ukrainian defenders repelled 21 enemy attacks
Description: This is in the operational information of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine as of 10:00 p.m. March 1. Ukrainian defenders continue to resolutely repel the enemy's attempts to advance deep into our territory, inflicting fire damage on it. Today, the Russian invaders launched two missile and 76 air strikes, deployed two missiles and 95 guided bombs, used 987 kamikaze drones and fired more than 4,000 attacks on the positions of our troops and populated areas. In the Kharkiv direction, the enemy carried out airstrikes with air defense systems on Okhrimovka, Makarovka, Bugaivka and Granov. In the Kupyansk direction, the aggressor carried out three offensives near Novoosynovo and Zagryzovo, and was repulsed. In the Lyman direction Russian invaders attacked the positions of the Defense Forces near Novy, Novomykhailivka, Yampolivka and in the direction of Katerynivka 10 times, eight attacks have already been repelled, two are ongoing. Borova and Boguslavka were hit by enemy airstrikes. In the Toretsk direction our soldiers repelled 13 enemy attacks in the areas of Krymske, Dachne, Toretsk and Dilyivka settlements. Kostyantynivka and Toretsk were hit by airstrikes. In the Pokrovsky direction, since the beginning of the last day, the enemy attacked 21 times in the districts of Novaya Poltavka, Elizavetivka, Promenya, Kotlyarivka, Nadezhdinka, Pokrovsk, Pischany, Udachny, Preobrazhenka, Bohdanivka, Andriivka, and Ulakli. Enemy aviation struck with anti-aircraft missiles at Pokrovsk, Udachny, Grodivka, Novopavlivka and Novoukrainka. Today, in this direction, according to preliminary data, Ukrainian soldiers neutralized 236 occupiers, 116 of them irreversibly. They also destroyed four units of automobile equipment, a D-30 gun, 14 BpLA, eight motorcycles, two ATVs, two armored personnel carriers, a mortar, BMP, an armored tractor, seven BpLA control antennas and six communication antennas, and also damaged a tank, an armored combat vehicle, a self-propelled artillery installation, a mortar and a motorcycle of the occupiers. In the Novopavlovsk direction, the enemy made eight attempts to break through our defenses in the direction of the settlements of Kostiantynopil and Skudne. There is currently one battle going on. Komar and Shevchenko were hit by airstrikes. In the Gulyajpil direction, the invaders attacked three times in the direction of Privilny and Charivny. Ternove, Gulyaipole and Zaliznychne were hit by airstrikes. In the Orykhiv direction, the invaders, with the support of aviation, tried to advance in the districts of Pyatikhatok, Nesteryanka, and Kamiansky, Ukrainians repelled all four enemy attacks. In the Dnieper direction, the occupation troops are conducting one offensive operation, the battle is ongoing. On the Kursk direction, Ukrainian defenders repelled 16 enemy attacks today. At the same time, the enemy carried out 22 air strikes, dropped a total of 30 guided bombs, and launched 383 artillery strikes, including 4 from rocket salvo systems. In the rest of the directions, the operational situation did not undergo any significant changes. Soldiers of the 118th Separate Mechanized Brigade, 406th Separate Artillery Brigade were honored at the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, who are effectively destroying the enemy, causing significant losses in manpower and equipment.

Title: Nizhna -Trembita-, rejection of the TCC and the golden age of artillery: the story of the gunner -Ru...
Description: Her story, told for ArmiyaTV, is not just a dry service report. This is an explosive mixture of courage, discipline and the fight against stereotypes, which proves that at the front a woman can not only keep up with men, but sometimes surpass them. Runa knows what looks like surprise or skepticism. She laughs at how civilians still can't get used to women in the army: -Society still doesn't fully understand that a woman on the front can perform combat tasks on par with men, and sometimes even better than them. The military got used to this a long time ago, but with the civilians… They see a military man in uniform on the street and automatically think it's a man.- Her love for weapons was born in school, when she first picked up a machine gun. The dream of becoming a soldier burned in her despite everything: upbringing in a boarding school, distant relations with her parents - these difficulties only hardened her. Her sister and friends supported her, admiring the courage that drove her forward. The path to the army was not easy. At first, Runa was refused at the district TCC - there were no vacancies. -I was so disappointed that I went home in tears,- she recalls. But fate loves the brave: the same day she received a call with an offer to serve. Without hesitation, she packed her things and jumped on the train and headed to the training center. It was the beginning - sharp as a shot and irreversible… Since 2018, a girl is in the Armed Forces, and her crew is not just a team, but a real combat family. There is everyone here: from young fighters to a 55-year-old veteran who could have retired but chose the front. -My crew is all men. The oldest is 55 years old, retired from civilian life, but continues to serve and protect the country. The crew ranges from young to those with decades of experience. We work as one mechanism. While working, everyone listens to my commands: -Fire!-, -Stop!-, -Recoil!- — everything is going smoothly, because I have the best boyfriends,- she says. There are also old-timers, like a soldier with the call sign -Volt-, who has been with Runa since 2018, and newcomers who quickly learn in the hot conditions of war. Everyone knows that when Rune shouts -Fire!-, the cannon obeys and the enemy trembles. In 2019, she entered the Tavri State University of Agrotechnology in Marketing. Service, courses at night, distance learning, she juggled it all, even when a full-scale invasion closed her way to field sessions. After completing her bachelor's degree, she went on to do her master's part-time. When the cannon falls silent, Runa opens her laptop. In war, there is no time for swagger. Every day is training for a real battle. Recruits learn on the fly, but everyone here is a volunteer, charged with the desire to defend their land. -We are the only ones working so close to the enemy. When we leave, they immediately know who we are by radio communication. The guys from the infantry often give thanks for the support, especially during assault operations. Some have tried to work from a longer distance, but experience has shown that firepower is lost. We drive up, complete the tasks and leave, changing positions several times a day,- the girl says. Their weapon is the old but legendary AZP-57, affectionately known as the Trembita. -When it was given to us, it worked as it should. I have been on it for almost two years. To this - ZU-23-2. Over time, the cannon wears out, but regular maintenance, cleaning and repairs allow it to hit the enemy effectively. Sometimes it breaks - some finger or charging mechanism flies out, but after repair it -sings- again. We even call her 'Trembita': when she deploys in a battle stance, it looks incredible,- laughs Runa. War has changed. In 2022, Runa still didn't know what FPV drones or EW were, and now she doesn't do a single step without them. Drones buzz overhead, targeting the KamAZ, but EW systems save the day. -When we hear the sound of an FPV drone, everyone crouches down. But there is no protection on the KamAZ - neither armor nor shelter. Therefore, in such a situation, we make a quick rollback. We are chased not only by artillery, but also by drones. You need to constantly listen to the front, the sky, and still perform tasks,- she shares. But despite the technology of the enemy, artillery is its trump card. -In fact, every day is a golden time for artillery for us. There is enough work both during the day and at night,- says Runa. Her call sign is no accident. The Teyvaz rune tattoo on her neck, made in the Pokrovsky direction, became her amulet. The symbol of a warrior and a winner perfectly reflects her spirit. And there is also sport, which keeps her in good shape. -It's not about perfect workouts, it's about movement,- she explains. Between departures - 20-30 minutes for push-ups, press or improvised dumbbells made of water eggplants. Boots instead of sneakers, but the main thing is not to stop. Her dream? Own sports hall. Initially, she planned to live in Mariupol, but the war changed her plans: -I have a dream, but I will realize it after the war. At first I wanted to do it in Mariupol. The main thing is not in Kyiv, because this metropolis is too noisy. I really like Chernivtsi - a city with a unique atmosphere, reminiscent of Lviv.- Rune is not just a name. It is a symbol of force that breaks patterns. Her cannon thunders on the front lines, her voice rules the battle, and her dreams live on even in the chaos of war. Women on the frontline are not an exception, but a reality that Runa now embodies every day…
