Like who went to the border now - there are already 200 of them, the woman said. As reported by ArmyInform, in a conversation intercepted by Ukrainian intelligence, a resident of the Bryansk region of the Russian Federation criticizes Russian dictator Vladimir Putin for continuing criminal war against Ukraine.

Title: F-16, air defense systems and billions of dollars: the President told what help to expect from partn...
Description: The President's Office informs about this. -I spoke with President Macron about his visit to America, we are coordinating our actions. to Emmanuel Also, our team has already started working with what the partners promised yesterday in Kyiv, at the Ukraine support summit,- he said. According to him, Britain will provide military aid this year - more than 5.5 billion dollars. -Norway confirms aid at the level of 3.5 billion dollars, we also have support for energy security and the humanitarian sphere. Spain - €1 billion this year, we really appreciate this focus on support. Sweden is preparing the transfer of air defense systems - thank you,- the head of state said. In addition, Denmark will provide an additional 285 million dollars for weapons and ammunition for Ukrainian soldiers. -We are working to increase our F-16 fleet - this year we should reach all the planned indicators. The Baltic states, together with the Nordics, will provide equipment and training of the brigade-sized units,- said Volodymyr Zelenskyi. Estonia has also prepared a support package, and there are agreements with Lithuania on further joint steps for defense, including the defense of the sky. -On the eve of February 24, new decisions on sanctions against Russia for the war were adopted: the European Union agreed on a new package, there are sanctions decisions by Britain, Australia, and New Zealand. Thank you all for your support! And there will be more solutions. Now we are actively preparing them - meetings, agreements, negotiations,- the President said. Volodymyr Zelenskyi emphasized that Ukraine must be strong so that diplomacy can work thanks to this strength. -There is already a lot of diplomacy, and events will only accelerate. We are preparing some formats with partners. And today I met with parliamentarians from the global network of parliamentary support of Ukraine, and this is important,- he summarized. As reported by ArmyInform, the President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyy discussed with the Prime Minister of Belgium Bart de Wever the use of frozen Russian assets,coordinated further contacts, and also congratulated him on his recent appointment.

Title: - Forester - saved the fighters who were surrounded
Description: The soldier's story was published on the Land Forces page. -The forester- together with his brothers received an order to go to help. His squad broke through 400-500 meters forward and reached the surrounded fighters. There they took up the defense together. -During the night shooting battles, the -Forest- destroyed a significant number of enemy attacking infantry and helped the comrades to get out of the encirclement. For his heroic deed, he was awarded the Golden Cross,- said the Ground Forces. Before the full-scale invasion, Serhii worked at an agricultural company. Joined the army in March 2022. Since then, he fought in the Kherson direction, in Soledar and Avdiivka. Today, he continues to selflessly defend Ukraine. As reported by ArmyInform, a story appeared on the page of the State Border Service of Ukraine about the first assault of a young border guard with the call sign -Wise.- The boy, who was a cadet last year, now commands a platoon of border guards of the -Steel Border- brigade.

Title: Ukrainian military chaplains have advanced their qualifications in Great Britain
Description: About informs Military Chaplaincy Service of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. During their training, Ukrainian clerics had the opportunity to get acquainted with the experience of their British colleagues from the Royal Army of the Armed Forces of Great Britain. The course program included both theoretical lectures and practical sessions aimed at improving the skills of pastoral ministry in a military environment. Also, as part of the course program, the chaplains had the opportunity to meet with the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Ukraine to the United Kingdom Valery Zaluzhny, who visited the School of Chaplaincy. The completion of the training was marked by the receipt of relevant certificates and a joint prayer for the victory of Ukraine. As a sign of gratitude for their support and cooperation, Ukrainian military chaplains presented their British compatriots with commemorative awards and departmental awards. As reported by ArmyInform, candidates for the positions of military chaplains will now have six months instead of three to conclude a contract for military service from the moment of receiving the mandate.

Title: The forces of unmanned systems destroyed a Russian air defense system that could hit targets at a di...
Description: A video of combat work appearedon the unit's page. This system is capable of hitting targets at a distance of up to 5 kilometers and at a height of 10 meters. It is noted that its task was to cover the units of the occupiers, primarily from Ukrainian drones. Operators of the 412th “NEMESIS” regiment in Luhansk region destroyed a “Strela-10M4” (9K35M4/SA-13 Gopher) surface-to-air missile system. This is one of the most advanced modernizations of the Soviet-era “Strela-10.” The SAM system was tasked with protecting the occupying army… pic.twitter.com/tUrzbsDxgt — Unmanned Systems Forces (@usf_army) February 25, 2025 -But our operators once again demonstrated who is the real master in the sky. This is the second destroyed Strela and, in general, the fifth affected air defense complex destroyed by SBS units in February,- the defenders said. As reported by ArmyInform, fighters of the 412th Nemesis unmanned systems regiment hit a rare 170-mm M1978 self-propelled gun. -Koksan- produced by the DPRK.

Title: 15 years for treason: an FSB agent received a fair punishment in Donetsk region
Description: informs the SBU about this. In January 2024, the woman was arrested, and now the court sentenced her to 15 years in prison with confiscation of property. The investigation established that the FSB agent transmitted to the enemy the geolocation of fortified areas, checkpoints and artillery positions of the Ukrainian troops on the hottest direction of the front — Pokrovsky. To collect information, the traitor traveled hundreds of kilometers by taxi in the districts of Kurakhovo, Mirnograd, Novogrodivka, Selidovo, and Mykhailivka, where she secretly recorded the positions of the Armed Forces of Ukraine and transmitted their coordinates to her Russian curator via messenger. The identity of this curator has already been established by the SBU. It is documented how the woman sent agency -reports- in the form of marks on electronic maps with the names of objects. During the search of the residence of the FSB agent, a mobile phone with an anonymous chat, which she used to communicate with the enemy, was seized. The investigation revealed that the woman came into the view of the occupiers in the fall of 2023, when she published anti-Ukrainian comments on Telegram channels. After one of these -posts-, she was contacted by an FSB staff member in a messenger and offered cooperation in exchange for -privileges-, which he promised her in the event of the capture of the region. The court found the agent guilty of h. 2 Art. 111 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (treason committed under martial law). The investigation was conducted by SBU employees in Donetsk and Luhansk regions under the procedural guidance of the Donetsk regional prosecutor's office. As reported by ArmyInform, in Zakarpattia, a man who agreed to set fire to military and volunteer cars for money was sentenced to 5 years in prison will.

Title: A commander with a granite character: the story of -Jimmy-, who turned from a monolith into a Vampir...
Description: The story of the fighter was made public on page 141 of a separate mechanized brigade. The fighter with the call sign -Jimmy- says: -I was a monolith. Worked with marble and granite. But in 2023, everything changed. At first I was a drone operator, then I went through training, and now I have been commanding the department for several months now.- Vampire is not just a kamikaze drone. It can strike enemy warehouses, equipment, and personnel, as well as transport cargo. According to -Jimmy-, drone operators play a key role in supporting the infantry: -The area was mined tonight, the enemy left - and three -three hundred- at once. It saved our boys. We not only destroy the occupiers, but also protect our infantry.- Controlling a drone is one thing, but bringing it to the target in the conditions of Russian electronic warfare systems is quite another. -The worst thing is to lose the board because of the mufflers. But if everything goes according to plan, there is job satisfaction. When you hit it exactly, you know that minus the enemy, and they won't come to us anymore,- adds the fighter. Life at the front is constant tension. -Getting used to war is difficult. When they shoot, when they fly - it is not the case that you are completely calm. This is war. But over time, you already understand your task, what they want from you, and you just work,- says -Jimi-. Family support is also important. -It's good that there are phones, you can call directly from the dugout. The main thing is that there should be a connection.- As reported by ArmyInform, a story about the first assault of a young border guard with the call sign -Wise-. The boy, who was a cadet last year, now commands a platoon of border guards of the brigade -Steel border-.

Title: Since the beginning of the year, our soldiers have destroyed more than 500 enemy tanks — the Command...
Description: The Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces wrote about this on his page. -The Defense Forces continue the fight for the Independence of Ukraine! Thank you for your courage and resilience!- Oleksandr Syrsky emphasized in his address. As reported by ArmyInform, General Oleksandr Syrsky spoke on February 24 with an address on the anniversary of the large-scale invasion Russian.

Title: $1,000 — and you are unfit: a scheme to evade mobilization was exposed in Dnipropetrovsk Oblast
Description: The National Police of Ukraine informs about this. A 63-year-old neurologist from one of the city's hospitals conspired with a 54-year-old secretary of the People's Liberation Army to establish a corrupt mechanism for enriching conscripts. They drew up documents with fictitious diagnoses, which served as a basis for serving exclusively in rear units, in particular, in territorial recruitment and social support centers. While receiving a bribe in the amount of 800 dollars, the neurologist was detained right in her office. On the same day, her accomplice, the secretary of the VLK, who received $200, a part of the total amount of the bribe, was also detained. Both women involved in the case were informed of the suspicion for h. 2 Art. 369-2 (Abuse of influence) of the Criminal Code of Ukraine. They face up to five years in prison. As reported by ArmyInform, in Zakarpattia, a man who, for money agreed to set fire to the cars of soldiers and volunteers, received 5 years in prison will.

Title: The Verkhovna Rada adopted a number of laws for the military
Description: This is in a message on the page of the Parliament of Ukraine. The Verkhovna Rada adopted as a basis and as a whole the project Law No. 12333 on the release of persons who were in places of detention as a result of armed aggression against Ukraine from paying an administrative fee for issuing a citizen's passport of Ukraine. The law is aimed at protecting the rights of both military servicemen and civilians who returned after captivity to the territory controlled by Ukraine. It is important that the state not only grants the right to obtain a passport of a citizen of Ukraine free of charge, but also ensures its quick receipt — no later than three working days from the date of filing the application form. The Verkhovna Rada also adopted Law No. 10160 on the provision of rehabilitation services to military personnel in special educational institutions. -It allows special institutions of general secondary education to provide rehabilitation services to persons with special educational needs and other persons with visual and/or hearing impairments, in particular from among military personnel, persons released from military service, war veterans, persons who have special merits to the Motherland,- the message reads. The law is aimed at providing access for a wider range of persons to such services on the basis of special institutions of general secondary education and further implementation of international standards in the field of protection of the rights of persons with disabilities. In addition, the Verkhovna Rada adopted Law No.12378 on the issue of sending units of the Armed Forces to other states, taking into account the proposals of President Volodymyr Zelenskyi. It provides that during the period of martial law, the union, military units and units of the Armed Forces of Ukraine may be sent to other states to ensure national security, repel and deter armed aggression, protect the sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine, as well as exercise the right to self-defense in accordance with Article 51 of the UN Charter. In addition, as Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal announced, the Cabinet of Ministers extended until March 31 the postponement of reserved employees. -In this way, businesses will have time to confirm critical status according to the updated criteria, as well as to rebook their staff,- he said. As reported by ArmyInform, last week the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine adopted two important resolutions which were developed by the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine. The first resolution is -On Amendments to the Nutrition Standards of Servicemen of the Armed Forces and Other Military Formations.- The second resolution is called -On amending Clause 16 of the Regulation on the procedure for accounting, storage, write-off and use of military property in the Armed Forces.-

Title: Her Heart Beats to the Rhythm of War: The Story of a Combat Medic Who Combines a White Coat with a P...
Description: The story of the defender was made public on page 101 of the separate security brigade of the State Military Academy named after Colonel-General Gennady Vorobyov. -I saw an announcement about vacancies in our brigade and my heart told me to act immediately,- says Anna. At first, she hid her decision from her parents and confessed to them only on the eve of leaving for the training center, where she was the only girl among all the recruits. Relatives, of course, were worried, but later understood and supported her choice. Anna is from Zhytomyr Oblast and graduated from the military lyceum in Pereyaslav. -In her heart, she was a -warrior of good- from childhood and wanted to save this world, help people,- the girl shares. Her vacillation between the medic's white coat and the pixel uniform of the military combined harmoniously in the position of a combat medic. In February 2022, when the full-scale invasion began, Anna and her family found themselves under occupation in Chernihiv Oblast. Their shelter was a strong basement built by their grandfather, a World War II veteran. -Our saviors turned out to be the soldiers of the 72nd Brigade, who were defending the neighborhood,- Anna recalls. It was they who helped them survive and provided them with the necessary medicine. Having survived the difficult period of occupation and received burns on her body, Anna became even stronger in her desire to help people. Because of her small leg size, she received the nickname -Princess-, which later changed to -Mouse- - that's how her mother gently called her. With the beginning of the enemy's offensive on Kharkiv Oblast, real medical practice in extreme conditions began for Anna. -Constant assaults and shelling. I had to work around the clock, sometimes without sleep for several days,- says -Myshka-. She had to help wounded soldiers, tamponize wounds, apply bandages and maintain their fighting spirit. The hardest thing for Anna is the realization of the loss of her siblings. -It's impossible to get used to,- she admits. However, even in the most difficult situations, -Mouse- does not lose optimism and finds the strength to help others. Even in short moments of rest, Anna finds time for creativity and cooking. Her culinary masterpieces at the positions are always popular among her peers. And she also has a good heart for animals - once, together with her siblings, she saved a kitten whose mother blew herself up on me. Once, returning from the shower, Anna came under fire. Despite the danger, she did not hesitate to run to her brothers to provide them with medical help. -I didn't think about my own life at all. I was only afraid that I wouldn't have time to save my siblings,- the girl admits. Anna does not part with her first aid kit even during vacations. Once she witnessed an accident and provided first aid to the injured driver. Anna met her love in her brigade. Her future husband noticed a picture she was drawing - a pixelated cat with a machine gun and wings. The loved one made the proposal at the landfill, presenting a grenade ring instead of an engagement ring. Today, -Mouse- serves in another unit, but continues to support his previous one by organizing volunteer assistance. -I don't care what the enemy IPSO says. I saw how our lions fight bravely and I have no doubt that they will overcome the enemy,- Anna is convinced. She dreams of the day of victory, when she can gather with her brothers in her favorite restaurant and celebrate this long-awaited day. While the struggle for Ukraine continues, Myshka remains true to its principles and continues to contribute to the common victory. As ArmiyaInform reported, there is no room for error at Ukrainian airfields. Every cog, every check, every movement matters, because the cost of any mistake can be the pilot's life. For Valery, an aviation technician of the tactical aviation brigade, this truth is not just a professional rule, it is a personal challenge.

Title: They hid, but did not escape: how the drones of the Defense Forces destroyed the occupiers in the tu...
Description: The video of combat work was made public on the brigade's page. The filigree work of the UAV operators in the video selection from the brigade speaks for itself: The filigree work of UAV operators in the video sample from the brigade speaks for itself: Escape to nowhere. Several occupiers decided to hide in a drainage pipe, but our drones proved that utility lines are not bomb shelters. A good hit - and the pipe together with its -inhabitants- turns into a sad memory. Boomerang for operators. Enemy drone operators chose to operate stealthily from their positions, but our scouts proved that there are professionals working in the sky. After a series of targeted strikes, their equipment was scrapped, and the Rashists themselves another entry on the casualty list. Basement minus one. Russian infantry tried to set up a shelter in the basement after crossing the Oskil. But she did not take into account one nuance - Ukrainian drones do not forgive. The building, along with its unexpected guests, disappeared from the map. Fiery salute for the tank. Our fighters with special -warmth- greeted the enemy tank with 20-kilogram ammunition. The result is smoke, flames and another metal monument to the Russian invasion. As reported by ArmyInform, the drones of the 155th mechanized brigade named after Anna of Kyiv liquidated the assault group of the invaders to our positions.

Title: A taxi driver from Donetsk region went to court for transporting evaders
Description: This was reported on February 25 by the prosecutor's office of the Donetsk region. In September 2024, a taxi driver from Slovyansk organized a criminal scheme to transport men of military age to EU countries. During a conversation with an acquaintance of the city, the accused promised to take him to Vinnytsia, and from there acquaintances of the organizer would take him to a settlement near the border with Moldova. After paying $5,000, the so-called evader had to force the river. After some time, the businessman adjusted the scheme, foreseeing the delivery of the man to Odessa, and from there to Moldova. At the same time, the latter had to pay already $15,500. On October 30, the organizer received $17,700, including the fee for the petitioner's transportation across Ukraine and the purchase of fuel. On the same day, he was detained by law enforcement officers. Prosecutors of the Donetsk Regional Prosecutor's Office sent the indictment to the court on the fact of illegal transportation of persons across the state border of Ukraine (Part 3 of Article 332 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine). ArmyInform reminds that it is better not to break the law or risk your life, but to use the aggregator of vacancies in the Armed Forces and recruiting centers.

Title: A Russian drone hit a car in Kharkiv Oblast, killing a civilian
Description: The Prosecutor General's Office informs about this. The fire engulfed the vehicle. Its 62-year-old driver was killed. The 53-year-old passenger received multiple injuries and was hospitalized. -Under the procedural leadership of the Chuguyiv district prosecutor's office of the Kharkiv region, a pre-trial investigation has been launched into the fact of a war crime that caused the death of a person (Part 2 of Article 438 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine). -All possible and appropriate measures are being taken to document war crimes committed by Russian servicemen,- the statement said. As reported by ArmyInform, today, February 25, around 11:30, the armed forces of the Russian Federation struck from aviation to the village of Zolochiv, Bogoduhiv district, as a result of which two anti-aircraft missiles were hit in the settlement.

Title: -I do not heroize women in the army, but I respect their choice-: the story of paramedic Anastasia, ...
Description: The defender's story was published on the page of the Land Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. -I don't like the excessive heroization of women in the army. We all, men and women alike, have an equal duty to defend our country. But I have tremendous respect for the choice of those who chose to serve for the sake of victory,- she says. Each evacuation trip is a meeting with the wounded, with his pain, fears and memories. -The hardest thing for me mentally is the road to the hospital. You go with a fighter, you have to talk to him, maintain his level of consciousness. He tells you stories that sometimes break your heart. But then… you forget them. Not names are feelings. Because if I memorized everything, I wouldn't be able to stand it,- admits Nastya. She heard different things: about seven children waiting for their father at home, about dreams that were cut short by the war, about the fear of not living until tomorrow. And each story leaves a scar on her heart. -Some part of you just dies with each such story. But you have no right to stop,- she says. The girl gave her youth to the war, but does not regret it. -For me, the words 'to victory' are not just a phrase. This is a question for myself: will I be able to see the result? I'm ready to work as long as it takes,- Nastya firmly declares. She does not seek fame, does not expect thanks. Just doing her job, the one she chose on purpose. Because there, on the front line, those who have to return home are waiting for her. As reported by ArmyInform, a story about the first assault of a young border guard with the call sign -Wise-. The boy, who was a cadet last year, now commands a platoon of border guards of the -Steel Border- brigade.

Title: -Birdfall- in the Kharkiv region: FPV drones of the Defense Forces -landed- three Russian scouts
Description: The video of combat work was published on the brigade's page. The 22nd OMBr emphasizes: no enemy drone will fly with impunity in the Ukrainian sky! As reported by ArmyInform, the air defense unit of the 80th Airborne Assault Brigade of the Galician Brigade is effectively destroying enemy reconnaissance drones in the sky over Kurshchyna.

Title: The Ministry of Defense initiates the conclusion of three-year contracts with Ukrainian arms manufac...
Description: This is reported by the MoU on February 25. First Deputy Minister of Defense of Ukraine, Lieutenant General Ivan Havryliuk noted that together with the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, they identified a number of priority samples of Ukrainian weapons and military equipment. -These are the weapons that are critically important for the Ukrainian army to gain an advantage on the battlefield. And the conclusion of long-term contracts with its manufacturers is designed to ensure the reliability of the supply of these necessary weapons,- he said. The Ministry of Defense confirmed its position regarding priority support for domestic manufacturers in providing the army with the necessary weapons and equipment. Director of the Procurement Policy Department of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine, Hleb Kanevsky, noted that long-term contracts allow manufacturers to plan their work, attract investments, and develop technologies. -The procurement agency of the Ministry of Defense has already concluded contracts worth UAH 208 billion with Ukrainian manufacturers. In particular, with these funds, the Armed Forces receive artillery systems, ammunition, anti-tank missile systems, mortars, shots to them, armored combat vehicles, trucks, EW equipment, heavy bomber drones, etc.,- he emphasized. The Ministry of Defense has already prepared a list of weapons based on the needs and priorities determined by the General Staff of the Armed Forces. Necessary criteria are taken into account, in particular, the manufacturer must go through the codification procedure, carry out mass production, ensure the level of localization is not less than 50%. -The Department of Defense continues to work on the reform of defense procurement, introducing effective mechanisms of interaction with Ukrainian manufacturers to provide the army with everything necessary for the defense of the country,- the MOU said. As reported by ArmyInform, the Minister of Defense of Ukraine Rustem Umyerov took part in an international meeting via video link. which united representatives of the countries of the E5 group (Poland, Germany, France, Italy, Great Britain), the Nordic-Baltic eight, the Netherlands, as well as the EU and NATO.

Title: Rocket attack on Kramatorsk: there is a dead and wounded, among them children
Description: The National Police of Ukraine informs about this. Currently, a rescue operation is underway at the scene of the tragedy. It is difficult to imagine all the horror experienced by the civilians of Kramatorsk during this shelling. According to preliminary data, at least 17 private houses were damaged as a result of the enemy attack. Destructions vary in nature and degree. At the scene of the incident, all the necessary services are working: the investigative and operational team, bomb squads, paramedics, patrol police and other specialized services. They document the aftermath of the war crime, provide aid to victims and ensure security at the site of the shelling. Information on the number of victims and destruction is constantly updated and may change. As reported by ArmiyaInform, today, February 25, 2025, Russian troops shelled Kramatorsk, resulting in at least one person being killed and another injured.

Title: The Russians are stepping on their corpses, the occupiers are crawling to surrender: a stream from a...
Description: In the direction of Zaporizhzhia, our fighters burned the S-300 anti-aircraft missile launcher. The other drone just flew up to correct the strike and capture fascinating footage of the burning anti-aircraft complex and how the Russians are trying to put it out. Gunners of the -Revenge- brigade destroyed the shelter of Russians in Donetsk region. For this, the border guards used the RAK-SA-12 rocket salvo fire system. After our shelling, the occupiers lost the desire to continue the assault. These and other topics are discussed by our presenters - junior lieutenant Volodymyr Kravchuk and lieutenant Serhiy Lipko.

Title: The Ukrainian defense industry received a new brand -WEAPONS-
Description: This is described in a publication on the website of the Government portal. -We are proud to have such a large production of drones, electronic warfare equipment, and other weapons. We started from the first days of the war and now we have significantly increased these capabilities,- said Volodymyr Zelenskyi, emphasizing the significant progress of the Ukrainian defense industry. Advisor to the President on strategic issues, Oleksandr Kamyshin, emphasized the importance of this brand for Ukraine and its international image: -Since the first days of the war, Ukraine has become known to the whole world for its courage and iron strength. Our partners have already learned such words as ZSU, Ukrzaliznytsia, Palyanytsia. Another Ukrainian word that we will be happy to share with the whole free world will be our Ukrainian WEAPON. Our Ukrainian weapons are the key to the security of Europe and the entire Free World.- The Minister of Strategic Industries of Ukraine, Herman Smetanin, noted that the -WEAPONS- brand symbolizes the strength and effectiveness of Ukrainian weapons that have been hardened in battles and meet modern requirements: -Ukrainian weapons are hardened in the most intense war since World War II. It proves its effectiveness in the most difficult conditions - real combat operations. Conventional weapons and equipment are adapted to modern requirements. Innovative products born during the war are changing the approach to conducting combat operations. A WEAPON is born in the hands of Ukrainian gunsmiths - the Weapon of Victory.- The Deputy Minister of Strategic Industries of Ukraine, Anna Gvozdyar, spoke about the uniqueness of the Ukrainian defense ecosystem, which unites 800 manufacturers and more than 1,000 teams working on innovative solutions: -Our defense ecosystem is a unique phenomenon. It was reborn and developed over three years of full-scale invasion. It includes the Defense Forces, Ministries, other government bodies, state and private manufacturers, incubators and accelerators, institutes and universities, volunteers and foundations. These are 800 manufacturers, more than 1000 teams working on innovative solutions. And now all the weapons produced by this ecosystem in Ukraine, we will call WEAPONS.- The English version of the ZBROYA brand aims to attract international partners to support the production of Ukrainian weapons and to spread information about the phenomenon of the development of the Ukrainian defense industry during a full-scale invasion. The visual elements of the -WEAPONS- brand will be used to apply the logo to OVT products, the unification of state services for OVT manufacturers, media publications and other manifestations of communication about the Ukrainian defense industry. This brand should convey to the world that the Ukrainian -WEAPON- is a smart force hardened by the real battlefield, it is a sign of quality. The Ukrainian defense industry is modern, flexible and fast, it responds to the challenges of war and is constantly improving. She represents the free people who create new generation weapons to defend their land and build the Arsenal of the free world. After all, Ukraine has become the flagship of the production of the latest weapons thanks to the unique experience of modern warfare during these three years of full-scale invasion. As reported by ArmyInform, an exhibition of drones was organized in the -Ukrainian House- for our international partners.

Title: Rustem Umyerov discussed the key needs of Ukraine's defense in 2025 with the union of parliamentaria...
Description: He wrote about this on his Facebook page on February 25. The head of the Ministry of Defense expressed gratitude for the consistent support of Ukraine in the conditions of 11 years of Russian aggression and 3 years of full-scale war. -Russia is trying to mislead the world about its intentions while continuing to build up troops and weapons production in preparation for further aggression,- he noted. Rustem Umerov informed the delegation about the current situation at the front, threats to Europe and the real plans of the Kremlin. They discussed the key defense needs of Ukraine in 2025, necessary to destroy the enemy's plans: They also analyzed the level of military aid for 2022-2024, plans for 2025 and the capabilities of the Ukrainian defense industry. The Minister of Defense of Ukraine emphasized that increasing the amount of support is critical for Ukrainian victory. -Parliamentarians have confirmed: Europe will support Ukraine until victory.- Our unity is our strength. With joint efforts, we should work on real security guarantees to ensure a lasting and just peace in Europe,- Rustem Umyerov summarized. As reported by ArmyInform, the Minister of Defense of Ukraine Rustem Umyerov took part in an international meeting via video link. which united representatives of the countries of the E5 group (Poland, Germany, France, Italy, Great Britain), the Nordic-Baltic eight, the Netherlands, as well as the EU and NATO.

Title: The all-powerful TikTok: how the Ministry of Defense builds communication campaigns for recruiting
Description: Recruiters met to summarize their own experience and consider future areas of activity in the Ministry of Defense system. One of the speakers at the Forum was the head of the operational communications department of the Department of Mass Information of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine, Lt. Col. The Ministry of Defense is on those social networks where our potential recruits are. That is, we are where our audience is. Any communication campaign, if it does not have information support, is doomed to fail to achieve its main goal,- said Volodymyr Fityo.   According to him, this is why the resources of the Ministry of Defense are represented in all social networks: -Our resources are Army TV, Army FM and ArmyInform. They continuously provide information on digital television networks, on the radio and, accordingly, ArmyInform, as an information agency, publishes military and surrounding military news on its website.- The officer clarified that thanks to social networks, where the listed military mass media are also represented - especially due to TikTok, which has a young audience - campaigns on the -Contract 18-24-, -Be yourself- projects, campaigns on recruiting and mobilization are supported. -On average, about 30 promotional videos of the Army media brand are released per week in all popular social media, which popularize the military service, the Armed Forces and encourage potential recruits and potential candidates to join the Defense Forces,- emphasized the head of the operational communications department of the Department of Mass Information of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine, Lt. Col. Volodymyr Fityo.

Title: He held the bridgehead in conditions of collapsed logistics and dozens of KABs per day: the story of...
Description: The story of the fighter was published by the Southern Air Command. He started his military career in 2019. He said that he was lucky because he had time to prepare for a full-scale invasion. According to him, the longest in his life were four kilometers, when he carried his comrades under fire under heavy enemy fire, and the greatest joy was when he survived. And the understanding of what true brotherhood is when, after the landmine landed, he heard the voice of his brother: -Hold on, brother!-, who was pulling him to a safe place by his bulletproof vest. After rehabilitation, Roman continues to serve in his native anti-aircraft brigade. -We just have to fight. Each of the Ukrainians is in his place. Otherwise, piece by piece, everything will be taken from us. I have reported three times for a business trip to the Combined Rifle Brigade of the Air Force. Someone said: -You have a little son.- But this is my main motivation. Of course, no one threw us into battle,- the fighter said. At first, Roman underwent long-term training, after which he was sent to resupply the marine infantry brigade. In the summer of 2023, he fought in the Avdiiv region, where fierce battles were fought at that time. -It was difficult, but we held our positions. When Comrade Serhii was wounded in the leg, we, together with the soldier, dragged him to the place of medical assistance. It was really long kilometers, enemy shelling continued, but we didn't even think about the danger,- the man recalled. Now the rescued fellow wears the call sign -Fartovy-. Roman had to understand what real brotherhood is by his own example. In November 2023, a man heard the characteristic whistle of the 120th mine in Kherson Oblast. He managed to duck down, saw a flash and felt a piercing pain from a shell fragment. -I didn't have time to think something pessimistic, as brother Ivan with the call sign -Major- already dragged him a little further away from the shelling into the basement of the building and provided first aid. The fighting in Krynk was more than active, so I spent several days in that basement. Periodically, shooting battles between Ukrainian soldiers and the occupiers even took place in the same building with me, on the basement floor. But the rioters were chased away, and I was evacuated,- said Roman. Despite being wounded, he continues his service and passes on his combat experience to younger soldiers. -Three years have passed… War has changed and evolved. One thing has remained unchanged - the understanding that we have no other way out than to fight for our own,- the fighter assured. For personal bravery, Roman Mosezhny was awarded the Cross of Valor and the Golden Cross badge. As reported by ArmyInform, a story appeared on the page of the State Border Service of Ukraine about the first assault of a young border guard with the call sign -Wise.- The boy, who was a cadet last year, now commands a platoon of border guards of the -Steel Border- brigade.

Title: The President of Ukraine and the Prime Minister of Belgium discussed the use of frozen assets of the...
Description: The head of the Ukrainian state wrote about this on February 25 on his page in social networks. According to him, the global situation requires coordinated actions and a quick response. -It is important for us that Belgium's support for Ukraine remains steadfast in these difficult times. Appreciate your willingness to continue to help. We sincerely appreciate that Belgium shares Ukraine's position: it is important to ensure a common European response to the challenges posed by Russia,- the President summarized. As ArmiyaInform reported, Volodymyr Zelensky met with the President of the European Commission Ursula von der Leyen and the President of the European Council Antonio Kosta. During the negotiations, the parties discussed the key issues of defense support to Ukraine, increased sanctions pressure on Russia, and progress in negotiations on accession of Ukraine to the European Union.

Title: Ten skirmishes took place in the Kursk direction
Description: This is in the operational information of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine as of 4:00 p.m. on February 25. The invaders do not stop using artillery on the territories of the regions bordering the Russian Federation. Areas of Uhroidy, Vilne, Popivka, Oleksandrivka, Bila Bereza, Yizdetske settlements of the Sumy region came under enemy fire; Girsk, Chernihiv region. The invaders carried out four assaults in the direction of Vovchansk and Dvorichny in the Kharkiv direction. Enemy aircraft dropped anti-aircraft missiles on Zolochiv, Udy, and Yemtsi. The enemy tried four times to capture Ukrainian units in the Petropavlivka and Zagryzovy areas in the Kupyansk direction. In the Lymansk direction the aggressor is attacking in the areas of Nadiya, Novolyubivka, Zelena Dolyna and Yampolivka settlements. Since the beginning of the day, there have been five clashes in this direction, one of which is ongoing. Six enemy attacks were repulsed by our defenders in the districts of Bilogorivka, Ivano-Daryivka and Verkhnyokamyansky in the Seversky direction, one battle is still ongoing. In the Kramatorsk direction Defense forces repulsed one enemy advance attempt near Chasovoy Yar. In the Toretsk direction the enemy attacked the positions of our troops in the Toretsk and Crimea regions seven times. Three clashes continue until now. In the Pokrovsky direction today, the enemy attacked the positions of our defenders 14 times in the areas of Promin, Tarasivka, Nadiivka, Preobrazhenka and Andriivka settlements, three skirmishes continue. Lysivka and Pokrovsk were hit by KABs. In the Novopavlovsk direction, our defenders repelled two enemy attacks in the areas of Kostiantynopil and Burlatske settlements, two more are still ongoing. Two skirmishes are ongoing in the Orykhiv direction, Ukrainian units have already repelled one more enemy attack. The enemy is trying to advance in the districts of Mali Shcherbaki and Kamianskyi. One unsuccessful assault of the Russians in the Dnieper direction has ended. In the Gulyaipil direction since the beginning of the day, the enemy has not carried out offensive actions. Ten combat clashes took place today in the Kursk direction, three are still ongoing. In addition, the enemy carried out 6 air strikes, dropped nine anti-aircraft missiles and launched 294 artillery barrages. As reported by ArmyInform, over the past 24 hours, the Russian army has lost 1,300 personnel, 26 artillery systems and 2 air defense systems.

Title: Clear sky over Kurshchyna - our paratroopers hunt for enemy -wings-
Description: The video of combat work was released on February 25 by the Airborne Assault Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. -The Russians, with the help of UAVs, continuously try to track the positions of Ukrainian troops for further assaults. However, they are rebuffed not only on earth, but also in heaven! The video shows only a part of the trophies that the Galician paratroopers managed to land recently. Targets affected include Supercam, Zala and Orlan. We are working to reduce Russian junk in the air!- — commented on the video in the DSHV of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. As reported by ArmyInform, UAV pilots Pride group 2 of battalion 80 the Halych assault brigade was well trained by the Russians' manpower.

Title: In Lviv, 120 veterans took part in the All-Ukrainian Bestrong Games adaptive competition
Description: The purpose of the event was to unite veterans of the Russian-Ukrainian war — including people with injuries of varying severity — in order to give them the opportunity to test themselves in the chosen sports and compete on equal terms. Also, at BESTRONG GAMES, veterans had the opportunity to meet other veterans, and it is possible to choose a sport for themselves, which they will continue to practice, including at the Educational and Sports Base of Summer Sports. The database defines the groups of coaches and athletes - these are honored coaches of Ukraine and athletes of the highest sportsmanship, who constantly work with veterans, and with whom you can sign up for classes. Athletes competed in 10 disciplines: All veterans say it's great to have sports events they can compete in, and they also advise other service members to join similar competitions, because life doesn't end after being wounded. Nikita is from the 12th operational brigade of the National Guard of Ukraine -Azov-. He was wounded on December 2, 2024 near the settlement of Leonidivka in Donetsk region. And already in February 2025, he is participating in competitions. -I found out about the competition when I went here for archery training. Therefore, I competed in archery from 10 meters and laser weapons. Guys, I strongly advise you to participate in such competitions, because sports is what it is, you develop, you feel more lively, and you make a lot of healthy acquaintances.- And Pavlo joined the ranks of one of the special units of the Defense Forces of Ukraine in February 2022. He was wounded in June 2023 during a combat mission on the border of Kharkiv and Belgorod regions. He speaks so succinctly about the importance of such competitions: -You need to participate. Because by participating at least once, you already become one step better.- The plans of the Training and Sports Base of Summer Sports include continuing to hold new competitions for wounded servicemen and developing the availability of sports facilities. In particular, the base already has an elevator, ramps and lifts. The event was organized by the NGO -BE STRONG- and the Educational and Sports Base of Summer Sports of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine. A memorandum of cooperation was signed between them for the organization and holding of events for veterans of the Russian-Ukrainian war. Photo by Anton Pidgorny, Volodymyr Yakymchuk

Title: -Contract 18‒24- and development strategy: achievements and prospects of recruiting to the Defense F...
Description: The event was attended by representatives of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine, recruiting centers of the Ukrainian Army and the Armed Forces of Ukraine, recruiting structures of military units, TCCs and joint ventures, public organizations, foreign representatives and online platforms that are platforms for disseminating information about vacancies in the Defense Forces. At the Forum, a strategy for attracting, developing and maintaining human capital in the Defense Forces for the period until 2027 was presented of the year, presented an experimental project of military service by citizens of Ukraine aged 18 to 25 and summed up and outlined prospects for the development of the network of recruiting centers of the Ukrainian army. Participants discussed the results and prospects of recruiting foreigners and stateless persons, the place and role of online platforms for searching for military vacancies and communication, and online tools for the promotion of military service. Also during the work The Forum summed up the activities of the Recruiting Centers for 2024 and awarded the best recruiters, partners and units (institutions) based on the results of the 2024 recruiting campaign. The priority areas of the Strategy for the attraction, development and retention of human capital in the Defense Forces of Ukraine for the period until 2027 were outlined by the Deputy Head of the Department of Coordination of Human Capital Management Projects and the Implementation of Changes Colonel Dmytro Zubovskyi of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine. The strategy approved by the Ministry of Defense in January 2025 deals with the principles of systemic transformations in the field of military recruitment, modern standards of education and training, as well as clear mechanisms for the career and professional growth of servicemen. -Since last year, the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine has started comprehensive work on rethinking the approach to working with human capital. Today, there is a clear understanding of the importance of man as the central subject of achieving any success on the battlefield. This is the most valuable thing that is in Ukraine. A policy was developed to attract, develop and maintain human capital in the Defense Forces, the logical continuation of which was a strategy that detailed all the elements, defined specific stages and tasks that should be faced. The Ministry of Defense acts in this matter as the architect of all components of the Defense Forces, since according to the provisions of the regulatory founding acts, we set a general policy for all subjects of the defense sector, which fall under the concept of military personnel,- said Dmytro Zubovskyi. The strategy covers all components of the Defense Forces and defines clear deadlines by which the innovations provided for in the strategy must be implemented. Its philosophy consists in the development of a people-oriented system of attracting, developing and maintaining human capital in the defense sector. In particular, the Strategy refers to the creation of a fundamentally new recruiting and staffing system, which will provide for the predictability of military service in the chosen specialty when citizens enter military service. In particular, it provides for the transformation of the system of military education and personnel training, the introduction of transparent and a clear policy for determining suitability based on health status, the possibility for recruits to choose their future career path in the army. An important aspect of the Strategy is the rethinking of the elements of the social package as a motivating incentive for citizens to join the army on a voluntary basis. -The purpose of the strategy is to create a coherent and coordinated system of attracting, developing and maintaining human capital in the Defense Forces. When we developed this strategic document, a three-stage logic was laid in it, which was supposed to follow the entire life cycle of a serviceman, since it is impossible to work with human capital, fragmenting the process of passing through the stages of a military career,- said the representative of the Ministry of Defense. Implementation of the Strategy will allow the Defense Forces to be fully staffed with motivated personnel to perform all combat and non-combat tasks with the aim of defending sovereignty and of the territorial integrity of the state. -Our activity has an institutional nature, it allows us to make deep changes in the field of work with human capital, and not just create a certain informational noise around this topic-, - emphasized Dmytro Zubovsky. The head of the Department of Coordination and Direction of Recruiting Centers characterized the historical experience, current state and prospective directions of development of recruiting activities in the system of the Ministry of Defense colonel Serhiy Krylov. The first attempts to reform the archaic system of staffing the Armed Forces, which Ukraine inherited from Soviet times, date back to the 2000s. At that time, the process of professionalization of the Armed Forces of Ukraine was started, which was carried out by recruiting citizens of Ukraine for military service under a contract. The first successful results were achieved during the implementation in 2004‒2007 of pilot projects aimed at reforming the recruitment system by activating the network of military commissariats. During this time, it was possible to almost completely staff several experimental units and units of the Armed Forces of Ukraine with contractors. -On the basis of the 30th brigade, 7th aviation brigade, 36th separate coastal defense brigade and the large landing ship -Kostyantyn Olshansky-, a practical experiment was conducted that made it possible to staff these units almost 100% with contract servicemen,- said Colonel Serhiy Krylov. At the same time, the experiment revealed that recruiting through the system of military commissariats is not effective enough due to the overload of military commissars with other tasks. With this in mind, a decision was made in 2008 to create a network of 25 specialized recruiting units in the Armed Forces, separated from the military commissariats and directly subordinated to the General Staff. -The idea of ​​creating such recruiting units was borrowed from the experience of the armies of the leading NATO countries, which at that time helped us in creating this recruiting system. She has been working since 2008 and has shown very interesting results — from the number of people selected by recruiters, only 4% of the staff left in three years. It was a victory that no one could even hope for,- Serhiy Krylov assessed the results of the measures taken at the time. At that time, the average rate of effectiveness of a recruiter's work was 50 people per year, while the best recruiters selected from 120 to 150 future military personnel. At the same time, the annual task of a recruiter in individual NATO countries is 10 people during the year. Unfortunately, this promising system, which gave the first positive results, was completely destroyed in 2012, almost on the eve of the beginning of the open armed aggression of the Russian Federation. As a result, after 2014, it was necessary to restore the processes of professionalization of the Armed Forces of Ukraine almost from scratch. The next push for urgent transformations of the order of involvement in military service was a large-scale invasion. Today, the system of recruiting for the Armed Forces of Ukraine is divided into two functional components - military and civilian. The military component includes 6 recruiting centers of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, 380 recruiting units of combat brigades, regiments and separate battalions, as well as 500 recruiting units that remain in the system of territorial recruitment and social support centers. The issue of activity planning and interaction of the recruiting units of the Armed Forces of Ukraine was highlighted by the deputy head of management, head of the recruitment organization and development department of the General Staff, Colonel Dmytro Larin. Today there are 6 recruiting centers of branches and types of troops — Ground Forces, Airborne Assault Forces, Unmanned Systems Forces, Territorial Defense Forces, Special Operations Forces, Naval Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Appeals to them are one of the most effective structures for attracting citizens to the ranks of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Appropriate structures have been created in the command of the Ground Forces and four operational commands of the Ground Forces, which are engaged in accompanying recruiting activities, planning their activities and distributing tasks. Interaction between recruiting centers and military units has been established. Military recruiters are being trained on the basis of the National Academy of Land Forces named after Hetman Petro Sahaidachny, and the possibilities of such training are being considered for certain categories of personnel of recruiting units on the basis of the National Defense University of Ukraine and the Military Institute of Kyiv National University. An important direction is the digitization of the recruiting process, which is stated in Resolution No. 1170 of the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine -On the implementation of an experimental project on recruiting citizens of Ukraine in electronic form- dated October 15, 2024. The most extensive recruiting system currently exists in the Ground Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Colonel Mykola Kachanenko, head of the personnel department of the headquarters of the Land Forces Command of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, focused on the activities of the network of recruiting units of the Ground Forces, the achievements and prospects of reforming and optimizing the staffing and recruiting system. In addition to the First Recruiting Center of the Ground Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, which began its activities on September 1, 2024, the recruiting network of the Ground Forces includes units recruiting from the structure of TCC and JV. Recruiting groups have also been created in each military unit. Recruiting units at military units were only created at the end of last year, so they have not yet had time to fully form and acquire the appropriate capabilities. However, even in the first two months of their existence, they have already managed to win the trust of the population and show the first results. -Citizens respond positively to the creation of this system and to the fact that representatives of military units work with them directly - they explain something, provide information about the procedure for completing military service, about the motivational factors that exist at the moment,- said Mykola Kachanenko. The military emphasized the positive difference between the recruiting system and system of compulsory mobilization, because thanks to it the Armed Forces and the Defense Forces as a whole receive highly motivated personnel who came to the service not under compulsion, but by their own choice. Among the active means of informing citizens and involving them in military service, the officer gave examples of information activities that are currently being conducted - from live broadcasts on television, materials in the mass media, outdoor advertising to meetings in educational institutions and recruiting using the capabilities of the Internet. -Currently, virtually every military unit, every brigade has its own website, which you can go to by simply typing the name of that brigade into the search engine. This is one of the ways for our military units to achieve success,- the military officer noted. Speaking about the prospects for reforming and optimizing the recruitment and recruitment system, Mykola Kachanenko emphasized the need to intensify cooperation between military recruiters and representatives of the civilian sector. In particular, this can happen on the basis of making changes to the legislative framework, which will stimulate the desire of the heads of institutions and organizations to provide comprehensive assistance and support to military recruiters. Finally, the officer emphasized the need to separate the recruiting function from the functional sphere of territorial recruitment and social support centers and create a network of regional recruiting centers in the Armed Forces. Unlike TCCs and JVs, which are overburdened with other functions, and recruiting centers would be able to focus their activities precisely on conducting active recruiting activities. Concluding the work of the first panel Lieutenant Colonel Petro Avramich highlighted the activities and achievements of the Fourth Recruiting Center of the Territorial Defense Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, and the authorized representative of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine on recruiting issues, Senior Lieutenant Oleksiy Bezhevets, presented the activities, work results and prospects for the development of the network Recruiting centers of the Ukrainian army. There are currently 47 recruiting centers for the Defense Forces throughout Ukraine, as well as 1 online center. In addition to the function of informing and responding to the requests of interested citizens, their recruiters proactively contact those who are looking for work with offers of relevant vacancies. The experimental project of the contract for military service by citizens of Ukraine aged 18 to 25 was presented by the deputy director of the personnel policy department of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine, Colonel Ruslan Rusetskyi. -It is no secret that today we have combat units The Armed Forces of Ukraine are experiencing a personnel shortage. In view of this, the military-political leadership of the state considered the possibility of enlisting motivated citizens aged 18 to 25 for military service under a contract,- the officer noted. The project concerns citizens of Ukraine who are not subject to conscription for military service upon mobilization and the enlistment of citizens of 1824 to the defense of Ukraine thanks to the system of increasing motivational factors on the part of the state. In no case can it be considered a veiled mobilization, because the conclusion of the contract takes place exclusively on a voluntary basis. Currently, the project is being implemented on the basis of six brigades designated by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. These are the 10th separate Edelweiss mountain assault brigade, the 28th separate mechanized brigade named after the Knights of the Winter Campaign, the 38th separate marine infantry brigade, the 72nd separate mechanized brigade named after the Black Zaporozhets, the 92nd separate assault brigade named after the basket chieftain Ivan Sirk, and the 95th separate amphibious assault brigade of the Polish Brigade. up to 25 years before service in the Defense Forces should be scalable. In the near future, it is planned to increase the number of brigades participating in the experimental project, as well as to expand the list of combat positions in which it will be possible to serve under its conditions. During the implementation of the project, it is planned to recruit up to 10 thousand citizens of Ukraine aged 18 to 25 for military service, despite the fact that there are 800 thousand people of this age in Ukraine in total. The experimental project provides for a number of motivational factors before concluding a contract. In addition to the payment of monetary compensation in the total amount of UAH 1 million, this also includes: The military unit will receive 200,000 UAH for the enhanced military training of each recruit involved in this project. UAH., which will be directed to the improvement of the educational and material base. The first part is when a citizen comes to a military unit and puts his signature on the contract. The first tranche of this payment will be made within 5 working days. The Department of Finance and the Department of Social Security of the Ministry of Defense reported that a reserve of money has already been formed for the payment of this first tranche of the reward for signing the first contract,- Ruslan Rusetskyi said. The second tranche will be received by servicemen of this age who signed the contract after completing military training, arriving in the unit and engaging in tasks. It will amount to 300,000. UAH Before dismissal, if the terms of the contract are fulfilled, the third tranche in the amount of 500 thousand is paid. hryvnias. In addition, during the service, the contractor will be able to receive standard financial support in the amount of about 20,000 UAH. UAH, reward 100,000 UAH per month for participating in hostilities, additional remuneration in the amount of 70,000 UAH. hryvnias for the total number of days of participation in hostilities and payments for the destruction of enemy weapons and military equipment. Financial motives are important, as 40% of citizens aged 18‒24 who submitted applications for concluding a contract indicated that they were the reason for concluding a contract. Another 43% cited patriotic considerations as the main motive. -We are where our potential recruits are- Also, during the Defense Forces Recruiters Forum, practical experience of the recruiting projects -Drone Force- and -Victory Drones-, 28 separate mechanized brigades named after the Knights of the Winter Campaign and 47 separate mechanized brigades of -Magura- were presented. The Armed Forces of Ukraine and the 13 Brigade of Operational Purpose of the National Guard of Ukraine, presented the work of Tyachiv RTC and SP Nick John Polecauskene presented the practice of recruitment to the Lithuanian armed forces. ua , Lobbyx and Work.ua . Communication campaign in recruiting for forces of defense in social networks covered Ank -rel =- nofollow - HTEF = -https://www.youtube.com/channel/ucwrz7Gegbri5fi2-46Ex3ja-> Armyatv , Armyfm and Armyinform : -Armyfm - we listen, army - we look, armyinform - we read. The ArmyFM is FM broadcasting in almost all regions of Ukraine. Armyatv is a digital television plus YouTube channel with an audience of more than one million subscribers. Armyinform is an information agency that informs everything that concerns not only the Armed Forces of Ukraine, but also military topics. -We try to be information exactly where our potential audience is. It is where we can offer vacancies. We hold our hand on the pulse and go out wherever our potential recruits are. It is especially important in the context of the contract -contract 18‒24-, since the vast majority of Ukrainian citizens receive information from these social networks, --said Vladimir Fito a> on the Armyinform Army, in which in the maximum In a clear form, all the necessary information is systematized for those who decide to join the ranks of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.

Title: Ammunition, anti-aircraft defense, investments: Rustem Umyerov discussed key requests of Ukraine wit...
Description: He wrote about this on his Facebook page on February 25. -Three years ago, we deterred the first attacks of Russian troops thanks to the anti-tank systems provided by the allies. Today, we continue the fight thanks to tanks, planes and artillery,- Rustem Umyerov emphasized, thanking international partners for their unwavering support. The Minister of Defense outlined the key demands of Ukraine, which are critical for continued resistance to Russian aggression: According to Rustem Umyerov, Russia continues to build up its military capabilities, which threatens not only Ukraine, but all of Europe. -The future of European security must be in the hands of Europe,- Rustem Umyerov stressed, stressing the importance of intensifying military cooperation between allies. As reported by ArmyInform, Ukraine and Denmark continue to strengthen their cooperation in the field of defense. The Ministers of Defense of both countries, Rustem Umyerov and Troels Lund Poulsen, together with the Minister of Strategic Industries Herman Smetanin signed an important document that opens new horizons for the defense industry of Ukraine.

Title: They will catch up with any enemy equipment: the MoU allowed drones to be used -The Witcher-
Description: The Ministry of Defense of Ukraine reported this on February 25. The high-speed FPV drones of this complex are capable of catching up with any wheeled vehicle of the occupiers. This was reported in the Main Directorate for Life Cycle Support of Weapons and Military Equipment. -The Witcher- is manufactured at a Ukrainian enterprise. The complex was created taking into account the combat experience of our soldiers. Most of the components are of domestic production. With fairly compact dimensions, the -Witcher- is able to carry a charge, the power of which is sufficient for effective damage to armored vehicles and protected firing positions of the enemy. At the same time, the copter develops significant speed and can maneuver sharply. -Birds- of the complex work day and night, detecting and recognizing typical enemy targets. The Ministry of Defense reminds the manufacturers of OVT that useful information regarding the codification procedure of new samples of weapons and military equipment is available. As ArmiyaInform reported, representatives of the Ministry of Defense and the US delegation discussed increasing Ukraine's defense capabilities.

Title: - 80% of the armor was destroyed on the battlefield - — a series of active, lively, complex skirmish...
Description: Captain Yury Fedorenko, commander of the 429th separate regiment of unmanned systems -Achilles-, told about this on the broadcast of the -Edyny Novyny- telethon. According to him, near the village of Kruglyakivki, which is not far from Kupyansk, the fighting is going on around the -wedge- that the enemy created last year. The defense forces hold their positions and prevent this -wedge- from expanding. -The defense forces have blocked the enemy and are hitting him day and night with available forces and means. Dynamic enough. Over the past week, three enemy attacks were repelled using lightly armored vehicles. 80% of this armor was destroyed on the battlefield. Thanks to the joint work of several brigades,- said the commander of the 429th separate regiment of unmanned systems -Achilles-. Another touch - Kupianskyi. There, the especially dangerous area of ​​Dvorichnya, where, under the cover of fog, the enemy managed to cross to the other side of Oskol. However, this is his greatest achievement so far. -The defense forces control the water surface, inflict constant fire damage. The adversary cannot carry out engineering training in order to lead regular crossings, strengthen his group with artillery, light armored vehicles. Now there are active, lively, complex battles to block the enemy,- Yuriy Fedorenko noted. As reported ArmyInform, in Kharkiv Oblast, near Vovchansk, the enemy uses the tactics of constant fire influence. Guided aerial bombs are used, enemy artillery and mortars are operating. Very active drones.

Title: A father's hands are a son's wings: how an aviation technician prepares a fighter for his pilot son
Description: The story of the fighter was made public on the page of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Valeriy checks the technical serviceability of the MiG-29 combat fighter every day. It is these machines, controlled by Ukrainian aces, that hunt in the sky for strike drones and cruise missiles, cover the hostilities of fellow fighters and inflict devastating blows on the occupiers. -Aviation technicians treat airplanes as if they were living creatures,- Valery says. — We know their -characters-, follow the smallest changes in the systems' operation, prepare them for hard service in the sky. Inspection of flight systems, diagnostics, refueling - technicians work regardless of the time of day or weather. Only after all thorough checks can they hand the fighter over to the pilot, report readiness, shake hands and wait for his return. For Valery, this work gained even more meaning when his son was in the cockpit of one of the planes. He is an experienced fighter pilot with over 200 sorties to his credit. Its mission is to destroy enemy positions on the ground and in the air, to use the latest weapons that help Ukraine fight for freedom. -Preparing my son's plane for departure is an excitement that cannot be expressed in words,- Valery shares. — You do your work even more carefully, because you know: not only the success of the task depends on you, but also the life of the most precious person. After each sortie, the pilot returns to the airfield, and the technician again takes care of the maintenance of his aircraft. It is a ritual that never loses its importance. For a father, this is more than a duty, it is his contribution to future victory. - I am proud of my son. He fights in heaven, I support him on earth. Together, we are approaching the day when the Ukrainian sky will be finally free. This story is another proof that the war in Ukraine is not just a struggle of weapons, but also a struggle in which different generations forge victory together. As reported by ArmyInform, a story appeared on the page of the State Border Service of Ukraine about the first assault of a young border guard with the call sign -Wise-. The boy, who was a cadet last year, now commands a platoon of border guards of the -Steel Border- brigade.

Title: As a result of the Russian strike in Kramatorsk, a person died
Description: informs the head of Donetsk OVA Vadym Filashkin about this. -the Russians attacked the city this afternoon. We are establishing all the circumstances of the shelling, the exact number of victims and destruction. Evacuate in time!- - says the message.
