Glory to Ukraine! Support the Ukrainian army! We will win together!-, - said the message of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. As reported by ArmyInform, the occupiers 20 times tried to seize Ukrainian positions in the Pokrovsky area.

Title: -We put a patient without four limbs on prostheses in 4 months-. Interview with the colonel of the m...
Description: This is what the head of the post-acute and long-term rehabilitation department of the GVKG, Colonel of the Medical Service, Khrystyna Tabakar says. She has been in this position since August 2023. He has been serving in the Armed Forces for 27 years. The department she manages deals with the rehabilitation of wounded and traumatized servicemen as a result of the Russian-Ukrainian war. He notes that the load on the department increases in a geometric progression. The correspondent of ArmiyaInform asked about the specifics of the rehabilitation of servicemen after serious injuries, the specifics of prosthetics, the importance of working with a psychologist and the challenges that await our state in the context of working with veterans. The department, which is headed by Khrystyna Tabakar, provides complex medical and psychological rehabilitation for military personnel through coordinated team work. It has its own positive practical experience of effective rehabilitation, its own protocols, recommendations. — I am very impressed that the boys like us, like in the meme: so cozy, homely, sometimes they joke (smiles). After completing the rehabilitation course, many guys choose our department for a repeat course. We are happy to meet them. The clinical cases that our department focuses on require periodic rehabilitation, normalization and correction of functional physical and mental states. These are mostly amputations, severe skeletal injuries, severe fractures that require rehabilitation not only for a month, but sometimes for years. For example, it is physiological that the stumps change over time, and the military appeals to us again. It is important that there is a department like ours: there is somewhere to turn, the military feels cared for, it is important that you are not alone, says Khrystyna Ivanovna. The process of prosthetics for a military man is a complex and energy-consuming journey that he must go through. During this period, a military serviceman is focused on multi-vector interaction: both with prosthetic centers, and at the same time active work with physical therapists and the psychologist of the department. — At one time, I thought that working with amputated limbs was quite simple: a leg was amputated, after the tissues had healed, specialists would prepare a prosthesis, and the person quickly got on this prosthesis and went on living his life. And in fact, only pre-prosthetic preparation takes several months. In the best case, up to a month, provided the amputation is not complicated, and provided there are no complications, if the stump heals normally, up to a month. Our most striking case is when we put a patient on training prostheses and started the process of learning to walk in just under 4 months. The patient had an amputation of all four limbs. During the 3 months that the patient was in the department, the rehabilitation specialists prepared the stumps in a high-quality manner and began the process of learning how to use prostheses, says Hrystyna Tabakar. - This is an incredibly strong, courageous soldier. He went to war deliberately, received a severe wound in March 2024 in both upper limbs, lower limbs, brain injury, frostbite of both hands and a foot with the development of gangrene. Later, the limbs had to be amputated. At the age of 54, the soldier first had to learn to do seemingly simple, but at the same time so difficult things - walk, eat with the help of prostheses. A real fighter worked very hard, and his faithful wife was always with him. Oleksiy and Elena… they are for us as a single whole, as an example of extraordinary courage, strength of the human spirit and body… — the department tells. The post-acute and long-term rehabilitation department works closely with a number of prosthetic centers: both state and non-state. In total - with about 15 prosthetic centers. These are the Prosthetics Center -Without Limits-, Stetsenko Clinic, ProtezFoundation, Ukrprotez. Also, according to Khrystyna Tabakar, they work with prosthetic centers that are not very well-known yet, but have proven themselves very well: -Orto-Pro- or Antis-Orto. — Military personnel are given the opportunity to visit various prosthetic centers, she notes. - It is their legal right to choose the best services. As a rule, the selection criterion is the speed and quality of obtaining a prosthesis. In fairly well-known prosthetic centers, there is a very long queue: 1.5-2 thousand people. That is, it's about half a year, you have to wait until it's your turn to come for a fitting. On the other hand, prosthetic centers, which are not very well-known, immediately do a fitting and immediately prepare components. There, boys can get an educational prosthesis in just a month. And this is very often the selection criterion for our military. Can this prosthetics industry handle the influx of injured people? Khrystyna Tabakar answers in the negative: - Can't cope. And the direction must be strengthened somehow. Nowadays, there are many prosthetic centers. The problem is that each case is individual and requires different components. There are none in Ukraine, we do not produce them, we have to wait from abroad: Germany, the USA, etc. In Ukraine, the company -Olbionics- recently appeared, it is very young, they have just started work. They will make bionic prostheses for the boys. It is important that these are bionic prostheses of the upper limbs. Because if the lower limbs are made by almost all prosthetic centers, and such prosthetics has a lot of world experience, then with the upper limbs it is very, very difficult. Yes, there are prosthetic centers in the world that make upper limbs, but the world simply hasn't faced the same challenges as we have - they don't have them. It is usually a combat pathology of the upper limbs… Therefore, in the context of this experience, Ukraine can give any other country a head start. But, unfortunately, this way… According to Khrystyna Tabakar, foreign patients (Spanish and English-speaking, in particular) go to the psychologist with greater friendliness. - They perform all exercises with great understanding. We have such a psychologist in our department that she is so open, sincere and so easy to communicate with that she can find an approach to everyone. She can joke with one, with another she can find the words he wants to hear at that moment. This is probably such a gift, talent… You can feel sorry for someone, you can stand up for someone's mother, and you can also find the necessary words of motivation for those who are confused or feel despair. I will tell you about one of the unusual cases that clearly demonstrates the need for the professional help of a psychologist. A year ago, a patient who had been in a wheelchair for about a year came to us, and his rehabilitation process came to a dead end. He had one leg amputated and the other broken. — As our psychologist discovered, this patient had a false belief that his other non-amputated limb would not be able to heal in any way, and that if he stood on this leg, it would break again. That is, with a normal stump, already ready to walk on a prosthesis, it was the unprocessed false beliefs at the psychological level that made further physical rehabilitation impossible. The patient was convinced that he would never be able to stand on the prosthesis again, and if he did, the bone of the second leg would collapse. He came to the department with the idea that his whole future life is a wheelchair. Mrs. Khrystyna continues: — During the conversation, our psychologist asked: -What or who do you think will help you stand upright and get up from the chair?- The patient answered: -There was only one person, she was a midwife in Makarov, I always went to her, and she helped me in difficult life situations. But now she is probably no longer alive. My life is already full. All good things are over forever.- The psychologist consulted with the doctor, told about her unusual tactics for working out the false beliefs of the patient, who agreed. Then our psychologist said that she had a relative with such a gift, and that she was taking courses as a biotherapist. She offered to -charm- above the leg in the style of -ahalai mahalai-, twirled her hands, said that she has strong energy, and assured: -That's it, now you can try.- And he tried. And put on a prosthesis. At most, he became a good motivator for the other guys in the ward. He became an example of strength for them, says Ms. Khrystyna about this -healing story-. This, he says, is another proof that people change after working with a psychologist. There is another story - also about the result. — Military, low amputation of the upper limb. One eye is missing, the other has also been hit by a bullet, its vision is rapidly declining and a cataract is forming. Military man is married, has a daughter. But the wife did not choose the path of always being next to her husband, but left him. It caused depression, he struggled with betrayal… But our psychologist found an approach to him - and he was able to -digest- and let go of this story. Now he is an example of strength and courage for others, has an unparalleled sense of humor, supports others, is determined to further treat his eye, works with his limb, received a training prosthesis, and works with it. Khrystyna Tabakar states that life after life in the rehabilitation department for military personnel can be somewhat more difficult. — According to the military, it is much more difficult to live outside a medical institution. There is a reality in which there are no smooth asphalt roads and on which it is very difficult to walk with prostheses, there are no ramps, equipped elevators, social support, where it is difficult to find a job, and sometimes there is no simple human understanding of the needs of people with disabilities, inclusive culture. And these are the questions that our society will face in the future. And we will have to work on this problem, because today nothing has been resolved, says the department. Mrs. Khrystyna tells the story of three servicemen who lost both upper limbs during the Russian-Ukrainian war. Two of them are under 30 years old. — They are both from Donetsk region: Avdiyivka, Mariupol. Both have nowhere to return. And the question arises: both of them have prostheses, one of them closed all questions, was released from military service, sent documents to obtain a disability group, and where now?... Where to discharge him? He has nowhere to go and is absolutely, 100% dependent on outside help. He is still with us, now the question is being resolved about him… There are people who found him an apartment, and there is a person who has the ability to pay for that apartment for a year. But he still needs a person to help him put on that prosthesis, go to the toilet in the morning, drink water, lock the door with a key, and so on. But this is a temporary solution to one person's problem. In my opinion, it is necessary to develop social support, support programs for veterans at the state level. They protected us, I think it would be fair for the state to take care of them and create new opportunities for their self-realization. These guys are capable of great things. Photo of Olena Khudyakova and from the personal archive of Khrystyna Tabakar

Title: Repelling banzai attacks -Storm Z- on motorcycles under a swarm of drones and an onslaught of KABs: ...
Description: Now attacks happen almost every day. The brigade uses all available means to destroy enemy assault groups. Among those who actively cover their infantry are princely tankmen... ... Frosty sunny morning. There is not a single cloud in the sky. Perfect weather for drones. But not for those they hunt. We are heading to the position of the -30- tankers. This is what its fighters call the brigade among themselves. Already at the entrance, it becomes clear that today the enemy is also trying to storm - artillery is working regularly. They did not have time to reach their positions when the command: -take cover!- is heard. An enemy FPV drone is flying nearby. Our work has increased recently, says tank commander Dmytro. He is 24 years old. In the Armed Forces since the beginning of the large-scale invasion, and for the last almost one and a half years in the tank battalion of the 30th OMBr. He works on a trophy T-72 captured during the Kharkiv counteroffensive. It was quieter before that. They tried to attack from time to time, but they were beaten and kept quiet. And it became something more active. -Storm Z- units are storming. They try to slip by on motorcycles, buggies, cars. Once a group of several dozen motorcyclists attacked. But they didn't get there. Our FPVers did a good job and drones with resets. They also periodically attack MTLB and shed tanks,- – says Dmytro. Most often now they have to work on enemy infantry, Dmytro continues, adding that for them it doesn't matter what to work on - equipment, infantry or dugouts. Ready for anything. -If a tank or a self-propelled guns appear, then of course they will go after them. What is important is accurate shooting. The tank thing is accurate. But it all depends on the crew. If the crew is coordinated, then the tank is a killer machine. We destroyed both tanks and infantry fighting vehicles.- They work most often from closed positions. After all, it is safer in modern conditions. Although sometimes they leave for direct fire. Depends on the situation. The other day, the task was to work with direct fire, says the commander of another tank Serhii with the call sign -Hetman-: -But we were noticed. Artillery began to work. The commander of one of the tanks was wounded in the leg. I had to quickly change the point. And we managed to move in time. Because as we later learned from intelligence, 10 FPV drones flew after us at once. That is, they are ready to launch a whole swarm of drones even on one tank-. FPV-drones, -Lancets- and reconnaissance drones are the main problem for tankers now, says tank commander Dmytro. -Now the main problem is drones. FPV drones, also -Orlans-. Because they give the target indication of the day of -Krasnopol-. They have such an installation. And it is very accurate. -Maviks- still. Because if they noticed you, the arta will not let go of you. Will constantly have -nightmares-. But the main problem – FPV drones. It's just a slipper. There are a lot of them. You could already see for yourself. If they notice us, the whole swarm flies out immediately. It was somehow easier at the beginning of the war. Because there was almost none of this. And now -zest-. They also began to use KAB very often. This year, like a rush. Several events each day. Villages and positions are destroyed.- Our tankers counter this with camouflage, additional protection and speed, says tank commander Serhii -Hetman-: -We are making special frames, strengthening protection against FPV and skidding. Well, we try to practice as quickly as possible. To shoot back and immediately hide in a hole.- Sergiu is also 24 years old. He has been in 30 OMBr for 4 years. At first, he did his military service here, and then signed a contract and became a tanker driver. Went with the brigade all its combat path from the beginning of the large-scale invasion. He says that he is used to this work: -I am used to my profession. I know everything. I don't want anything else. I know that if there is a team, the crew and I are already leaving and working. How everything is happening. We are called by the company. Shows the route, how it is better to get there, where it is better to retreat, or detour. Shows targets where you need to practice. The number of the enemy. Are there armored vehicles or not? We are preparing the tank for departure and, following the command, we are leaving for the specified area.- The workhorse of the -Hetman- is the T-64 BV tank. Although the machine is old and periodically needs repairs, it continues to perform its functions and destroy the enemy. -Would I like to work on Western equipment? But I don't want to. I'm already used to our 64. I know her better. Here, by the way, the gun is very accurate. And the best stabilization of the gun... If you need to work on a different type of machine, then I can sit for the commander. But for a gunner or a mechanic-driver, it is more difficult here. The machines are still different. You need to know the nuances. And what is the commander's business? Constantly on the walkie-talkie. Give target indication to the gunner. And to monitor the situation.- Dmytro, unlike Serhiy, does not mind working on Western equipment. He says that he has heard many good reviews about her: -There are acquaintances who serve on Leopards and Abrams. I asked them. What they say is worth it. But we have what we have-. Both commanders could have remained in civilian life for their age, but chose the path of struggle. They say that the level of motivation has fallen a little over the years, but the main thing remains the same - not to let the enemy pass any further. So that he does not reach their homes...

Title: The US Army needed dump trucks: the Pentagon ordered a hundred units of heavy armored self-unloading...
Description: As informed portal of the manufacturing company from the state of Pennsylvania, the purchase of 74 trucks for the US Army will be financed with the funds of the US state budget, another 29 vehicles will be transferred to the National Guard. These vehicles will be used in the construction and maintenance of military infrastructure facilities such as airfields and supply points, ArmyInform notes. The additional vehicles are part of a previously announced fixed-price contract worth more than $296 million over seven years, which as href=-https://www.defense.gov/News/Contracts/Contract/Article/1534325/->stated on the official website of the Pentagon, the US Army entered into a contract with Mack Defense in 2018, which provided for the supply of 683 such trucks. The M917A3 vehicle is a heavy dump truck (HDT) developed by Mack Defense for meeting the needs of military tactical and logistical transportation. Built on a Mack Granite chassis, the car has refinements such as four-wheel drive, reinforced axles and a reinforced suspension for improved mobility and durability. The car has a load capacity of up to 27 tons and a steel body with a volume of 13.76 m³. The total weight of the vehicle is 42.9 tons. The truck is suitable for operation in difficult conditions and can be equipped with a replaceable armored cabin. The frame of the machine is versatile and can serve as a platform to place on it, for example, a radar station, be a transporter of heavy equipment or a fuel tanker. Production of the M917A3 began in 2021 at the Mack Experience Center (MEC) in Allentown, after an investment of 6.5 million US dollars in a special production line. The cars are equipped with advanced features such as ABS braking systems, touch controls and chemical protection. Equipped with a 520 hp Mack MP8 engine. and a torque of 2521 N·m. combined with an Allison automatic transmission, the trucks are designed to work in difficult terrain, guaranteeing safety and operational efficiency. Diesel engine compatible with JP8 fuel commonly used in the military. JP8 fuel is jet fuel, i.e. aviation kerosene. The cockpit of the M917A3 accommodates a driver and one passenger. Designed by TenCate, the armored cab is equipped with Jankel BLASTech seats to help reduce blast impact and increase occupant survivability. The truck has eight cross members along the frame rails for better strength and rigidity. A chemical resistant coating (CARC) is applied to these vehicles to protect them from corrosion, chemical and biological weapons, and to provide camouflage properties. The truck has a 243-inch (6.17 m) wheelbase and front and rear Michelin XZY3 445/65R22.5 load-band L tires. Front braking includes Meritor® disc brakes EX+ and the rear uses Meritor Q+ Cam Drum 16.5-x7- brakes. The front suspension is a conical spring (parabolic). Rear axle suspension is Primaxx® Pax 792 high stability suspension with 76,800 lb (34,836 kg) load capacity. M917A3 trucks based on commercial model Mack Granite, have been adapted to military specifications. Key features include reinforced rear axles, four-wheel drive, increased suspension height and advanced safety systems. These vehicles also undergo rigorous inspections by government auditors to ensure compliance with military standards. The truck is air transportable and can be transported by military transport aircraft. For example, strategic cargo aircraft C-17 Globemaster manufactured by McDonnell Douglas According to Dave Hartzell, president of Mack Defense, these dump trucks have demonstrated reliability during global operational deployments. He noted that the US Army, its Reserves and the United States National Guard continue to invest in these modern vehicles to effectively meet operational requirements. Production, originally part of the Mack Customer Adaptation Center, was later moved to Lehigh Valley Operations in Macungie, Pennsylvania, where all Mack Class 8 vehicles are assembled for North America and export markets. The strength and power of these Army Dump trucks have even been rated by video game creators. In particular, computer scientists from Focus Entertainment/Nintendo highlighted the Mack Defense M917A3 heavy dump truck in their video game SnowRunner: Season 10 Fix and Connect Connect, which takes place in the wilds of British Columbia. The M917A3 takes center stage, demonstrating its reliability and ability to cope with the most difficult tasks. Amid a rugged landscape of sawmills, farms and silo towers, players tackle tasks such as delivering generators and necessary reconstruction materials, erecting electricity poles to connect to the grid, and repairing critical infrastructure such as ferries and weather stations. However, in real combat conditions, these trucks have much more tasks. M917A3 heavy dump truck featured in the game Snowrunner Video: Mack Defense M917A3, a heavy duty dump truck (HDT) developed by Mack Defense to meet the needs of US Army. Video: Mack Defense

Title: Ukrainians are not terrorizing Europe: the Kremlin is trying to convince the world of its parallel r...
Description: the Russian propaganda machine works according to a well-known pattern: The latest -spell- about -terrorists from Ukraine- appeared in the Russian media after a series of criminal incidents in Europe in which Ukrainians were allegedly involved. There is no evidence, of course, just hearsay and manipulation. Speaking of threats to Europe, it is worth mentioning the hundreds of detained Russian agents, spies and provocateurs in various countries. It is the citizens of the Russian Federation who regularly appear in scandals related to destabilization attempts. In addition, the Russian mafia has long been known in the EU for its -exploits- in the field of smuggling, cyber fraud and arms trafficking. But, of course, Russian propaganda is not interested in this. The simple answer: Ukrainians not only survived the war, but also continue to fight, help their country and defend their dignity. the Kremlin wants to create the image of a -dangerous Ukrainian- so that: But, unfortunately for Russian propagandists, their fables fall apart at the first inspection. Ukrainians are not terrorizing Europe - they are fighting for their freedom, and the Kremlin is once again trying to convince the world of its parallel reality.

Title: 5 years for arson: a man who set fire to military vehicles was sentenced in Transcarpathia
Description: The Prosecutor General's Office informs about this. Prosecutors proved that the man at Telegram accepted the offer of a -customer- for a monetary reward to set fire to military vehicles. To fulfill this task, in September 2024, he set fire to three cars - servicemen of the Armed Forces of Ukraine and a local unit of the Red Cross Society. Law enforcement officers exposed an arsonist during another task in Uzhgorod. The convict, using a flammable mixture, planned to burn another vehicle - a military minibus. The promised reward for this was 1,000 USD, but the man did not receive any funds. He was waiting for the court verdict in custody. The citizen admitted his guilt and repented. The pre-trial investigation was carried out by the SBU Department in Zakarpattia Oblast under the operational support of units of the National Police of Zakarpattia. As reported by ArmyInform, the Odesa Regional Prosecutor's Office informed about the suspicion of a former deputy of the Odesa City Council from the pro-Russian party -Rodina- in treason, war propaganda and justification of armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine.

Title: -Battle of the brave loves-: the story of the soldier Rostyslav, who met his beloved after being wou...
Description: The story of the fighter was made public on the brigade's page. -My meeting with my wife in the hospital, where I was admitted after being wounded, reminds me of the final scene from the movie -Strong Peanut-, but in a Ukrainian interpretation,- says Rostyslav. — -She bursts into my ward, and I'm sitting there, on a wheelchair, bloodied and with a cigarette in my teeth. And then hugs and my phrase: -Hello, wife!-. In that moment, I felt relieved, we are together again, so everything will be fine.- This meeting became for Rostislav a symbol of returning to a normal life after months of separation and struggle for survival. He is grateful to his wife for the support and love that helps him overcome all difficulties. Rostislav also tells about how the commander saved him. -He was injured - I was taking him out, I was injured - he was taking me out. So when I returned to the formation, the first thing I did was shake his hand and say 1:1,- the soldier recalls. This example of fraternal mutual aid is another evidence that in war people become not just comrades for each other, but also true friends, ready to come to the rescue in any situation. 22-year-old Rostislav is a native of Lysychansk, he devoted three years of his life to military service. During this time, he had to go through many trials, but he did not lose his optimism and sense of humor. -It seems that I was ironed by everyone: arta was flying, KABs were exploding. But my boys knew that if I went, I would one hundred percent take the wounded and bring something back,- Rostyslav says about his work in transporting the necessary supplies and evacuating wounded comrades. As reported by ArmyInform, Gostomel. February 24, 2022. The sky is cut by the roar of Ka-52 attack helicopters. There are six of them, they fly low, covering themselves with the folds of the terrain. Russian airborne troops are preparing to land at the Antonov airfield. But they are already waiting for them on the ground.

Title: Another children's military propaganda action was held by the enemy at the TOT of Luhansk region
Description: This is reported by the Center of National Resistance. On the day of the so-called -defender-, the Russians conducted a series of propaganda activities involving children who are planned to be trained to participate in Russia's war of aggression. In particular, in the temporarily occupied Luhansk region, a joint action was held by members of the -youth army- and war criminals of the Third Combined Arms Army of the Russian Federation. The children were forced to hold the unfurled banner -army of Russia- and thank the Russian terrorists for -protection- in the cold for several hours. The occupiers of the TOT of Ukraine are not ashamed to purposefully use children to impose their own ideology. Propaganda reaches even the youngest schoolchildren: first-graders are drawn into drawing contests on politicized topics, forced to study distorted history, and imposed values ​​that contradict their national identity. As reported by ArmyInform, on the Day of Heroes of the Heavenly Hundred in the Kyiv Palace of Children and Youth (KPDU) with the support of the Department of Science and Education of the City of Kyiv opened an exhibition dedicated to the Hero of Ukraine Andriy Pilshchikov, a fighter pilot with the nickname -Jus-, and educator Badri Lolashvili, who defended the country since 2014 and died during the defense of Kyiv.

Title: Volodymyr Zelenskyy held talks with EU leaders: defense support, sanctions and European integration
Description: The head of the Ukrainian state wrote about this on his social media page. During the meeting, special attention was paid to the development of the Ukrainian defense industry, in particular to investments in expanding the capabilities of long-range weapons. Volodymyr Zelenskyy emphasized that victory in the war is possible only under the conditions of European unity and the readiness of partners to support Ukraine by force, as Russia does not seek a fair end to hostilities. Another important decision was the adoption by the EU of the 16th package of sanctions aimed at limiting Russian logistics, banking system, military-industrial complex and propaganda resources. A ban on the storage of Russian oil products in EU countries has also been introduced. The President of Ukraine thanked the partners for this step, stressing that sanctions should hit everything that finances Russian aggression. During the negotiations, the issues of Ukraine's integration into the EU were also discussed. Volodymyr Zelenskyi expressed hope for the opening of the first negotiating cluster -Osnovy- as soon as possible, which will be the next step in the process of Ukraine's accession to the European Union. The President thanked the European leaders for their support and their visit to Ukraine. As reported by ArmyInform, President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyi took part in the traditional meeting of G7 leaders, which became another important signal support of our state.

Title: The third assault struck a powerful blow against enemy equipment and manpower in the Kharkiv region
Description: This is reported in the publication on the brigade's page. According to the press service of the brigade, Ukrainian defenders hit the enemy's air defense system (air defense), and also destroyed and damaged a large number of artillery installations, tanks, armored vehicles and other military equipment the enemy In particular, the following were destroyed: In addition, the enemy suffered losses in manpower: As reported by ArmyInform, -Green- is an otolaryngologist of the medical company of the Third Separate Assault Brigade. A large number of wounded people passed through his hands, many he saved.

Title: The exhibition - Mariupol Invincible - has started in the capital
Description: The event was attended by residents of Mariupol, clergy, representatives of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine, other state bodies and local authorities. The head of the -Voices- public organization, actress and theater producer Olga Sobko said that Kyiv residents and guests of the capital will see the -living voice of the people of Mariupol- at the exhibition: -They will see people who, being under occupation, wanted to express their protest against the horrors that were happening at that time. People who wanted to say that they are Ukrainians. Visitors will see many paintings by different artists, because the Mariupol tragedy cannot but touch the heart of any person, especially a creative person.- According to Olga Sobko, artists from different parts of Ukraine and the world wanted to express their support for Mariupol with their works and say that they remember the city and carry the history of Mariupol further to the world. -The idea of ​​the project belongs to Valery Yurichkovsky. He organized the first exhibition in Mariupol underground. Several artists gathered there and brought their paintings. Later, these artists left Mariupol in different ways. And already being in Ukraine, they started holding such exhibitions openly,- Olga Sobko added. -The tragedy of Mariupol, together with the extraordinary courage of its residents and defenders, was felt by every visitor of the exhibition. The city has become a symbol of indomitability, and such exhibitions help not only to preserve the memory of its tragedy, but also to support those who went through the hell of the occupation,- noted the representative of the Ministry of Defense Volodymyr Slynko. -Mariupol Invincible- is an international art project that has gained international recognition. The exhibition is a permanent, mobile exposition that travels around the world. It has already taken place in Italy, Germany, Poland, Lithuania, Latvia, Estonia. Currently, the exhibition will be held in the bell tower of the Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra until March 2.

Title: -In the war he learned to fly-: the story of the scout -Barbera-
Description: The story of the fighter was made public on the brigade's page. A year ago he was a hairdresser, and today he is a UAV operator performing important reconnaissance missions. His path to technology was quite difficult, but it was military service and the new demands of war that prompted him to master a new field. -We have to move forward, we can only win this war with intelligence - otherwise it will not work,- says -Barber-. And if the mind is the key to victory, then the drone control panel became his tool. It all started with a simple desire to learn. -The main thing is to want to learn, develop and mow down orcs,- he jokes, emphasizing the importance of motivation and the desire to improve. A week after he first picked up a drone remote control, Barber started flying FPV drones. Today, he knows how to fly a variety of models, from Mavics to Wings, and is capable of working with all the equipment that comes into his hands. Own initiative and the desire to develop - this is what became the basis for success. -If a person wants to learn, if they have the will, they can learn any technique,- he says, adding that even those with no previous experience with the technique can become excellent drone operators. -Personally, I've only been cutting people's hair a year ago, and I never thought I'd be able to fly drones,- Barber admits. Now he works in intelligence, and drones have become an indispensable tool for completing tasks. According to him, without technical innovations such as drones, victory in the war would be impossible. Every day, he realizes that the development and technical equipment of the fighters of the 141st brigade is not just an important aspect, but a necessity for achieving results. -With such a team working together with me, there are no impossible tasks,- he adds, emphasizing the cohesion, strength and indomitability of his crew. As reported by ArmyInform, Gostomel. February 24, 2022. The sky is cut by the roar of the propellers of Ka-52 attack helicopters. There are six of them, they fly low, covered by the folds of the terrain. Russian airborne troops are preparing to land at the Antonov airfield. But they are already waiting for them on the ground.

Title: Museums in the occupied territories have become a weapon in the hands of the Russians: the FSB contr...
Description: This is reported by the Center of National Resistance. To centralize propaganda in the captured museums, the Russians appointed curators from the FSB to each of them. Now self-appointed directors have to coordinate exhibitions with Kremlin officials. In addition, the FSB employees will determine the personnel policy of the museum and check the scenarios of excursions so that they take place in the right tone of the Kremlin. The National Resistance Center calls for continued reporting of enemy actions with the goal of effectively destroying the occupiers and their accomplices. This fact is another evidence that the Russian occupiers use culture and history as a tool of propaganda and disinformation. They are trying to rewrite history in their own way, impose their own ideology and destroy Ukrainian identity. As reported by ArmyInform, on the Day of the Heroes of the Heavenly Hundred in the Kyiv Palace of Children and Youth (KPDU) with the support of the Department of Science and Education of the City of Kyiv opened an exhibition dedicated to the Hero of Ukraine Andriy Pilshchikov, a fighter pilot with the callsign -Jus-, and educator Badri Lolashvili, who defended the country since 2014 and died during the defense of Kyiv.

Title: Dnipropetrovsk region under enemy fire: Nikopol and communities suffered 10 attacks in a day
Description: informs the head of Dnipropetrovsk OVA Serhii Lysak about this. According to him, Nikopol, Mirivska, Marganetska and Chervonogrigorivska communities came under fire. Infrastructure and 7 private houses were damaged as a result of enemy attacks. One farm building was also destroyed and another was damaged. Fortunately, there were no casualties this time. -People were not hurt,- noted Serhiy Lysak. As reported by ArmyInform, today, February 24, Russian troops carried out an airstrike on the village of Tsupivka district of Kharkiv region. As a result of the attack, four civilians were injured, among them there are seriously wounded.

Title: Rustem Umerov: Ukraine and Denmark are taking the defense partnership to a new level
Description: He wrote about this on his Facebook page. This step is a logical continuation of the successful -Danish model- of funding, which has already proven its effectiveness. Denmark is one of Ukraine's staunchest allies, having provided more than €7 billion in military aid since the start of the full-scale invasion. Thanks to joint efforts, the Ukrainian defense-industrial complex (ODC) is receiving a powerful push for development. Almost 600 million euros have already been raised within the framework of the -Danish model-, and another 1.5 billion euros are planned to be invested in 2025. Denmark undertakes to allocate 2.2 billion euros annually for the period of 2025-2028 to support the Defense Forces of Ukraine. In addition to financial assistance, Denmark actively helps with the supply and maintenance of modern F-16 fighters, and also trains Ukrainian pilots and technical personnel. During the meeting, the ministers discussed the current security situation and enemy plans. The Air Force Commander, Brigadier General Oleh Zakharchuk, spoke about the important role of the F-16 in protecting Ukrainian skies. Ukraine highly appreciates Denmark's leadership in the process of transferring these modern combat aircraft. Rustem Umyerov thanked Troels Lund Poulsen and the Danish parliamentarians for their visit and support. He emphasized that Denmark remains a reliable ally of Ukraine, and cooperation between the countries will only deepen. As reported by ArmyInform, the Minister of Defense of Ukraine, Rustem Umyerov, said that in the past three years, Ukraine not only stood up against the Russian aggressor, but also strengthened.

Title: -Wings of Omega- continue to destroy the enemy: attack UAVs effectively hit the concentration of ene...
Description: The video of combat work was published on the unit's page. Strike UAVs -Omega Wings- once again prove their effectiveness in the fight against Russian invaders. Kamikaze drone pilots skillfully detect and destroy the enemy, inflicting significant losses on them. The video shows how our drones attack a group of Russian soldiers, inflicting fatal injuries on them. The enemy has no chance to save himself, because every blow is accurate and deadly. As reported by ArmyInform, snipers of the 3rd separate detachment of the Special Purpose Center Omega neutralized Russian infantrymen who were moving in the water in the Kherson region.

Title: -His own director-: how a Ukrainian was looking for adventure on the border, but found mines, wolves...
Description: informs DPSU about this. Two days of wandering through the forests between Zhytomyr Region and Rivne Region could be his last. The man not only came across a minefield, but also met a pack of wolves. Twice he miraculously did not drown in the swamps, and fierce night frosts could easily turn his adventure into an icy drama. -Don't try to cross the border illegally, especially in the northern direction. This is very dangerous,- the head of one of the border guard units, in whose area the violator was found, commented on the incident. This story could be the plot of an adventure film, if it were not so real and dangerous. Fortunately, thanks to the vigilance of the border guards, everything ended well. However, this case should serve as a lesson to those who take their own safety lightly and think they can circumvent the law. A border is not a place for games, and a minefield is not a backdrop for selfies. ArmyInform reminds that it is better not to break the law or risk your life, but to use the aggregator of vacancies in the Armed Forces and recruiting centers.

Title: Infantry, drones, rescue: how Nestor from the Rubizh brigade helps his brothers at the front
Description: The story of the fighter was made public on page 4 of the operational assignment brigade -Rubizh- of NSU. Nestor guarded critical infrastructure facilities for two years, but then decided to join the -Rubizh- Brigade as an infantryman, underwent training and coordination at the training ground, and received his first combat assignment - the defense of frontiers in the village of Stelmakhivka, Luhansk region. However, during missions in combat positions, Nestor became interested in drones, so when the opportunity arose to become a UAV operator, he took it. — I have an acquaintance who went into drone flying, he flies on Heavy shot — these are large shock drones. He said that this is a very interesting and promising direction. When I was in the infantry and watching drones, I knew I wanted to try it, too, he says. Now Nestor is not only a drone operator, but also saves the lives of his brothers as a medic. After serving in the infantry, he well understands the importance of drones for covering Ukrainian positions: — If you are an infantryman, you need support from the sky. When you sit in the landing, you see only the ground. But you need to know what is happening from above. Without drones, the guys cannot cope, so we are constantly working at full capacity. Ahead of the national guard are new challenges and tasks. For those who want to join the army, but hesitate, Nestor advises not to be afraid: - You need to act, because until you test yourself, you will not know. If there is a desire, everything will work out. As reported by ArmyInform, for Andrii, call sign -Cold-, the war began on February 24, 2022. In his peaceful life, he worked in the banking sector, but, like thousands of Ukrainians, he could not stay away. He joined the Territorial Defense Forces, defended Kyiv region, went through the hell of Irpen and Buchi.

Title: Traitors got what they deserved: the court sentenced four militants who fought against Ukraine
Description: informs the SBU about this. Among the convicts there is also a colorful personality - the militant Lee Won Chol, a Ukrainian of Korean origin, known under the pseudonym Herman Prokopiv. Back in 2014, he helped install Russian flags in Luhansk and fought against ATO forces. With the beginning of a full-scale invasion, the traitor did not change his -convictions- and helped the invaders attack Ukrainian cities. However, his -career- ended in 2024 when he was captured by the Defense Forces during the fighting for Spirne in Donetsk. In addition to him, three more traitors who fought on the side of the occupiers in different areas of the Eastern Front were convicted. One of them, a resident of the temporarily occupied Luhansk region, -served- in the 4th motorized rifle brigade of the Russian Federation, where he was involved in the evacuation of wounded Russian soldiers. Another set up firing positions and fortifications for the 7th Motorized Rifle Brigade of the occupiers. Both of them were captured by Ukrainian defenders during the fighting in 2024. The fourth convict is a native of Kharkiv region, who lived in Russia for a long time, where he was mobilized to the 59th tank regiment of the Russian Federation. After a short -training-, he was thrown into an assault on the positions of Ukrainian troops near the village of Terny in Donetsk region, where his unit was destroyed, and he himself was taken prisoner. The court found the perpetrators guilty under four articles of the Criminal Code of Ukraine: treason, collaborative activity, encroachment on the territorial integrity and inviolability of Ukraine, and participation in the activities of armed groups not provided for by law. As reported by ArmyInform,The Security Service of Ukraine records a significant activation of Russian special services in conducting information and psychological special operations in Ukraine, in particular, the number of information sabotage aimed at dividing society and artificially spreading protest sentiments.

Title: -An educated nation is invincible-: the Chief of the General Staff of the Armed Forces addressed sch...
Description: This is reported by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The lesson, organized by the Apparatus of the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine, gathered more than 27,000 pupils and students from all over the country. Lieutenant General Anatoliy Barhylevych emphasized the unity of the Ukrainian people in the fight against the aggressor, noting that this is what allowed Ukraine to endure and continue the fight, despite the enemy's superiority in weaponry. He mentioned the successful operations of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, such as the liberation of Kyiv region, Sumy region, Chernihiv region, Kharkiv region and Kherson, stressing that this was possible thanks to the joint efforts of the military and civilians. According to the chief of the General Staff, the losses of the Russian army in 2024 amounted to almost 434 thousand people, and in total for three years of the war - almost 900 thousand. He thanked the pupils and students for their support, recalling that since the first days of the war, they had helped the army in various ways: from direct participation in hostilities to volunteering and the development of new technologies. Lieutenant General Anatoliy Barhylevych emphasized that today the Armed Forces of Ukraine are switching to high-tech systems, and high-quality education is the key to successfully mastering these technologies and creating their own developments. He called on pupils and students to continue their studies, despite the war, because their knowledge is an investment in the country's future. -An educated nation that believes in freedom and loves its country cannot be conquered,- he stressed. As reported by ArmyInform, on the night of February 24, the Defense Forces of Ukraine struck the Ryazan Oil Refinery plant in the Ryazan region, which is involved in the provision of the occupation army of the Russian Federation.

Title: The defense forces demonstrate the fine work of FPV drones: every strike is precisely on target
Description: The video of combat work was made public on the brigade's page. Result? Every sortie is a hit. Every shot is minus the occupier. The Russians now have a new position - -extras in the survival game-. Only survival in this game is not foreseen for them. Drones have turned the war into an intellectual duel, where Ukraine leads the party cold-bloodedly and accurately, and the Russians can only hope for a -gesture of goodwill.- As reported by ArmyInform, the operator of the UAV under the pseudonym -Puma- became a real terror for the Russian military, during its service more than 300 occupants.

Title: In Sumy Oblast, the occupiers attacked a civilian car with a drone: one person died, one was injured
Description: This is reported by the Sumy Regional Prosecutor's Office. As a result of the attack, the 62-year-old car driver died in an ambulance from his injuries. A 31-year-old passenger was injured and hospitalized. Currently, prosecutors, together with other law enforcement agencies, are documenting the consequences of the shooting. The pre-trial investigation is carried out by investigators of the Sumy District Police Department. As reported by ArmyInform, today, February 11, around 3:00 p.m., the occupiers dropped two guided aerial bombs on the civilian infrastructure of the Krasnopil community of Sumsk. district, as a result of which a 40-year-old man and a 30-year-old woman were killed.

Title: The hunter for -Alligators-: the fighter -Rubezh- told how he shot down the first Russian Ka-52 over...
Description: Serhiy Falatiuk, a fighter of the 4th brigade of operational assignment -Rubizh- of the National Guard of Ukraine with the call sign -Fara-, stands with the portable anti-aircraft missile system -Igla-. In his hands is a chance to change the course of events. The story of the fighter was made public in an interview on the brigade's page. -It was sent over the radio that our aircraft would be operating. I went out to have a look. But I heard the sound of propellers in the sky,- Fara recalls. Ka-52s appeared on the horizon. These are Russian modern attack helicopters. -Then it became clear: with what intention they were flying,- says the fighter. -I took the rocket, launched it on the first one. He gave the command: -Fire at enemy aircraft!-- he recalls. The missile hit a block of unguided missiles, and the Ka-52 made an emergency landing. In a few hours, photos of the downed -Alligator- appeared on the Internet, next to which local residents posed. Later it became known that the commander of the Russian brigade could be on board. He shot down the second -Farah- helicopter without any chance of rescue - it exploded in the air. According to the soldier, the destruction of the Ka-52 prevented the Russian military from quickly landing an amphibious assault. -If we hadn't opened fire, they would have gone in much faster,- he explains. The attack continued. Soldiers of -Rubezh- together with units of the Armed Forces destroyed the enemy, moving between shelters. But the main thing has already happened - the Ukrainian military did not allow the enemy to gain a foothold. -The Pskov landing party was destroyed. Artillery of the 72nd Brigade leveled them to the ground,- the fighter recalls. After Gostomel, -Farah- shot down two more Su-25s, continuing its struggle with Russian aviation. But warfare is changing, and now the main threat is drones. -Russians learn from their mistakes. Their aircraft do not come close, they work from high altitudes,- he explains. That is why Ukrainian forces are switching to new methods of struggle. -We use FPV drones to destroy enemy reconnaissance drones. It's cheaper and more efficient,- Farah says. The Ukrainian army proves that even the most powerful enemy can be defeated not by quantity, but by skill and innovation. For a fighter, the most difficult thing was not the battle itself, but the realization that it was only the beginning. -On the first day of the war, I thought: if only I wouldn't die. Because I understood that it would take a long time,- he says. The story of Fara is the story of those who changed the course of the war. Who did not allow the enemy to capture the capital in a matter of hours. Who became a real nightmare for Russian aviation. As reported by ArmyInform, a story about the first assault of a young border guard with the call sign -Wise-. The guy, who was a cadet just last year, now commands a platoon of border guards of the brigade -Steel border-.

Title: UAH 7 million of suspended payments were returned to the military — Ministry of Defense
Description: This is reported by the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine. Thus, it was established that six servicemen who were undergoing treatment abroad stopped receiving payments due to late submission of documents by the officials of the military unit for conducting a remote medical examination of the VLK. In addition, 46 servicemen did not pass a military medical examination (MCU) for two months and remained at the disposal of the unit commander without finding out the reasons for the lengthy medical examination. This led to a significant reduction in their payments. The Ministry of Defense quickly intervened in the situation - the Central Department for the Protection of Servicemen's Rights sent relevant requests to the military unit, the command of the Ground Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine and the military hospital. As a result, the military unit prepared all the necessary documents, which made it possible to conduct remote medical examinations and resume payments. -This situation has become an example of how timely response and control over compliance with laws allows the rights of servicemen to be restored. Thanks to the investigation and interaction with the command, the payment to the military was returned. We will continue to monitor these issues to ensure adequate funding for our defenders. The military should fight, not fight the bureaucracy,- said Deputy Minister of Defense of Ukraine, Brigadier General of Justice Serhii Melnyk. As of today, according to the Ministry of Defense, 3.9 million hryvnias have already been paid to the military, the rest - almost 3 million hryvnias - will be paid during March. As reported by ArmyInform, The Ministry of Defense, together with partners, has determined the place where a training ground will be created for testing the latest technologies demining, in particular with the use of artificial intelligence.

Title: Work behind enemy lines, a raid by NSU special forces, donkeys in the Russian army: a stream from a ...
Description: In the Zaporizhzhia region, a Ukrainian subversive-reconnaissance group entered the rear of the enemy. Title: Volodymyr Zelenskyi took part in the meeting of G7 leaders: the main points of the negotiations
Description: He informed about this on his page. As the head of state noted, the meeting was productive, and most partners expressed a principled position regarding assistance to Ukraine. The main focus of the discussion was the need for security guarantees for Ukraine and real ways to stop Russian aggression. Volodymyr Zelenskyi emphasized that peace should not only be achieved, but also as reliable and stable as possible. -We count on the unity of the world - Europe, America and all peoples who strive to live in peace and according to international rules,- the President of Ukraine noted. As reported by ArmyInform, Volodymyr Zelenskyy delivered a speech at the plenary session of the summit -Support Ukraine- to the third anniversary of the beginning of the large-scale invasion of the Russians.

Title: - Luhansk character - with a machine gun: how children are prepared for war in the occupied Luhansk ...
Description: This was reported by the head of the Luhansk OVA, Artem Lysogor. The occupiers believe that the involvement of militants in classes will contribute to the development of a -sense of collectivism- in children. Simply put, young Ukrainians are forced to get used to the military presence and ideology of the -Russian world- from an early age. However, -educational- work with children is not limited to lessons and dividing them into groups. Militarization of young men in the -LNR- is also carried out under the guise of -labor training-. The Luhansk Economic and Legal Lyceum has a military-historical class, where students learn information warfare and drone control skills in the -Fundamentals of Homeland Security and Defense- classes. The occupying power has developed a long-term strategy for training personnel for its army in the occupied territories. Children are -zombified- with propaganda from an early age, preparing them for the fact that war is -normal- and service in the army is an -honorable duty.- Of course, one can laugh ironically at this, saying, -what kind of -education- can there be if the -educators- are people armed to the teeth who came to a foreign land to kill and destroy.- But in reality the situation is dire. The Russians want to destroy the identity of Ukrainian children, turning them into obedient soldiers of their army. As reported by ArmyInform, the leader of the so-called lnr launched the regional personnel program -Heroes of Luhansk Region-, which provides that the new the governing elite of the -republic- will be formed from representatives of the Russian army.

Title: Great Britain announced the largest package of sanctions against Russia
Description: This is stated in a message on the website of the British government. The sanctions package targets Russia's military supply chains, the revenues that fuel Putin's illegal war, and the kleptocrats that bring profits to the Kremlin. Sanctions will also target the Russian military machine, the entities in third countries that support it, and the supply chains it relies on. Among the objects of sanctions are manufacturers and suppliers of machine tools, electronics and dual-purpose goods for the Russian military, including microprocessors used in weapons systems. They are based in a number of third countries, including Central Asian countries, Turkey, Thailand, India and China, which is the largest supplier of critical goods to the Russian military. North Korean Defense Minister Noh Kwang-chol and other North Korean generals and high-ranking officials involved in the deployment of more than 11,000 North Korean troops in Russia were also sanctioned. The list included 13 Russian citizens and companies, including Grant-Trade LLC, its owner Marat Mustafayev and his sister Dinara Mustafayev, who used the company to supply advanced European technology to Russia to support its illegal war. For the first time, Britain used new powers to impose sanctions on foreign financial institutions that support the Russian military machine. It is about OJSC -Keremet Bank-, based in Kyrgyzstan. The new sanctions also extend to 40 more -shadow fleet- ships carrying Russian oil. Only in the last six months, these ships together transported more than $5 billion worth of Russian oil and oil products. -We are imposing sanctions on 14 -new kleptocrats-, some of whom are engaged in the creation of strategic sectors of the Russian economy. Among them is Roman Trotsenko, one of the richest people in Russia, whose fortune is 2.2 billion pounds,- the statement said. As ArmiyaInform reported, the Council of the European Union adopted today a broad 16th package of economic and individual restrictive measures against Russia.

Title: -Omega- in Kharkiv region: special forces clear enemy shelters and take prisoners
Description: The video of combat work was made public on the brigade's page. The footage shows Omega fighters clearing the occupants' shelters using grenades and small arms. The operation is fast and efficient: the enemy did not expect such an onslaught and suffered losses. In addition, special forces captured prisoners. Their fate is currently unknown, but it can be assumed that they will be used to exchange or obtain valuable information about the enemy. As reported by ArmyInform, Ukrainian soldiers defeated an assault group of Russian invaders on the approaches to their positions in the Donetsk region.

Title: In Sumy Oblast, one person was killed and five were wounded as a result of enemy shelling
Description: This was reported by the Sumy Regional Prosecutor's Office. On civil infrastructure in the village. According to preliminary data, the enemy dropped guided aerial bombs in Myropyllya of the Sumy district. A 69-year-old retired couple and a 71-year-old man were injured. The occupiers also shelled a farm in the village with artillery. Shevchenko's Velikopysarov communities of Okhtyr district. A 44-year-old worker died, two more were injured. Under the procedural leadership of the Sumy District Prosecutor's Office and the Okhtyr District Prosecutor's Office, pre-trial investigations into the commission of war crimes are being conducted. Prosecutors, in cooperation with other law enforcement officers, document the consequences of the shelling. As ArmiyaInform reported, on February 24, Russian troops launched an airstrike on the village of Tsupivka, Dergachiv district, Kharkiv region. As a result of the attack, four civilians were injured, among them there are seriously wounded.

Title: -Contract 18-24-: clear term of service, travel abroad and mortgage at 0%
Description: In the previous material, we considered in detail the financial opportunities offered to volunteers. Today we will consider other incentives offered by the state to Ukrainians aged 18 to 24 for a year of service. A contract for Ukrainians aged 18 to 24 is not compulsory. It is only signed on a voluntary basis. And it includes what most servicemen dream of - a clear term of service. The contract is for 1 year. Approximately 2.5 months are allocated to it for training (45 days of general, 2 weeks of professional and up to 14 more days for coordination in the unit). That is, you can try your hand at it. And if you don't like it, leave at the end of the contract. After the contract expires, if the volunteer decides not to stay in the army, he will not be mobilized for 12 months. This will be possible only with their consent. Such volunteers will also be able to travel abroad. For this, you will need a military registration document, as well as a certificate from the military unit, or TCC and SP, which will confirm the completion of service under this contract. Here we are talking about the -eOselya- program, which has been operating for many years. But if in it mortgages are issued at 7% for combatants and 3% for contract servicemen, then for volunteers under the -contract 18-24- project, the interest rate is 0% per annum. Of course, issuing such a mortgage requires some time and effort. But it is unlikely that you can find other options with such conditions. You can read more about this mortgage lending program here One of the conditions of this contract is to participate in hostilities for 6 months. That is, after serving such a contract, the volunteer will receive the status of a participant in hostilities. This status provides a significant number of benefits. One of them is education. In particular, there are options for obtaining higher education at the expense of the state budget - there are quotas that are allocated specifically for beneficiaries. You can read more about it here. In general, Ukrainian legislation provides many benefits for UBD. And although some of them are already somewhat outdated, such as telephone lines or free internet in libraries, there are still a lot of such benefits that work and give you the opportunity to save. These include benefits for travel, utilities and medical care. We have already written about most of them, so you can get acquainted here.

Title: 70% die on the way to assaults - the enemy has a huge number of -irrational- losses
Description: Andriy Otchenash, commander of the crew of the Kara nebesna 4th operational brigade of the National Guard of Ukraine, said on the Espresso broadcast . According to him, approximately 70-80 percent of all such groups are destroyed on the way to the battle line. Another part is already directly at the storage points. However, it cannot be said that the enemy is acting without success. -Obviously, they will definitely have certain advances of several tens to hundreds of meters with a huge number of assault actions. But if you look at the number of losses among the enemy's personnel, and the amount received, then these are irrational costs that do not bring them any tactical gains,- the commander of the -Kara Nebesna- UAVs told the crew. A large amount of work is currently being done by enemy drones. A large number of fiber-optic drones is especially harmful to the Defense Forces. -Of course, it complicates the work of logistics and the movement of personnel. That is, they try to extinguish all our defense methods with drones and artillery fire as much as possible, and then they try to release the infantry. We see that there is logic in their actions. The enemy does not manage to get any achievements, thanks to the heroism of our fighters,- noted Andriy Otchenash. As ArmyInform reported, in the Pokrovsk direction, the enemy does not abandon its intentions to surround the Defense Forces in the area of ​​the city itself. However, after the counterattacks of the Defense Forces, the enemy somewhat reduced its activity.

Title: The GUR reported the details of the explosion in the office of the traitor-border guard
Description: This was reported by the Main Intelligence Directorate of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine on February 24. Podsudevskiy is a traitor to Ukraine, a collaborator, a former high-ranking official of the Border Service of Ukraine who fled to occupied Crimea in 2015. There, for some time, he served the Gauleiter Aksyonov, nicknamed -Goblin- and began cooperation with the Chekists of the so-called -FSB Department for the Republic of Crimea-. Between this administration of the enemy's special service in the temporarily occupied Crimea and another clan of the FSB of the Russian Federation, internal enmity continues over the flow of money in the captured territories of the Zaporizhzhia region. In fact, the explosion in Podsudevsky's office in occupied Primorsk was organized by the Fesbeshniks from Moscow, and it became another manifestation of the grudge between the Chekists for Deriban. In this way, the Fesbeshniks from Lubyanka sent a signal to the collaborator Podsudevsky and his patrons about the need to curb their appetites and be more accommodating to the -elder brother-. The incident with the explosion became known to the top leaders of the FSB, now the Chekists are conducting checks inside the special service. The GUR of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine reminds that even humble and diligent service to the occupying power does not guarantee protection from liquidation by greedy Muscovite corruptors. As reported by ArmyInform, a Russian war criminal was eliminated in Berdyansk.

Title: In the Pokrovsky direction, the occupiers tried to seize Ukrainian positions 20 times
Description: This is in the operational information of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine as of 4:00 p.m. on February 24. Border settlements, including Shevchenkove, Malushyne, Velyka Pisarivka, Pokrovka, Oleksandrivka, Luhivka, Bila Bereza, Timofiivka of the Sumy region, suffer from shelling from the territory of the Russian Federation; Kamianka, Chernihiv region. In the Kharkiv direction, our defenders repulse an enemy assault in the Vovchansk district. In the Kupyansk direction, the enemy carried out nine assaults near Petropavlivka and Zagryzovy. Six clashes are ongoing. In the Lyman direction, the invading army attacked four times near the settlements of Zelena Dolyna, Borivska Andriivka, and Novolyubivka. The defense forces repulse one Russian attack near Stupochkion the Kramatorsk direction. On the Toretsk direction the enemy attacked seven times near Toretsk and Crimea. Three attacks are still ongoing. In the Pokrovsky direction since the beginning of the day, the occupiers have made 20 attempts to dislodge our defenders from their positions in the areas of Vodyane Druge, Promin, Pokrovsk, Leontovichi, Kotlyna, Udachne, Molodetske, Nadiivka, Troitske, Andriivka and Ulakly settlements. The defense forces are holding back the enemy's onslaught and have repulsed 17 attacks, with three engagements still ongoing. Enemy losses are being refined. Today, in the Novopavlovsk direction, the enemy launched ten attacks near Constantinople and Burlatskyi, one battle continues to this day. In the Gulyajpil direction, our defenders repelled one attack near Novopol. With the support of attack aircraft today, the enemy attacked the settlement of Kamianske in the Orichiv direction. In the Dnieper direction our troops repelled two enemy attacks in the direction of the Sadove settlement. In the Northern direction today, the enemy did not conduct active operations. In the operational zone in Kurshchyna, units of the Defense Forces of Ukraine repelled seven attacks by Russian invaders during the day, one battle is still ongoing. The enemy carried out more than 220 attacks, including 12 from rocket salvo systems, carried out 16 air strikes, dropping 21 guided bombs. In other areas of the front, the situation has not undergone significant changes.

Title: A place has been determined for the creation of a testing ground for the latest technologies in mine...
Description: The Ministry of Defense of Ukraine informed about this on February 24. Representatives of the Main Directorate of Mine Action, Civil Defense and Environmental Security, the UN Development Program, the Ministry of Economy and the National Defense Industry Association visited the location of the future training ground. The participants of the meeting assessed the effectiveness of the existing base and discussed the prospects of its use for testing advanced technologies. -This is the first step within the strategic initiative to create an innovative test site. Together with our partners, we identified the key areas of further work and decided to create here a training and testing complex for the development of the latest technologies in the field of mine action, where not only technology modernization will be carried out, but also a bank of innovative solutions will be formed. It also opens up new aspects of international partnership,- said Olga Drobot, a representative of the Main Department of Mine Action. UNDP and the Ministry of Economy expressed interest in the development of this project as a basis for the formation of a coordination platform for innovations in humanitarian demining. Ahead is the creation of a road map, the formation of a working group and preparation for the first tests. Participants of the on-site meeting emphasized that the creation of such a modern test site will contribute to the development of the latest technologies that will enable the acceleration of humanitarian demining, increase the safety of deminers and reduce risks for the civilian population. As reported by ArmyInform, the Ministry of Defense named the oblast leaders by the number of appeals to recruiting centers.

Title: Denmark announced a new package of military aid to Ukraine
Description: This is stated in a message on the site of the Danish government. The money will be used for ammunition for Ukrainian servicemen and the development of the Ukrainian brigade together with the countries of Northern Europe and the Baltic States. Prime Minister of Denmark Mette Frederiksen said that for three years, Ukrainians fought heroically, defending themselves from the large-scale invasion of Russia. -Putin's military machine carries out brutal attacks on the civilian population, shelling schools and children's hospitals. Russia is responsible for years of deaths and destruction,- she emphasized. Mette Frederiksen stressed that Denmark will continue to support Ukraine as long as it is necessary. -Ukraine is fighting for all of Europe. We must put Ukraine in the strongest possible position. I am proud that Denmark, together with the Nordic and Baltic countries, is a leader in supporting Ukraine. Now we must hold fast. Provide more weapons and do it faster. Provide funds for the Ukrainian defense industry. Because we are at a fateful moment. What we are doing now will be crucial for future generations in Ukraine and Europe,- she concluded. As ArmiyaInform reported, Sweden will provide a new package of military aid to strengthen Ukraine's air defense.

Title: A propagandist who admired the Russian army was exposed in Kharkiv Oblast
Description: The Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office informs about this. According to the investigation, the unemployed man from Kharkiv was an active participant in anti-Ukrainian Telegram channels, where he left comments in support of the Russian occupiers. He supported the Russian army in every possible way, emphasized its successes and humiliated the Ukrainian defenders. In particular, the propagandist wrote: -I'm a Ukrainian, it's true, but I transferred money to subordinate units of the Russian Federation.- He also claimed that the Russian military has never bombed Ukrainian cities, and that their strikes are aimed only at -reconnaissance targets.- In addition, the resident of Kharkiv admired Putin and praised his actions. In one of his comments, he urged the -second army of the world- not to shell Kyiv, because it is a -Russian city that will still be useful.- As for Kharkiv, the propagandist believed that the Ukrainian authorities should accept Russia's conditions, and then the region would automatically become part of the -brotherly country-. Law enforcement officers exposed a fan of -Russian world-. He faces five to eight years in prison. A pre-trial investigation is currently underway. As reported by ArmyInform, the Kharkiv Court of Appeal confirmed the sentence of a 50-year-old associate professor of one of the Kharkiv vyshiv, who was found guilty of treason and sentenced to 15 years in prison with confiscation of property.

Title: Russian aviation attacked Tsupivka in the Kharkiv region: four were injured, some were seriously inj...
Description: The Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office informs about this. According to the investigation, at around 10:15 in the morning, Russian planes dropped aerial bombs on the residential quarters of Tsupivka. As a result of the shelling, fires broke out, at least 20 houses, farm buildings and cars were damaged. Four civilians were injured: a 21-year-old man, a 19-year-old girl and two men aged 37 and 73. A 21-year-old man was diagnosed with acubarotrauma, his condition is satisfactory. A 19-year-old girl suffered multiple shrapnel wounds and is in a medium condition. Two men were seriously injured: a 37-year-old man and a 73-year-old man received blast injuries and fractures, their condition is assessed as serious. Law enforcement officers are working at the scene, documenting yet another war crime of the Russian occupiers. Due to the shelling of Tsupivka, the Dergachy District Prosecutor's Office started a pre-trial investigation for h. 1 Art. 438 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (violation of the laws and customs of war). As reported by ArmyInform, today in Brovary, fragments of an enemy UAV hit an unfinished high-rise building, causing a fire on the 23rd floor.

Title: A conference was held for dentists of the Defense Forces
Description: It was organized and conducted by the public organization -Dental Front- with the support of the command of the Medical Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. This is one of the few events that managed to gather dentists from the security forces during Russia's large-scale aggression against independent Ukraine. As Marianna Bilyk, head of the NGO -Dental Front- noted, the task of the conference is to improve the quality of providing dental care and medical documentation in dentistry, to establish horizontal connections between doctors: -The problem is that when fighters are on the front line not for three months, not for four, but for a year or two, the situation with teeth becomes catastrophic. Teeth cannot regenerate or heal themselves, so specialist intervention is required. And here is the question that with dental caries we have sanitary losses, we actually have a loss of a fighter. The oral cavity is the entrance to the entire body. And when we have problems in the oral cavity, we immediately get problems in the gastrointestinal tract, the immune system suffers, complications also arise, and this is the head, and if the inflammation goes to the brain, it can even be life-threatening. And that is why it is very important here that the planned treatment of dental diseases is carried out. We have to get this process right and we can set an example for the whole world in building dental care, especially on the front line.- Dmytro Samofalov, major of the medical service, head of the advanced surgical department of the military medical clinical center of the Southern region, noted that -this conference is incredibly important, because there is a great need for military personnel in dental care. Our advanced surgical department is located near the contact line in the southern direction, we have a mobile dental office that is seconded to my department, and doctors work every day without a day off. At the same time, these same dentists are actively involved in helping the wounded, because they have quite a lot of facial injuries. We have one dentist and one maxillofacial surgeon, and they provide care for a wide variety of facial injuries, injuries not only to the dental part, but also to the cheekbones, and they are even actively involved in providing care for head injuries, because, in principle, there is no neurosurgeon on the front line in the surgical department.- Senior lieutenant of the medical service Volodymyr, head of the dental office of one of the airborne assault brigades, temporarily acting as the commander of the medical company, said that -such a conference is very important, because practicing dentists should communicate in order to teach each other something. Today, unfortunately, military dentists are isolated from each other. They hardly communicate, well, or infrequently. Every time I changed my location, I tried to find some dentists within a radius of several kilometers or several tens of kilometers to get to know each other.

Title: February 24 is not a holiday, but a struggle: how SSO operator Price celebrates his birthday in the ...
Description: The story of the fighter was made public on page 73 of the special purpose naval center named after the port captain Antin Holovaty. -He has not celebrated his birthday for several years since he joined the service. Says: -I associate this date not with a holiday, but primarily with war. When it ends, then I will celebrate,- says the message on the center's page. Price joined the Special Operations Forces after a full-scale Russian invasion began. Before that, he had nothing to do with the army, worked abroad and returned to Ukraine on the eve of the invasion. At the time, he thought it was temporary, but the war is still going on. He was the only one of the hundred mobilized cadets who answered -yes- to the question of the recruiter of the 73 center: -Who is not afraid of water?-. Thus began his path to the special purpose group. Together with his comrades, he studied, gained experience and performed tasks on the islands of the Kherson region, in Krynk, where he personally saved several wounded boys. -There are a lot of people in our ranks who, like Price, learned about war after the start of a full-scale invasion. There are also those who have taken up arms against the Russians and their oppressors since 2014. We all have two things in common: love for one's Motherland and hatred for our enemies,- the 73rd center of the SSO notes. February 24, 2022 became the point of no return for many Ukrainians, because they understood that Russia's goal is to seize Ukraine, destroy the unconquered and turn the rest into slaves. But Ukrainians resisted and continue to fight for their freedom.
