On this day, it is important to honor the memory of everyone who died defending their land, and to support those who continue to fight for every Ukrainian. Price turns 27 today. As reported by ArmyInform, an interesting publication about equipment appeared on the page of the 73 naval center of special purpose named after the basket commander Antin Holovaty operators The device that fighters use for demining attracts special attention.

Title: The President presented the Battle Flag to the 115th Separate Mechanized Brigade
Description: The brigade deserved it in the tough battles with the Russian occupiers. As the head of the communications department of the 115th brigade, Lieutenant Yevhen, told ArmyInform, the brigade was created back in March 2022. Considering the intensity of hostilities, the military leadership made a decision to immediately involve units of the newly formed 115 separate mechanized brigade to repulse the enemy offensive on one of the most difficult directions. For this purpose, the military unit was moved to certain areas of the Donetsk and Luhansk regions to perform assigned tasks. -Since the beginning of April 2022, units of the 115th separate mechanized brigade were involved in repelling the enemy offensive in the defense zone near the settlement of Severodonetsk, where, despite the enemy's significant superiority in weapons and manpower, they held the defense for almost 2 months - until the end of May 2022. From June to mid-July 2022, the 115th separate mechanized brigade restrained the onslaught of enemy troops near the settlement of Lysychansk,- said Yevhen. -After a short-term recovery, servicemen of the 115th separate mechanized brigade from mid-August to mid-November 2022 performed their assigned combat tasks in the Donetsk region, in the defense zone near the Donetsk airport. After conducting active hostilities in the Donetsk direction, the brigade was withdrawn for recovery. After the restoration of the servicemen of the brigade, they were sent to the Sumy region, where they performed combat tasks related to border protection from January 2023 to May 2023. In the period from June 2023 to August 2023, the 115th separate mechanized brigade took part in active combat operations in the Donetsk region near the settlements of Toretsk and New York, after which it was relocated, and from mid-August 2023 it performed combat missions in the Kharkiv direction near the settlement of Kupyansk. Since 2024, 115 separate mechanized brigades have been performing combat missions in the eastern regions of Ukraine. For the heroism and courage shown in the battles to protect the state sovereignty, independence and territorial integrity of Ukraine, fidelity to the Military Oath, 579 servicemen of the brigade were awarded state awards, among them: the Order of -Bohdan Khmelnytskyi- - 19; Order -For Courage- - 336; medal -For military service to Ukraine- - 106; Medal -For Saved Life- - 2; -Defender of the Fatherland- medal - 113; award of the President of Ukraine -For the Defense of Ukraine- — 3. 115 separate mechanized brigade continues to perform combat tasks in the Donetsk region in the fight against the Russian aggressor.

Title: -Contract 18‒24-: comments of combat brigade recruiters
Description: Recruiters of combat brigades commented to ArmiyaInform about the experimental project of the contract for citizens of Ukraine aged 18 to 25 regarding military service. Head of the recruiting department of the headquarters of the 28th separate mechanized brigade named after the Knights of the Winter Campaign, senior sergeant Denys Shvydky: - I am positive about the project, because it is a transition to contract service. Boys and girls will relieve tension at the front and help those who are fighting from 2022. They will be able to learn from senior fighters. In general, we see only positives in this. We will also be able to show our fellow citizens how much the army has changed since 2022. How much higher quality training has become, how much material support has improved, what are the relations within the military team. I hope that in the future many of those who will sign a one-year contract will decide to continue their military service and choose a military career. Chief of the personnel section of the headquarters of the 13th operational assignment brigade-Charter- of the National Guard of Ukraine, Lt. Col. Pavlo Popadynets: - This is a very necessary initiative, because we have many people from 18 to 24 years old who want to serve and who only lacked a push before that. This boost, with the benefits, benefits and security they will have, is extremely important. Based on this, it can be evaluated positively. Unfortunately, this practice does not apply to everyone. This practice applies exclusively to the Armed Forces of Ukraine, but not to the Defense Forces as a whole. In particular, it is absent in the National Guard of Ukraine. We are also at war, we also perform combat tasks, and we need this category of citizens. Because these are motivated people, they are those who can defend our state. This practice needs to be scaled up and extended to all the Defense Forces of Ukraine, in particular to the combat brigades of the National Guard of Ukraine.

Title: More than 700 representatives of the Criminal Enforcement Service are fighting at the front
Description: Also during the event, the memory of the fallen representatives of the DKVS of Ukraine was honored, who held the line until the last and did not retreat in front of a strong and ruthless enemy. -We honor those who forever became our heavenly guardians. Each hero's story, his fate, is unique. Our job is to preserve these stories. More than 40 of our comrades made their heads, honorably fulfilling their honorable mission as a Soldier and a Citizen,- the Deputy Minister noted. The official noted that the State Criminal Enforcement Service of Ukraine will take responsibility for all those who sacrificed themselves for the sake of the Motherland. And this is the least that can be done for those who defend Ukraine every day. Each family of the fallen defenders whose bravery and sacrifice was honored today in the department, whose history of courage and conscientious service was remembered in general, was given the kind of help they needed. It is very symbolic that the wife of Volodymyr Mirza, the storekeeper of the quartermaster and economic support department of the state institution -Odesa Detention Center-, who died in March 2022 in a fierce battle in the village of Terny in Donetsk region, asked to purchase a named drone for the front-line unit of the DPSU. -Mavik- will bear the name of master sergeant Mirza and will perform combat tasks in the interests of border guards. After all, in recent years a mobilized employee of the pre-trial detention center served in the ranks of the defenders of our borders. The hero's wife, Yana Igorivna, is also an active serviceman of the State Security Service of Ukraine, chief sergeant. She remembers her husband with warmth and gratitude for the years lived in harmony and love. -I asked to buy a Mavik to hand it over to our guys, who fearlessly and bravely fight in the same trenches with the army. This will be the best gift in memory of my husband and his brothers, who gave the most valuable in this war,- said Yana Mirza.

Title: Training of Ukrainian minesweepers - Chernihiv - and - Cherkasy - was shown in Britain
Description: This was reported by Permanent Joint Headquarters (PJHQ), which manages joint and multinational military operations on behalf of the UK Ministry of Defence. -Operating in the waters of Great Britain, the Ukrainian warships -Chernihiv- and -Cherkasy- continue training and practice with the British Royal Navy,- says the message on the social network Kh. It is also noted that additional photos from training on the ships will be published later this week. As reported by ArmyInform, in December 2023 within the framework of the Contact Group on Assistance to Ukraine to support our state at sea and rivers created a Maritime Coalition, which currently includes 18 states. The ship's crews underwent a series of exercises and training with Royal Navy instructors, participated in the multinational exercises Joint Warrior 23-II and Sea Breeze 2023. In July 2024, they took part in the Sea Breeze exercise, which took place off the coast of Glasgow. The coalition takes a comprehensive approach to capability building—not just the supply of ships, helicopters, and other systems, but also the training of their crews and system operators, training of technical personnel, and technical support for operation and deployment.

Title: No one in the world believes the Russian lies about our state and our people — the President
Description: The text of the speech was published on February 24 on the President's website. -No one in the world believes Russian lies about our state and our people. And even those who, unfortunately, became an accomplice of Russia in the war, who lie along with it, all of them understand whom and what they support. They can take various steps, they can earn some money from their relations with Russia now, but they will never gain respect,- Volodymyr Zelenskyi said. He thanked the Ukrainian allies. -And our respect now - to Ukrainian men and women, as well as millions of people around the world - our respect to all of you. And to such leaders and peoples as yours. Which have been with us since the beginning. Which helped save thousands of lives. Which help us protect our skies and maintain our positions at the front. Who are building weapons production together with us to fill both our and their arsenals. Who sheltered Ukrainians when it was so necessary. Who are not silent when the world needs to hear what is happening. And who — we really, really appreciate it — support strong diplomacy for the sake of peace,- noted Volodymyr Zelenskyy. As reported by ArmyInform, the President and the first lady together with foreign leaders honored the memory of the fallen soldiers.

Title: Ukrainian military chaplains completed a leadership course in Great Britain
Description: This is reported by the Eastern Air Command. Training in foggy Albion was a continuation of the professional training of military chaplains. The program provided for the acquisition of competencies in the basics of spiritual leadership, styles and examples of mentoring, the formation of mutual trust, sustainable motivation and the cohesion of combat-ready teams. -These topics are critical to the work of a military chaplain, as they play a key role in maintaining the military's morale, providing spiritual care and becoming role models,- says Chaplain Stanislav Skorokhod. One of the important elements of the leadership course were field trips to the Royal Military Academy in Sandhurst, where British Prime Minister Winston Churchill, Princes William and Harry of Wales once studied leadership. During training on leadership courses, military chaplains had the opportunity to meet with Ukrainian Ambassador to Great Britain Valery Zaluzhny and other high-ranking officials. As reported by ArmyInform, candidates for the positions of military chaplains will now have six months instead of three to conclude a contract for military service from the moment of receiving the mandate.

Title: -You hang in there-: the drones of the Dnipro paratroopers transmit to the occupiers -warm greetings...
Description: The video of combat work was made public on the brigade's page. In the new video, you can see how Ukrainian drones accurately cover enemy positions, turning them into ditches. As reported by ArmyInform, the occupiers made an attempt to storm Ukrainian positions near the settlement of Lozova, which is in the Kupyansky direction. However, thanks to the heroic actions of the soldiers of the 429th separate regiment of unmanned systems -Achilles-, the guardsmen of the First Presidential Brigade of the NSU -Bureviy- and the paratroopers of the 77th separate airmobile brigade, the enemy suffered losses.

Title: -Iron brothers-: how tracked drones help border guards on the front lines
Description: The video of the combat operation of ground drones was published on the DPSU page. Due to their tracked design, ground drones have increased mobility and can overcome difficult terrain. Their capabilities range from demining and evacuating the wounded to delivering ammunition, provisions and other necessary resources to the positions. The use of ground-based drones is an important step in the development of modern military technology. They allow you to minimize the risk to the personnel and increase the effectiveness of combat missions. As reported by ArmyInform, in the Sumy direction, fighters of the -Steel Border- brigade with the help of drones discovered several hideouts of the occupiers.

Title: A guide to the Kyiv region for the occupiers: the ex-deputy from Odesa was informed of suspicion of ...
Description: The Prosecutor General's Office informs about this. According to the investigation, the ex-deputy left for Russia in 2014, where he actively acted against the sovereignty and independence of Ukraine. On February 24, 2022, on the day of the Russian Federation's full-scale invasion of Ukraine, he joined the Russian troops in the temporarily occupied territory of the Kyiv region. The traitor helped the occupiers navigate the localities, spread Kremlin narratives among the civilian population and called on the Ukrainian military to lay down their arms through his Telegram channel. In his posts, he justified the aggression of the Russian Federation, informed about the progress of the occupation and spread disinformation. In addition, the suspect gave an interview to a well-known Russian YouTube blogger, where he openly admitted his cooperation with the occupiers and stated that Ukraine allegedly had no chance of victory. The traitor is currently wanted. He faces punishment in the form of imprisonment for a term of up to fifteen years. As reported by ArmyInform, two women citizens were exposed in carrying out a subversive operation activities against Ukraine. They were informed of the suspicion of treason (Part 2 of Article 111 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine).

Title: More and more women are interested in serving in the army: the Ministry of Defense named the leading...
Description: reported this by the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine. The share of women among Defense Forces candidates who join the army has increased to 21%. The largest number of applications from potential female candidates were recorded in Chernivtsi, Khmelnytskyi and Ternopil regions. Among all applications, the positions of UAV operators, drivers and shooting specialties are in the greatest demand. We remind you that 48 recruiting centers operate in Ukraine, including one online center. Their specialists advise and provide support for potential candidates for the Defense Forces of Ukraine. Recruiting centers, which are mostly located in the premises of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, provide exclusively confidential consultations. On their territory, it is forbidden to hold mobilization events and serve summonses by alert groups. As reported by ArmyInform, the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine constantly monitors the supply of food to the Armed Forces of Ukraine products, fuel and tangible property. If defects are discovered, low-quality products are returned to suppliers, who are obliged to eliminate the defects or replace the goods.

Title: - Cold War: the story of a military medic who saved dozens of lives
Description: The story of the fighter was published on page 58 of the separate motorized infantry brigade named after Hetman Ivan Vyhovsky. Later, Andriy became part of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, and in the summer of 2023 - a serviceman of the 58th separate motorized infantry brigade named after Hetman Ivan Vyhovskyi. He studied in Poland and became a combat medic. In fierce battles, he commanded the detachment, was the chief sergeant of the platoon. One of the most vivid memories for him was the evacuation of a wounded comrade near Prechistivka. -We dragged him 80 meters across open terrain, under heavy fire. I still don't know how we managed to cross that field alive,- the fighter recalls. Andriy not only saved lives physically, but also helped his brothers psychologically. -The main thing is your own example. When you see that a fighter is threatening, you stand next to him and start shooting. He sees what to do and returns to the fight,- says the warrior. Andriy learned to overcome his fear, and at some point he realized that he got rid of it altogether. -I stepped over a fallen FPV drone knowing it could explode at any moment. But I didn't care,- the fighter shares. That is why the commander decided to transfer him to another position. During the three years of the war, he lost many comrades, but he remembers everyone. After the victory, the first thing he will do is visit the graves of his fallen friends. Because the real -Cold- is not about the absence of fear, but about memory and devotion. As reported by ArmyInform, a story appeared on the page of the State Border Service of Ukraine about the first assault of a young border guard with the call sign -Wise-. The boy, who was a cadet last year, now commands a platoon of border guards of the -Steel Border- brigade.

Title: Canada will transfer 25 armored personnel carriers and four flight simulators of F-16 fighters to Uk...
Description: This was announced by Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau at the -Support Ukraine- summit, which is being held in Kyiv on February 24 with the participation of world leaders. The first two such armored vehicles will be delivered in the near future. -And this is in addition to the millions of additional components of ammunition, drones and first aid kits. We are also distributing the first tranche of $5 billion in aid to Ukraine, funded by proceeds from frozen Russian assets, along with a grant to help Ukraine maintain its energy security,- Justin Trudeau said. As ArmiyaInform reported, Sweden provides Ukraine with 100 million euros to strengthen air defense.

Title: An official of the military unit was detained, who collected 1 million hryvnias -tribute- from his s...
Description: The State Bureau of Investigation reported this on February 24. The attacker actually -sold- vacations to military personnel, and then hid their absence from the command. In addition, he demanded money from the military, threatening them with punishment for alleged violations of official discipline. Subordinates who fell on the -hook- of the commander paid him not only money, but also services, bought him household and computer equipment, as well as things for children. According to operational data, in 2023-2024, the official -earned- almost UAH 1 million in this way. Thanks to the cooperation with military personnel, the employees of the SBI exposed the perpetrator. As reported by ArmyInform, law enforcement detained an accomplice in the scheme to extort soldiers who evaded service.

Title: Pretending to be dead, becoming -baseball players - tricks do not help the Russians against drones
Description: The video of combat work was released on February 24 on the battalion channel. -Hiding in the bush? Pretended to be dead? Running away in a car? Uses a machine gun as a bat? So that the occupiers do not invent, to avoid a just punishment, our pilots will equally turn them either into cargo 200 or into bio-fertilizer,- the battalion commented on the video. As reported by ArmyInform, the operators of the Black Raven 93 unmanned systems battalion of the Kholodny Yar mechanized brigade in a few days destroyed two Strela-10 air defense systems one after another.

Title: Thanks to the inspection, 694 tons of food and 55 tons of poor-quality fuel did not reach the front
Description: The Ministry of Defense of Ukraine informed about this on February 24. Since the beginning of the year, the Central Department of Quality Control of the Ministry of Defense has accepted almost 1 million units of goods for a total amount of UAH 2.26 billion. At the same time, almost 46,000 units of products worth UAH 48.4 million, which is 2% of the total volume, were returned to suppliers due to non-compliance. As of today, most of the suppliers have eliminated inconsistencies and defects, and after repeated control, products worth UAH 21.2 million were received, which is more than 43% of the rejected amount. -It is unacceptable that low-quality products, fuel or uniforms get to the front. The lives of our defenders depend on compliance with quality requirements. The quality control system at the Ministry of Defense is designed to quickly identify deficiencies and prevent low-quality goods from entering the army. The military should receive only reliable and high-quality supplies,- emphasized the Deputy Minister of Defense, Brigadier General of Justice Serhii Melnyk. According to the results of laboratory tests, more than 55 tons of substandard diesel fuel worth UAH 2.23 million was not allowed to be supplied to the Armed Forces due to exceeding the permissible water mass fraction. As of mid-February 2025, the supplier has completely replaced substandard fuel. In total, 1,142 samples of fuel and lubricants were taken since the beginning of the year. During the inspection of food products before delivery to military units, more than 4,300 tons of food were examined, of which 694 tons worth UAH 140 million were not allowed to supply the military due to non-compliance with quality requirements. In addition, more than 1,200 tons of products were checked in military units during the inspection. Of them, there are almost 83,000 sets of dry rations. According to the results of the inspection, more than 31 tons of dangerous products worth UAH 3 million were not allowed to be used. As reported by ArmyInform, this week the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine adopted two important resolutions which were developed by the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine.

Title: The deputy from Odesa, who led the Russian convoy in the Kyiv region, was informed of the suspicion
Description: reported this on February 24 Odesa Regional Prosecutor's Office. The man was charged with treason, propaganda of war, justification and recognition of the legitimate armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine, committed with the use of mass media (Part 2 of Article 111, Article 436, Part 3 of Article 436-2 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine). According to the investigation, in 2014 the ex-deputy went to the territory of Russia, where he took active actions to the detriment of the sovereignty and independence of Ukraine. On February 24, 2022, the day of Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine, the suspect joined the Russian army in the temporarily occupied territory of the Kyiv region. He helped the enemy navigate the terrain and spread Kremlin narratives among the civilian population. The ex-deputy actively used his Telegram channel, where he posted messages with open appeals to the Ukrainian military to lay down their arms and not offer resistance. In his posts, he justified the aggression of the Russian Federation, informed about the progress of the occupation and spread misinformation. In addition, the suspect gave an interview to a well-known Russian YouTube blogger, where he openly admitted his cooperation with the occupiers and stated that Ukraine allegedly has no chance of victory. He is currently wanted. As reported by ArmyInform, an FSB agent was detained who, on the order of the Russian Federation, blew up the car of the military prosecutor in Odesa.

Title: - Stopped the crazy dynamics - the occupiers switched to Pokrovsk's logistics
Description: The commander of the 503rd separate battalion of the marines, Lt. Col. Bohdan Przhegalinsky, told about this on the broadcast of the -Edyny Novyny- telethon. According to him, the Defense Forces were able to concentrate, establish cooperation and stop the frenetic dynamics of the enemy in this direction. The enemy began to act in a different way - to launch rocket-bomb attacks on Pokrovsk itself and logistical routes. All in order to deprive the Defense Forces of normal support. -His tactics remain unchanged. These are permanent assault groups of small numbers - from three to four people. They attack our positions non-stop,- Bohdan Przhegalinsky noted. As reported ArmyInform, shelling of front-line settlements continues in the Orihiv direction, no other active enemy actions are observed. However, the enemy is accumulating manpower and trying to pull up heavy equipment.

Title: - Russian rich people - three convicts with millions of debts were captured in Kurshchyna
Description: reported this on February 24 Airborne assault troops of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Prisoners were provided timely medical and psychological assistance. In their units on the territory of the Russian Federation, they were subjected to inhumane treatment, torture and executions for failure to comply with criminal orders. -These people chose life and not death for the illusory fantasies of their dictator. They will be treated well as prisoners of war, will be safe and likely to await exchange. We call on all servicemen of the army of the Russian Federation: surrender,- said the message of the Armed Forces of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation. As reported by ArmyInform, the captured occupier refuses to return to the Russian Federation.

Title: The president and the first lady, together with foreign leaders, honored the memory of the fallen so...
Description: This was reported by the Office of the President. The ceremony was also attended by foreign leaders who arrived in Ukraine on the day of the third anniversary of the full-scale Russian invasion: President of Finland Alexander Stubb, President of Latvia Edgars Rinkevichs, President of Lithuania Gitanas Nausieda, President of the European Council Antoniou Kosta, President of the European Commission Ursula von der Leyen, Prime Minister of Canada Justin Trudeau. The ceremony was also attended by the Prime Minister of Denmark Mette Frederiksen, Prime Minister of Estonia Kristen Michal, Prime Minister of Iceland Kristrun Frostadottir, Prime Minister of Norway Jonas Gar Stere, Prime Minister of Spain Pedro Sanchez, Prime Minister of Sweden Ulf Kristersson, OSCE Secretary General Feridun Sinirlioglu and Minister of European Affairs of France Benjamin Haddad. The Chairman of the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine Ruslan Stefanchuk together with members of the European Parliament and Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal with members of the European Commission also paid their respects to the fallen heroes. Those present honored the memory of Ukrainian men and women who gave their lives for the Motherland with a moment of silence.

Title: Sweden provides Ukraine with 100 million euros to strengthen air defense
Description: This was reported by Swedish Prime Minister Ulf Kristersson, who arrived in Kyiv on the morning of February 24. -I am in Kyiv today. For the past three years, the Ukrainian people have been fighting for freedom and security — theirs and ours. Today we are announcing 100 million euros to support Ukraine's air defense. Strengthening Ukraine's ability to defend itself against Russian aggression also increases our security,- said Kh. The day before, Swedish government officials in the newspaper Svenska Dagbladet informed that the Robot 70 and Tridon Mk2 systems will be handed over to Ukraine. -The Tridon Mk2 can counter Russian mass attacks with simple drones and robots,- the article says. As ArmiyaInform reported, the Council of the European Union adopted today a broad 16th package of economic and individual restrictive measures against Russia.

Title: They are cutting logistics - Teroboron troops destroyed a dozen or so enemy vehicles in Kurshchyna
Description: The video of the combat operation was released on February 24. A total of 8 trucks, 5 cars and 2 loaves were damaged and destroyed. The strikes were carried out by drones provided by one of the volunteer communities. As reported by ArmyInform, fighters of the -Wings to Hell- unit of the 103 territorial defense brigade named Metropolitan Andrey Sheptytsky showed the pursuit of the Russian, who showed miracles of maneuverability.

Title: The enemy's drone net is not a cage - the enemy failed to create a safe -tunnel- to the Time Ravine
Description: About this on the air of the TV channel -Soviet News- told representative of the press service of the 24th separate mechanized brigade named after King Danylo Andriy Polukhin. According to him, clashes are taking place in buildings, more precisely in the ruins of high-rise buildings. The enemy seeps into the remains of buildings, tries to gain a foothold there. -The guys either clear those buildings or work on them with drones and artillery. Channel “Siverskyi Donetsk — Donbas” it is still problematic for them to cross, especially with mechanized equipment. Our guys are watching that area and practicing on the movement,- said Andriy Polukhin. In general, drone operators are constantly searching for targets. They are often found. The occupiers are trying to counter Ukrainian UAVs, but unsuccessfully. -This is evidenced, for example, by the enemy's attempt to close one of the roads to Chasovoy Yar with Bakhmut with a net - it was installed last year. Recently, there were news that it seems to be new, but in fact, it has just been updated. Because it is also affected and does not help them to move,- said the representative of the press service of the 24th separate mechanized brigade named after King Danylo. As reported ArmyInform, fighters of the 414th brigade of unmanned attack systems -Birds of Magyar- were able to find enemy armored vehicles that the occupiers had hidden quite far from the front.

Title: The EU approved the 16th package of sanctions against Russia: -shadow fleet-, banks and trade
Description: This is stated in the message Council of the EU. -The package affects vital sectors of the Russian economy, further weakening the regime's ability to wage an illegal, unprovoked and unjustified war of aggression against Ukraine,- the statement said. Individual lists The Council approved the sanctions list, which includes 48 individuals and 35 organizations responsible for actions that undermine or threaten the territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence of Ukraine. In addition, the Council established two new criteria that will allow the EU to impose restrictive measures on individuals and legal entities that own or operate vessels in Putin's shadow fleet; and those who support or benefit from the Russian military-industrial complex. Shadow fleet One more vessel has been added to the list of vessels that are prohibited from accessing the port and providing a wide range of services related to maritime transport. The measure targets non-EU tankers that are part of Putin's shadow fleet that circumvents the oil price cap mechanism, supports Russia's energy sector, or vessels responsible for transporting military equipment for Russia or stolen Ukrainian grain. In total, 153 vessels are already under sanctions. Finance and Banking For the first time, the EU is introducing a ban on transactions with credit or financial institutions based outside of Russia that use the Central Bank of Russia's Financial Reporting System (SPFS). SPFS is a specialized financial messaging service developed by the Central Bank of the Russian Federation to neutralize the effects of restrictive measures. In addition, the Council of the EU decided to extend the ban on the provision of specialized financial messaging services to 13 regional banks, which are considered important for the Russian financial and banking systems. Trade The EU Council also added 53 new entities to the list of those who directly support Russia's military-industrial complex in its war of aggression against Ukraine. They are subject to stricter export restrictions on dual-use goods and technologies, as well as goods and technologies that can contribute to the technological improvement of Russia's defense and security sector. A third of these organizations are Russian, while others are located in third countries (China, including Hong Kong, India, Kazakhstan, Singapore, Turkey, the United Arab Emirates and Uzbekistan) and have been involved in circumventing trade restrictions or involved in the procurement of goods needed, for example, for UAVs and missiles used for Russian military operations. In addition, today's decision expands the list of prohibited goods that contribute to the technological advancement of Russia's defense and security sector by adding items for the development and production of Russian military systems, such as: chemical precursors for chloropicrin and other anti-riot agents, software related to numerically controlled machines, chromium compounds, and controllers used to control UAVs. In addition, the EU imposed further restrictions on the export of goods that contribute to the increase of Russian industrial potential (chemicals, some plastics and rubber) and their transit through Russia, as well as further restrictions on the import of primary aluminum, which generates significant revenues for Russia. Broadcast ban Today, the Council of the EU decided to suspend the EU broadcasting licenses of eight Russian mass media, which are under the constant control of the Russian leadership, and to ban them from broadcasting their content. These are: EADaily / Eurasia Daily, Fondsk, Lenta, NewsFront, RuBaltic, SouthFront, Strategic Culture Foundation, Krasnaya zvezda/TV Zvezda. These mass media have played an important role in promoting and supporting Russia's aggressive war against Ukraine, as well as in destabilizing neighboring countries, as well as the EU and its member states. Seaports The EU prohibits any transactions with certain listed ports, gateways and airports in Russia that are used to transfer UAVs, missiles and related technology and components to Russia, or to circumvent oil price caps or other restrictive measures by vessels engaged in irregular and high-risk shipping. This includes access to their facilities and the provision of any services to ships and aircraft. Transports In order to ensure the effectiveness of EU restrictive measures aimed at the aviation sector, the Council of the EU decided to extend the ban on flights in the EU to listed air carriers that operate domestic flights within Russia or export aircraft or other aviation goods and technology to Russian air carriers and their controlled entities. In addition, the EU strengthens the current ban on the transportation of goods by road through the territory of the EU, in particular transit, by EU operators that are 25% or more owned by Russian individuals or legal entities. The new provision prohibits any changes in the capital structure of motor vehicle enterprises, which will lead to an increase in the ownership share of a Russian natural or legal entity by more than 25%. Energy The package agreed today imposes additional restrictions on the export of goods and technologies, including software related to oil and gas exploration, with the aim of further limiting Russia's exploration and production capacity. In addition, it extends the ban on the provision of goods, technology and services for the completion of crude oil projects in Russia, such as the Vostok oil project, similar to the completion of LNG projects currently in operation. The Council of the EU also prohibits the temporary storage of Russian crude oil and petroleum products on the territory of the EU, regardless of the purchase price of the oil and the final destination of these products. Other The EU bans the provision of construction services, including engineering, extending an approach already in place in illegally occupied parts of Ukraine. To combat the illegal re-export of EU goods subject to sanctions, EU operators selling sensitive goods to third countries other than partner countries should implement due diligence mechanisms capable of identifying, assessing and mitigating the risks of such re-exports to Russia. The Commission will help business entities to facilitate their compliance with the requirements, in particular with respect to these requirements. Belarus Today's package includes further restrictive measures against Belarus that reflect trade-related sanctions agreed against the Russian Federation, as well as other measures such as restrictions on the sale or provision of services and software, deposits and wallets of cryptocurrency assets, and transportation. In addition, the Council of the EU introduced a new listing criterion aimed at individuals, organizations or bodies that support or benefit from the military-industrial complex of Belarus. Crimea and Sevastopol, as well as some non-government-controlled territories of Ukraine Today, the Council of the EU introduced new restrictions in Crimea and Sevastopol, as well as in non-government-controlled territories of Ukraine in the Donetsk, Kherson, Luhansk, and Zaporizhzhia regions with the aim of preventing their integration into the Russian Federation and preventing the circumvention of EU sanctions. As ArmyInform reported, the Australian government introduced additional targeted financial sanctions and an entry ban for 70 individuals, as well as targeted financial sanctions for 79 legal entities.

Title: We are modernizing military aviation as recommended by the combat pilots - Anatoliy Klochko
Description: The Ministry of Defense of Ukraine informed about this on February 24. This is one of a series of trips planned on behalf of the Minister of Defense Rustem Umyerov in order to get acquainted with the state of affairs directly in the military service areas, its analysis and preparation of decisions to strengthen the military aviation of Ukraine. During the visit, Anatoly Klochko held a meeting with the participation of the acting commander of the Air Force, Lieutenant General Anatoly Kryvonozhka, Air Force Commander Brigadier General Oleh Zakharchuk, brigade command and heads of aircraft factories. The Deputy Minister of Defense noted that Ukraine is currently receiving new aircraft from its partners, but it is also extremely important to modernize the existing aircraft as soon as possible. -Our first aircraft will pass modernization This will make it possible to improve their tactical and technical characteristics, and therefore increase the safety of pilots and the efficiency of their work,- said Anatoly Klochko. This process will be effective only if all involved parties work in a coordinated and proactive manner. To this end, the deputy minister called on the command of aviation brigades performing combat missions to regularly provide information about the needs of their units. The command of the Air Force, specialized units of the Ministry of Defense and aviation enterprises, in turn, must respond promptly to meet these needs as much as possible. The participants discussed the repair schedules of the military aircraft that are in service, plans to modernize the means of navigation, attack, and other systems. They also discussed the development of the airfield infrastructure with an emphasis on means of protection against enemy air attacks. Anatoliy Klochko and Anatoliy Kryvonozhko presented awards to servicemen during the visit Minister of Defense and Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. As reported by ArmyInform, plans for the modernization of aviation equipment were discussed during an on-site meeting by the Deputy Minister of Defense of Ukraine, Brigadier General Anatoly Klochko, and the Commander of the Army Aviation, Colonel Pavlo Bardakov.

Title: A military serviceman-gamer from Sumy lost night vision devices worth 4.5 million hryvnias
Description: This was reported by the State Bureau of Investigation on February 24. Employees of the SBU, in cooperation with the SBU, exposed a serviceman of one of the units stationed in the Sumy region. He appropriated night vision devices and binoculars with a total value of over 4.5 million hryvnias. The figurehead responsible for material support had access to military equipment that was stored in warehouses. At the end of 2024, he received night vision devices and binoculars from the warehouse to ensure the combat readiness of the assault company. However, instead of handing them over to the military, he decided to sell them. The attacker offered his friend to buy two night vision devices and two binoculars for more than 430 thousand. hryvnias for further resale. He sent the equipment by mail, and spent the proceeds on gambling. Thanks to timely operational measures, it was possible to find and return part of the stolen equipment. As reported by ArmyInform, those involved who purchased low-quality first-aid kits for the Armed Forces for almost UAH 60 million, faces up to 10 years in prison.

Title: They scouted the positions of the units of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation - Russian agen...
Description: The Office of the Prosecutor General announced this on February 24. According to the investigation, in September 2024, in the pro-Russian chat of the Telegram messenger, a resident of the Kramatorsk district was approached by an employee of the FSB of the Russian Federation. The woman agreed to pass on information of a military nature and began to help the enemy in conducting military operations in Donetsk region. She emphasized the location of training grounds and equipment of the Defense Forces on the territory of the Kostyantyniv community. At the same time, she was aware that the data she provided would harm the national security of Ukraine. The second suspect is a resident of the village of Bagatyr, Volnova district, who was recruited by a serviceman of the Soviet Union in November of the same year. The agent carried out the instructions of the curator and scouted the places of deployment of the personnel of the Armed Forces in the Volnovasky direction and noted their coordinates in text messages. In addition, the woman helped the enemy to advance on the territory of the Kurakhiv community, looking for places to enter and anchor reconnaissance groups of the Russian army. The illegal activities of the suspects have been stopped. At the request of the prosecutor's office, preventive measures in the form of detention were chosen for them. As reported by ArmyInform, a Russian agent was detained in Kyiv Oblast who leaked data to the FSB about ex-prisoners fighting for Ukraine.

Title: The General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine announced the strikes on two Russian oil companies
Description: This was reported by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The damage was done by units of the Unmanned Systems Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, the Main Directorate of Intelligence, in cooperation with other components of the Defense Forces. At least 5 explosions are known in the vicinity of the target. Previously, there was a fire in the area of ​​the primary oil processing unit of the AT-6 oil refinery. The results of the damage are being clarified. In addition, yesterday units of the Unmanned Systems Forces of the Armed Forces hit an oil depot - a fire was recorded in the area of ​​the FDKU plant -8 Marta- in the Tula region of the Russian Federation. -Combat work on strategic objects involved in the provision of armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine will continue,- the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine emphasized. As reported by ArmyInform, the Ryazan Oil Refinery can process 17.1 million tons of oil per year, which makes it one of the five largest refineries in the Russian Federation. Gasoline, diesel fuel, aviation kerosene, fuel oil and petrochemicals are produced there. A special role is played by aviation fuel, which is critically important for the front-line aviation of the Russian army and strategic long-range aviation that strikes Ukraine

Title: We will win. Because there is no other way - the commander of the Ground Forces
Description: The appeal was published on February 24 on the channel of Mykhailo Drapatyi, who also heads the Khortytsia operational-strategic group of troops. -Today marks three years since the full-scale invasion began. But the great war does not last for three years - for eleven years we defend our sovereign right to be ourselves. Our ground forces are in order. They are becoming more modern, more technological. Today it is a force that has no equal in Europe. We grow, learn, improve. And all this under daily enemy fire,- Mykhailo Drapaty wrote. He admitted that it is difficult now and reminded that it has never been easy - neither in 2014, nor in 2022, nor now. -We knew what we were going for. And we know what we are fighting for. For the right to live in one's country. To be one's own people. On his land. For our children to grow up at home, and not in other people's basements or camps. So that our voice is not drowned out by enemy tanks and guns,- the commander of the Ground Forces remarked. -It's winter now. It is always the most difficult period at the front - cold, tired, damp, dirty. The enemy is trying to add informational noise, sowing despair and internal enmity among us. But we have to stick together. Our soldiers need a strong rear. Not only hot food or warm clothes, but also the understanding that not only the family, but the whole country is waiting for them at home. Every citizen who supports the front holds us all together. Remember this,- urged Mykhailo Drapaty. He said he is proud of each and every one who chooses freedom. -Those who have been fighting since 2014. Those who joined the army in 2022. Those who came in 2024 and already hold positions. Those who provide assistance to the Defense Forces in the rear. You are the heart and shield of our native land. I am proud that I can stand next to you. We go forward together. We will endure. We will win! Glory to Ukraine! Glory to the Ukrainian heroes!- Mykhailo Drapaty wrote. As reported by ArmyInform, Ukraine returned more than 50% of the territory occupied by the Russians after 02/24/22.

Title: - They switch to sadder means of transportation - - in the south, drone attacks - clean the enemy's ...
Description: told about this on the -Suspilne Novosti- broadcast, the head of the communications department of the 118th separate mechanized brigade, Dmytro Pelikh. Apparently, he said, the Orichiv direction is not currently among the enemy's prerogatives. Therefore, there will not be a very large accumulation of equipment here. In addition, drones of the Defense Forces are actively destroying equipment in the rear areas of the enemy. Both near and far - at a depth of 40 kilometers. -This is a very good indicator. Allows you to destroy equipment. The occupiers are afraid to accumulate it, concentrate it in large quantities. Taking into account the intensity of the fighting along the entire frontline, not so much was left of armored vehicles, but even -loaves-. Every month, the occupiers switch to more deplorable means of transportation,- said Dmytro Pelikh. As reported ArmyInform, operators of the Fatum unit of the anti-tank battalion of the 3rd assault brigade carried out targeted damage to Russian equipment.

Title: - Show me closer! - the Russians looked at our mines and exploded
Description: The video of the curious incident was released on February 24. Several Russians noticed our mines in the snow, which were dropped at night from drones. The invaders came closer and began to remove ammunition to warn their own. One of the Russians asked the operator to remove the mine at close range. It is not known whether he did it on purpose, or whether he did not know that the mines have magnetic detonators installed, which can work against an infantryman in a body armor and with ammunition in the unloader. And so it happened, an explosion rang out, the operator was shocked.   As reported by ArmyInform, the operators of the Ivan Franko Group unit were able not only striking a hit on the enemy, but also then finding a Russian video of the consequences of the hit.

Title: Aircraft, ballistics and strike drones: Defense forces shot down 26,525 enemy targets in three years
Description: This was reported by the Armed Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. -For three years, the Air Force has gone through a difficult path. We met the first mass attacks of the enemy with dignity, preserved the combat potential of the Air Force, persevered and forced the Russians to leave the Ukrainian sky!- - says the post on the third anniversary of the large-scale invasion of the Russian Federation. In three years, the Defense Forces of Ukraine destroyed: Over the course of three years, the tactical aviation of the Air Force carried out more than 20,000 sorties: about 10,000 — for fire damage to the enemy, more than 12,000 — for fighter air cover. As reported by ArmyInform, on the night of February 23, the enemy attacked with 267 Shahed-type attack UAVs and simulator drones of various types and from directions This is a record number of UAVs for one attack, starting on February 24, 2022.

Title: Australia announced the largest package of sanctions against the Russian Federation
Description: This is stated in a message on the site of the Australian government. It is Australia's largest sanctions package since February 2022. The new sanctions target individuals who support illegal Russian administrations in eastern Ukraine and temporarily occupied Crimea, including so-called -ministers-, judges and prosecutors, as well as those responsible for the forced deportation of Ukrainian children. The sanctions also target individuals and entities involved in deepening military cooperation between Russia and North Korea, including the deployment of North Korean troops on the battlefield. Companies in the defense, transport and financial sectors of the Russian Federation, as well as those who spread disinformation against Ukraine and its partners, were also sanctioned. New Zealand today also announced sanctions against 52 Russian citizens and entities. The list includes, in particular, the mother of the head of Chechnya, Ayman Kadyrova, who heads the Akhmat Kadyrov Foundation, several pilots of the Russian strategic aviation, the Novatek gas production company, and the Vector military enterprise. Several North Korean military officials associated with the deployment of this country's troops on Russian territory to participate in the invasion of Ukraine were also added to the sanctions list.

Title: I confused a drone with a tank - the Russian tried to hit our bomber with a grenade launcher
Description: The video was published on February 24 on the unit's channel. The occupier aimed at our bomber for a long time, fired but missed. But the resets hit, and the invader was left to die on Ukrainian soil. -It is clear that intelligence for these creatures is just an incomprehensible word,- commented the video in -Sharp Kartuzh-. As reported by ArmyInform, operators of the -Sharp Kartuza- unit of the National Guard filmed from a drone the clearing of a house with Russians by the forces of our attack aircraft.

Title: A moment of silence in Ukraine
Description: -In order to honor the bright memory, civic courage and self-sacrifice, strength of spirit, resilience and heroic deed of the soldiers who fell during the execution of combat missions to protect the state sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine, civilians who died as a result of the armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine, I decree: to start holding a national minute of silence every day at 9:00 a.m. for compatriots who died as a result of the armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine, which should be announced in all mass media, regardless of the form of ownership,- the document says.

Title: The Navy showed how they shot down -Shahedy- over Odeshchyna
Description: The video of the combat work was released on February 24 by the Naval Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. For the most part, -Shakhedi- were shot down by rockets. -Battle for the sky over Odesa - military sailors destroy -Shahedy- On the eve of the third anniversary of the full-scale invasion, the enemy once again terrorized peaceful Ukrainian cities with deadly drones. We will not stop fighting, as we did from the first day of the invasion. Only now we are even stronger and more experienced,- the Navy commented on the video. As reported by ArmyInform, the enemy attacked at night with 185 attack UAVs.

Title: In Zaporozhye, there are 455 shellings per day, there is destruction
Description: This was reported by the head of Zaporizhzhya OVA Ivan Fedorov. The enemy carried out 20 airstrikes on Stepnohirsk, Lukyanivsk, Gulyaipol, Varvarivka, Zeleny. 265 UAVs of various modifications attacked Zaporizhzhia, Kushugum, Kam'ianske, Gulyaipole, Shcherbaki, Novodanilivka, Mala Tokmachka, Charivne, Novodarivka. Three rounds of anti-aircraft fire covered Novodanilivka, Gulyaipole and Novodarivka. 167 artillery shells were fired on the territory of Kamiansky, Gulyaipol, Shcherbaki, Novodanilivka, Malaya Tokmachka, Charivny and Novodarivka. The woman was injured as a result of the Russian shelling of Zaporizhzhia. There were 27 reports of damage to apartments, private houses and cars. As reported by ArmyInform, today in Brovary, fragments of an enemy UAV hit an unfinished multi-storey building, causing a fire on the 23rd floor.

Title: President: Three years of resistance. Three years of gratitude. Three years of absolute heroism of U...
Description: The video was published on the head of state's social networks. The footage shows the first days of the large-scale invasion, the combat operations of the Armed Forces, the consequences of enemy shelling, and the heroic defense of Ukrainian defenders. -Three years of resistance. Three years of gratitude. Three years of absolute heroism of Ukrainians. I am proud of Ukraine! Thanks to everyone who protects her and helps. To everyone who works for Ukraine. And eternal memory to everyone who gave his life for the sake of our country and people,- says the caption to the video. As reported by ArmyInform, the Minister of Defense of Ukraine Rustem Umyerov in his address stated that in the past three years Ukraine not only stood up against the Russian aggressor, but also strengthened.

Title: Over the past day, the enemy has attacked almost a hundred times — the General Staff of the Armed Fo...
Description: Operational information as of 08:00 on February 24 was published by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The aggressor carried out airstrikes, in particular in the areas of the settlements of Glukhiv, Vovchansk, Slovyansk, Rai-Olexandrivka, Komar, Oleksiivka, Zvirovka, Lysivka, Myrnograd, Myrolyubivka, Zelene Pole, Gulyaipole, Kamianske, Novoyakovlivka. Over the past day, missile troops and artillery of the Defense Forces hit three areas of concentration of personnel, weapons and military equipment, five control points and one control point of enemy UAVs. In the Kharkiv direction, the enemy twice tried to break through the defensive lines of our defenders in the direction of Vovchansk and Zapadny. Four attacks by invaders took place in the Kupyansk direction yesterday. Our defenders repelled enemy assaults in Petropavlivka, Zagryzovo and in the direction of Bohuslavka. The enemy attacked 15 times in the Lyman direction. He tried to penetrate our defense near the settlements of Torske, Novoehorivka, Novolyubivka, Yampolivka, Kuzmyne and in the direction of Novy, Novoplatonivka, Shyykivka, Zelena Dolyna, Cherneshchyna. The defense forces repelled two offensive actions of the invaders in the districts of Bilogorivka and Ivano-Daryivka in the Siverskyi direction. In the Kramatorsk direction, two clashes have currently been recorded near Chasovoy Yar and in the Oleksandro-Shultyny direction. In the Toretsk direction, the enemy launched nine attacks in the Toretsk and Krymsky districts. In the Pokrovsky direction, our defenders stopped 22 assault actions of the aggressor towards the settlements of Promin, Kotlyne, Andriyivka, Bogdanivka, Ulakly, Novosergiivka, Molodetske, Leontovychi, Pokrovsk, Myrolyubivka and Vodiane Druge. In the direction of Novopavlivsk yesterday, the enemy carried out 11 attacks in the direction of Konstantinopol and Burlatskyi. In the Orihiv direction, the occupation troops once stormed the positions of the Defense Forces in the area of ​​the settlement of Stepove. The enemy did not conduct active operations in the Gulyaipil and Prydniprovsky directions of the past day. No signs of the formation of enemy offensive groups were detected in the Volyn and Poliske directions. Defense forces of Ukraine continue the operation in the Kursk region. Last day, the enemy carried out 22 airstrikes, dropping 45 anti-aircraft missiles, and fired 374 shots, seven of which were from anti-aircraft guns. Ukrainian defenders repelled 19 assaults by invaders. Our soldiers inflict significant losses in manpower and equipment on the occupying forces and actively undermine the offensive potential of the enemy in the rear. In general, the Russian invaders lost 1,050 people last day. Also, Ukrainian soldiers destroyed 9 tanks, 6 armored combat vehicles, 44 artillery systems, 3 rocket salvo systems, 217 UAVs of operational-tactical level and 110 cars of the occupiers. As reported by ArmyInform, during the 3 years of the war, the Russians lost more than 868 thousand soldiers.

(SOLAS) by disabling automatic identification systems. As reported by ArmyInform, fighters of the 426th battalion of unmanned systems were able to find and hit an enemy 2S4 -Tulip- 240-mm mortar.

Title: The Ryazan Refinery, one of the largest in the aggressor country, was attacked
Description: Lieutenant Andriy Kovalenko, head of the Center for Countering Disinformation of the NSDC, reported on February 24 about the strike. -Gasoline, diesel fuel, aviation kerosene, fuel oil and petrochemicals are produced there. A special role is played by aviation fuel, which is critically important for the front-line aviation of the Russian army and strategic long-range aviation that strikes Ukraine,- wrote Andriy Kovalenko. On the network videos of fires on the territory of the plant are being distributed. The local authorities, as always, assure that all the drones were shot down and the fire was caused by falling debris. As reported by ArmyInform, drones attacked an oil refinery a thousand kilometers from Ukraine at night.

Title: Air Force of the Ukrainian Armed Forces: the enemy attacked at night with 185 attack UAVs
Description: This was reported by the Air Force of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. As of 08:00, the shooting down of 113 Shahed-type attack UAVs and drones of other types in the Kharkiv, Poltava, Sumy, Kyiv, Chernihiv, Cherkasy, Kirovohrad, Khmelnytskyi, Mykolaiv, Odesa, Kherson and Dnipropetrovsk regions has been confirmed. 71 enemy impersonator drones - lost to location (no ill effects). As a result of the enemy attack, Dnipropetrovsk region, Odesa region, Kyiv region and Khmelnytskyi region were affected. The air attack was repulsed by aviation, anti-aircraft missile forces, electronic warfare units and mobile fire groups of the Air Force and the Defense Forces of Ukraine. As reported by ArmyInform, on the night of February 23, the enemy attacked with 267 Shahed-type attack UAVs and simulator drones of various types. directions This is the record number of UAVs in one attack since February 24, 2022.

Title: Rustem Umerov: Russia planned to break us in 72 hours, but today it is she who has catastrophic loss...
Description: This is stated in the minister's address to the anniversary of the large-scale Russian invasion. -Eleven years of war. Three years of large-scale war. Each of us remembers February 24, 2022. Ukraine did not just survive, but got stronger. russia planned to hack us in 72 hours. But today it is she who is suffering catastrophic losses,- said Rustem Umyerov. The minister emphasized that Ukrainian soldiers are fighting for every meter of their native land. Thousands of volunteers joined the ranks of the Defense Forces. The whole country is working for Victory - rescuers, energy workers, volunteers, entrepreneurs, scientists, doctors, workers, educators. Together we showed our power to the whole world. -Today, Ukraine is an army that is quickly mastering the most modern equipment. The F-16 and Mirage already protect our skies. Leopard, AMX-10, Caesar work on the front lines. Domestic robotic units are changing the face of war,- added Rustem Umyerov. He emphasized that today Ukraine is a defense industry that has become a strategic player. In three years, Ukraine increased the production of weapons to the potential of $35 billion. -This year we will release millions of drones. Joint ventures with leading global companies are already being established in Ukraine,- – said the minister. Rustem Umyerov emphasized that today Ukraine is a strong shield of Europe that has stopped the enemy that threatens the entire democratic world. Our experience in modern warfare is invaluable to NATO, and our defense industry is a reliable partner for the Alliance. -But the struggle continues. Decisive action by our allies is needed to win. Only together will we be able to restore the borders, free the prisoners, make Russia pay for what it has done,- he stressed. The Minister of Defense noted that support to Ukraine should continue until the last occupier leaves our land. -Ukraine will continue to strengthen its army and defense industry. Our victory is the safety of the entire free world. Thanks to our soldiers. Thanks to everyone who brings our victory closer. Thank you to all the countries that stand side by side with us. Glory to Ukraine!-, says the appeal.

Title: In the Kyiv region, an enemy UAV hit a high-rise building: the consequences of the Russian attack

The security guard of the residential complex is a man born in 1974. — suffered an acute reaction to stress, doctors provided him with the necessary assistance. This is the record number of UAVs in one attack since February 24, 2022.

Title: More than 50% of the territory occupied by the Russians after 02.24.22 was returned — Commander-in-C...
Description: The Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces wrote about this on his page. -Today, February 24, marks three years since the beginning of the large-scale invasion of the Russian Federation on the territory of Ukraine. This was a new stage of the war for Independence, which Russia unleashed against our country in these same February days 11 years ago,- noted Oleksandr Syrskyi. He reminded that the world did not believe that we would stand, but the Ukrainian people decently resisted the enemy's blows. -We defeated the Russian offensive group, pushed back the invaders from Kyiv, liberated the north of Ukraine, Kharkiv Oblast and Kherson. The Defense Forces of Ukraine returned more than 50% of the territory occupied by the Russians after February 24, 2022, conducted a number of effective defensive and offensive operations.- According to the Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces, our ability to act asymmetrically is one of the defining features of this war. The Kursk operation is a confirmation of that. She prevented an enemy attack on Sumy region and Kharkiv region. -For the first time in 11 years, we have moved large-scale military operations to enemy territory and continue to hold hundreds of square kilometers of Kurshchyna,- Oleksandr Syrskyi recalled. Advancement in the east comes at a high cost to the occupiers. Over the course of three years, the enemy lost almost 870,000 soldiers and officers (of which 250,000 were irreversible Russian losses), more than 10,100 tanks, 21.1 thousand armored fighting vehicles, 23.3 thousand art system And this list of enemy casualties can be continued. -We also hit the enemy deep into his territory with Deep Strike means. We are systematically destroying weapons depots, airfields, military and fuel enterprises in the Russian Federation, depriving the aggressor of resources to continue the war. How to evaluate our results? Compare them with the enemy's plans. Kyiv, which the Russians sought to conquer -in three days-, is still standing three years later. In 2022, the aggressor wanted to cut us off from the sea, was preparing an amphibious landing near Odessa. And today, the Black Sea Fleet of the Russian Federation actually ceased to exist - we drove its remains into the bays of Novorossiysk. With the support of Western partners and our own efforts, we are strengthening our defense capabilities, while continuing the defense operation, we are reorganizing the Armed Forces to increase their effectiveness. Ukrainian engineers and IT specialists wrote a new page in the history of military art. This war was the first where drones played a key role, and we were the first in the world to create an Unmanned Systems Force. With their skills and resilience, our soldiers hold back the enemy, who exceeds us in numbers and resources. I am proud of everyone who defends our country! I am honored to be the Commander-in-Chief of such soldiers at such a time. My sincere thanks to the citizens of Ukraine who support the Defense Forces by donation or volunteering. Together with you, we are proving to the whole world what Ukrainian unity is. And the fact that the main ally of the Ukrainian people is its Armed Forces. I sincerely thank our partners and allies who support the struggle of the Armed Forces of Ukraine for independence in the eastern outpost of the free world. On this day, I want to remember all those who gave their lives for the freedom of Ukraine. Eternal memory and glory to them! A low bow to every Ukrainian family that lost a son or father, daughter or mother, brother or sister in the war with the Russian invaders. We will avenge them. The Ukrainian people survived two world wars, collectivization, the Holodomor, occupations and repressions only during the 20th century... But the Ukrainians persevered and created an independent state. We are hardened, strong, united. Let's resist now. Glory to Ukraine! Glory to the heroes!- Oleksandr Syrskyi wrote. As reported by ArmyInform, during the 3 years of the war Russians lost more than 868 thousand soldiers.

Title: More than half of the attacks by the enemy — the General Staff of the Armed Forces — fell on the Pok...
Description: Operational information as of 22.00 on February 23 was made public by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The Russian invaders carried out 38 airstrikes, using 57 anti-aircraft missiles. In addition, the Russians used 928 kamikaze drones to destroy them and fired more than 4,000 shots at the positions of our troops and populated areas. In the Kharkiv direction, the enemy, supported by aviation, attacked twice in the direction of Vovchansk and Zapadny, one battle is still ongoing. In the Kupyansk direction, the enemy carried out three assaults on the positions of our defenders in the Zagryzovo area and in the direction of Bohuslavka. Ukrainian defenders repelled one attack, two more clashes are still ongoing. Since the beginning of the day, Russian invaders have attacked Ukrainian positions 12 times in the Lymansky direction near the settlements of Novoyehorivka, Novolyubivka, Yampolivka, Kuzmyne, and in the direction of Novy, Shiykivka, Novoplatonivka, Zelena Dolyna, and Cherneshchyna. One battle is currently underway. Sloviansk was hit by an airstrike. The defense forces repel one offensive action of the invaders in the area of ​​Belogorivka in the Siverskyi direction. In the Kramatorsk direction, two skirmishes have been recorded near Chasovoy Yar and in the direction of Oleksandr-Shultyny; one attack was repulsed by Ukrainian soldiers. Rai-Olexandrivka was hit by an airstrike. In the Toretsk direction, the Russians attacked the positions of the Defense Forces eight times. The occupiers concentrated their main offensive efforts near the settlements of Toretsk and Krymske, four attacks are still ongoing. Since the beginning of this day, in the Pokrovsky direction, the Russians have tried 22 times to break through our defenses near the settlements of Promin, Kotlyne, Andriivka, Bogdanivka, Ulakly, Novosergiivka, Molodetske, Leontovichi, Pokrovsk, Myrolyubivka and Vodiane Druge, two skirmishes are ongoing.
